Wow. Again, Wow. I had heard about Federal, but kept forgetting to go (there soo many good restaurants in the area). I decided to get some takeout after a hard day at work. We started with an order of the marinated Castelvetrano Olives ($4) that were mind numbing! We also got the house chopped salad that came with prosciutto, cappicola, provolone, peppers onions and a great vinaigrette ($10) and one of the best salads I've ever had! We also got the meatball pizza ($14) that was just amazing. I couldn't believe how perfect the crust was, and this was TAKEOUT! I can only imagine how good it is in house and super fresh. All in all, our bill was a measly $29 and worth EVERY STINKIN CENT!!! I'm super happy to have another great restaurant in the area!

We've never eaten inside the restaurant, but we have regularly been driving home from work and said to one another "I could really do pizza tonight"  30 seconds later he's got his phone out and we're ordering our regular: big star pizza and tlc salad.  That's really all we get and everytime it's amazing.  With the restaurant being an old bank building, I love that they've maintained the drive thru lane and we can just drive up to pay and receive our order.  It's ridiculously convenient.  We've eaten a lot of pizzas in the valley, this is by far our favorite and now we can't eat any others without a) feeling ill or b) comparing it.  Nothing is as good.   Try it, you shouldn't be disappointed.
Place was pack! Had enough beers to chose from. Pizza was good! Brussel sprouts is recommended.

The pizza at Federal is very good. Everything else is so over-priced that we almost never go. We live about a half mile away and have been maybe three times. Last night we decided to try again. The Margherita Pizza was delicious. We also got two Great Little Salads (operative word is little) and Lamb Bolognese. The total takeout bill was $42. The salads are a complete ripoff. They were $5 each and tiny. TINY. The pasta dish was about the size of a salad plate and was $16.  We probably won't go for anything except for the occasional pizza. It's not worth the cost.

Great pizza!  One of the best, in fact.    Customer service was pretty decent... But I think it might be hit or miss, at least as we experienced.  Two of our servers were phenomenal, one was just ok.  It all comes down to customer service, doesn't it.  I would definitely recommend Federal Pizza.

LOVE! Great service, great drinks, great food.   We went in for lunch and got their special that included half salad and a half pizza for $10.50. It was a great way to check out a pizza without committing to a big pizza.   Also! Happy hour until 5, you have to get the Blood Orange wine cooler for $5.

Everything was delightful and delicious.  Casanova pizza, chopped salad...oh my. Uber relaxed and amazingly wonderful.  Megan suggestions for us newbies was a welcomed wonder. We are already planning our next visit.

I really just love this place...for take out.  We've dined in a few times, but the wait is usually very long (duh...because word is out that it is fantastic) so now we take out 90% of the time.  Our favorite collectively, is the Big Star pizza, my husbands favorite is the Pepperoni and mine is the At Last.  The flavor combination on At Last as a meatless pizza (and I'm a meat eater!) is so well thought out.  I feel like I'm a judge sampling a pizza on a cooking show or something.  Seriously.....try it.  And tonight, we got (our first here) dessert, the Lil Triple.  It was really good. The chocolate cream is more like just chocolate pudding.  But it was cute anyway. And the staff who takes and hands off our take out order are just the nicest and most attentive. We had Josh take care of our take out order tonight, and he was great. Just go...it's worth a bit of a wait.  Bring friends, have some drinks at the bar, the beer selection is great too! Brava!

I will be honest, the first time I came I wasn't that impressed. Impurities in the beer, mediocre pizza ... Everyone has a bad night so I came back for more. This time around we got the pizzas we should have ordered the first time (second guessing screwed us over). I forget the names but one had meatballs and the other had peppers and some spice. VERY good. Pitchers of beer are very reasonable. The homemade wine coolers were especially good (grapefruit ginger).  We'll definitely be back for more. My only disappointment was the lack of use of the TVs. Football was on and the TVs were off. Forcing us to be social?? Bah-humbug.
Good pizza and the place is awesome, there apps are where it's at, pizza was thin crust, tasted good but the fries were bomb!!
Yum! Great ingredients! Love a good pepperoni pizza with a glass of sauvignon blanc and pino for my love. We go a few times a month! Great service and kiick back atmosphere. Decent enough music too!
Who has the aux cord because someone has been playing a lot of bloc party, grizzly bear, modest mouse and some other bangerz. Oh yeah the the pizza is bomb AF

We've been going to Federal since it opened. Love all the salads, the cobbler is great but have the ice cream on the side as it turns to cream immediately due to the cobbler temp. We usually have the 4 Kings pizza- consistently good. Give it a try, you'll like it...
My favorite pizza in the world is.... the Casanova. Always get great service here as well.

We have found our pizza spot.   Love all of the food. The salads and pizzas are great whether you go with a more traditional style or their funkier styles.   Try the sweet potato pizza and add sausage it sounds crazy but tastes like thanksgiving dinner.   They also have a drive through window which makes take out orders very easy.

This place is amazing! I live in SD, CA! And the times I have come here I have loved it!!! The food and service are amazing!!! Nicole was our server and she was amazing! If she isn't in management, SHE NEEDS TO BE!!!!

I have heard about this place for a while and it comes up all the time (on yelp) when I visit my friend in downtown Phoenix.  I have wanted to try this place, but I never wins over all the other places to eat.  Well that changed this time.  My friend wanted to meet for lunch here and I have to say I was impressed, though it has a hipster vibe.    Lets start off by talking about the parking.  It shares a parking lot with Joy Ride Tacos; so if you don't get there early enough, you will be doing the "complimentary" valet parking.  But I don't grade on parking, so on to the food...  We ordered two appetizers.  When looking at the menu, we ordered the first one, called the three meatballs and the last one, I dont know that one's name.  The last one is five - six pieces of oven toasted bread and this "ice cream" sized scoop of some kind of cheese.  Make sure to use both the mint leaves and the cheese when you eat the bread. That will a huge difference.  Next we got the three meatballs.  The meatballs themselves are not anything special. But it comes with two fried pieces of polenta and toghter.  That becomes a very "tasty meatball."  On to the entrees.  We got two pizzas a sweet potato one and the big star.  The big star was very yummy. It has sausage, green and balck olives, bell peppers. On top of their pizza sauce.  This would have been enough and is was very yummy.  But my friend had to have his sweet potato pizza.  I was pretty concerned with this idea.  But I have an open mind so I tried it.  Best decision today.  It has slices of sweet potato and little bits of cheese (like goat cheese or something). The sweet potato add just enough sweetness and the cheese does not over power the delicious flavors of the pizza dough and sweet potato.  I recommend this pizza, as long as you like sweet potatoes.  Finally dessert. It was my friends birthday so he had a email offering him a free dessert.  We got the "bubbles;" which was basically doughnut holes with a chocolate dip.  Again this was also delicious.  The server suggested some kind of Oreo dessart, I'll have to try that next time.   If you don't mind paying a little bit more for pizza, I highly recommend Federal Pizza.  But if you do mind spending a little extra for pizza, I feel sorry for you.  There are so many tasy pizza places that end up on the pricier side.

Awesome place!! The only thing I haven't fallen in love with is the veggie lasagna- thinner slices of eggplant and more cheese would make it perfection. Otherwise, Federal knows what's up. Easy to-go window and delicious pizzas!! Try the meatball and polenta appetizer!!! So gooood.

I recently went here with some friends, and the service was amazing. The staff was fun and hip, and eager to check in on us at every moment ( not in the way that annoys you because it becomes far too redundant ) but merely in a manner that makes you feel like your needs are always met, we went during happy hour, the special is great and the beer and pizza deals are amazing, we will definitely had this place to our go to spots

This place has good food, but when I got a to go order on new years eve the girl who rang up our bill was rude. She acted like we were bothering her. The guy who welcomed us in and brought us our order was nice. If I have a couple more experiences with rude employees then I would consider not returning. Mickey white and garganelli pastas are delicious. Pineapple Express and big star pizzas are great. To federal pizza please make sure your employees are welcoming and nice. No reason have rude people working for you.

We love Federal Pizza as well as all of the other Upward Projects restaurants. We have been coming to them since we moved three years ago and have never had a bad experience. We tried the wedge salad tonight.... delicious and the manifesto pizza. That is our go to favorite. I also love the $5 before 5 pm wine coolers. I am sure they are all good but the blueberry hibiscus is delicious. I have never tried another one. I love sitting on the dog friendly patio and seeing the dogs. The service tonight was excellent.

I believe that a great experience is often times the occurrence of  many chance happenings. Federal Pizza is what I like to call urban hipster style! Everyone I seen was attractive lol looked like an urban outfitters catalog I loved it.   The staff was pleasant mostly women, very knowledgable funny & have up great recommendations. I ate during happy hour & the beer/wine is only $5 dollars everyday! & served in ridiculous sized mugs. It was grand. The pizza was good too similar to that of LGO but slightly better. Let's not forget the atmosphere; valet parking amazing pandora or spotify radio stations. I heard my jams throughout my meal. A well spent afternoon.

One of the best dinning and takeout options in uptown. Federal Pizza has a beautiful interior and patio. Unsurprisingly the menu is mostly pizza but they also offer some variety in the form of pastas, sandwiches and salads. Dining in is a great experience and the take out is quick and just as delicious. I prefer dining in because they have a great happy hour special.   The Big Star pizza is a must try for anyone who looking for something completely unique. It is my favorite menu item complete with all the veggies and meats one could ask for. Perfection! I have also had the Manifesto and Casanova. Both of which were also very good. As far as appetizers the green olives and the avocado are also great choices.

Staff - awesome, attentive, and unselfish. I was greeted before I could fully cross the threshold and had random folks refill my water and ask if I needed anything. Matt, by bartender, upgraded my pint to a pitcher (same price in HH) but served in my pint glass two perfect Porters  Pizza was awesome! Even passed the leftover for breakfast test next morning.

I had to try this place as I frequent the other upward project restaurants. I stopped here for lunch with a girlfriend.The place is right next to postino central. Very cute decor inside, modern, trendy, but yet casual. They have the same happy hour drink specials as postino with $5 pitchers, glasses of wine, but also offered homemade wine coolers that looked quite interesting and will definitely try next time. They offer very unique pizza combinations from broccolini with goat cheese and roasted corn to Brussels sprouts and sweet potatoes. (Range from $11-14) We opted for their lunch special which was a great deal. It comes with a half size pizza (full size is good for one person) and also half a salad of your choice. I went for the big star (schreiners sausage, peppers, mushrooms, pepperoni, and their cheese blend) very tasty! And half the TLC salad (pear,apple, pecorino, citrus shallot vinegarette) awesome once again. All that for $9.99 was well worth it!  We still had room for dessert and tried the bombellinis (fried sugar doughnuts with chocolate dipping sauce) soooo perfect!!! Don't pass those up! Service was great. Although it was pretty empty anyway. The server was extremely helpful, kind, and upbeat :) hopefully it's the same when it's more busy.  Will definitely be back again probably during happy hour to try those wine coolers, more pizza, and those bombellinis!  Make me the happiest girl and bring this one to Gilbert too, Upward Projects!!!!!! :)

Absolutely LOVE this restaurant! EVERYTHING I've had is so delicous, from the pizza to the salads and the world's greatest fingerlings! The sauce to dip the fingerlings is unlike any dipping sauce you'll ever have. I come to this restaurant sometimes simply because I am craving the fingerlings. I am not a big pizza person and yet I love this place. I feel that says A LOT about the restaurant!

Been wanting to try this new pizza place.  Finally got in last night and boy was it a surprise. The pizza was g-r-e-a-t !!  I mean really great!!  We ordered two large, one pepperoni and one meatball.  The meatball was especially good !!  The size was smaller than expected but no matter.  The flavor made up for it and besides we ended up taking some home anyway. So I guess the size was perfect.  The place itself was very nice.  Trendy, music playing- loud. So if it's quiet ambiance you're after, this is not the place.  We had to lean forward and repeat several times to have conversation with each other.   It is definitely a trendy loud hip place I guess you'd call it.  The people were exceptionally nice.  It felt as if we had been there before by the way they interacted with us, which was welcoming.  The one girl in particular who told  us she was new brought our pizza and asked if we wanted fresh mozzarella on top.  We said yes, she came with the mozzarella and started shaving some on top.  Then about 1/3 of the block broke off and fell on top of one of the pizzas.  We laughed because it was unexpected and she was so adorable about it and kept doing her thing.  Sweet!  She was so cute I liked her a lot and SHE IS THE REASON I'd go back notwithstanding the great pizza itself.  So I hope she got a large portion of the very nice tip we left.  I don't remember her name, but I'll remember next time.  I would go back and would recommend any pizza lover to go here, it's great!  I gave 4 stars just because of the loudness.  They could stand to turn down the volume a little, not a lot, just a little.

My new favorite pizza place, for sure!  The pizza comes close to Pizzeria Bianco (not quite, but close).  I've tried a few different vegetarian pizzas and have never been disappointed.  The house salad is delicious -- simple with a tasty dressing.  They have yummy appetizers -- corn coins and olives are my favorite.   It's fun to sit at the pizza bar and watch the folks cook too.  They have a decent booze selection as well.
Cool Place, Great Staff, and AWESOME Music....The Sweet Potato pizza is the business!!! Just try it! The wine coolers are great as well. Can't wait to go back and eat there again

This is a great pizza place.  There was no wait, even with 7 of us, which is awesome since they weren't taking reservations when I called.  They have great happy hour specials ($5 pitchers!) but unfortunately that only goes until 5 PM.  Prices overall are very good for what you get.  The food is excellent.  Everyone was happy with their pizzas, and we had enough leftovers to have lunch for the next day.  I would definitely recommend this for the next time you're in the area and in the mood for pizza.  Enjoy!

I really like this place. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing with soft lighting and tastefully chosen furniture and art. Great rotating craft beer selection on draft. The pizzas are somewhat pricy but yummy and perfect for two people to share. Great salads also. Service has always been friendly and efficient.

From the moment you walk in to the moment you finish your last delicious bite, Federal Pizza is a fun and awesome place to be.  The introductions are hilarious, the waitstaff balances courteous service with hilarious interjections, and the food is delicious.  I like the variety of pizzas, and the environment is friendly and clean.  Really under-emphasized when reading lists of places to eat on Central. Take some friends and check it out!  If you park in the back, you'll be next to the bakery and can get a cookie on your way out.

As a family, we consider ourselves to be pizza snobs. My husband was raised on Pizzeria Bianco so he is not willing to ever waste his time on bad pizza. For some reason, we had always steered away from trying Federal. Maybe it was because it's the same owners of Postino and they do bruschetta so well we thought there was no way they could do pizza well? I'm honestly not sure, but 2 weekends ago we decided we wanted to go somewhere new for date night and landed on Federal. We were NOT disappointed!  I had the pizza (can't remember the name) that comes with arugula, ricotta cheese, figs, and proscuitto and it might be my new favorite meal. My husband had another pizza that was equally as good (I can't remember what he had because I was way too interested in my own food) and a coffee beer that he said was the best coffee beer he had ever had. Our service was great, the food was bomb, and we loved it so much we decided to come back last weekend with my sister in law!  My sis in law happens to be gluten free and it can be challenging for her to find good pizza, but apparently this place hit the spot. She said that their GF dough was as good as the real thing, which is saying a lot if you know anyone who is GF.

I really don't see what the excitement is all about. I have now given them two chances and was not impressed either time. The service has always been great, as well as the atmosphere, but I am not impressed with the food. My first time I ordered the chef's special pizza so I took that into consideration since it was a little more quirky than I prefer but this last time I went basic and was still not impressed. The pepperoni was WAY too salty and completely ruined my pizza. And this is coming from someone who puts salt on everything. Also, the crust is completely flavorless, I think actual air might taste better. Add the veggies and polenta sticks to your Salty McSalty meal and an IV might be required in order to restore your hydration.   Sorry Federal, I really want to love you and your 'walking distance from my home' but we are certainly not friends yet. I have heard the sausage pizza is really good so maybe I will give it another shot but I am pretty sure the crust isn't changing :(

Oh. My. Lanta. I loved the food. We had the burrata, tlc salad and Casanova pizza. The burrata with the slightly charred bread. Oh so good. Lovely lovely salad with beets, nuts and pears. And my fave was the pizza. Mmmmm. Arugula, dates, proscuitto and ricotta. Reminded me of one of my favorite Spanish tapas - dates stuffed with cheese and wrapped in bacon. I heart you, Federal Pizza.

One of my favorite restaurants! They have salad, pasta and pizza and all are delicious! Service is always outstanding and staff are friendly. The atmosphere is great too! Highly recommend this restaurant! And don't leave without trying the Bombolini! It's to die for! They serve beer, wine and wine coolers (no other alcohol).

So I stopped in late on Thursday, with an out of town work buddy, because it had been a really rough week.  We sat outside (heavenly!) and drank wine and had some apps.  The Burrata and Olive appetizers were both heavenly.  We also ordered the Casanova and splurged on the fruit crisp...thanks for helping up both regain the will to live, Federal!

Other than the fact that it gets so loud that its hard to have a conversation, I really like this place. The pizza is delicious, service was good, and the atmosphere is fun. Who would ever thought to put brussel sprouts on a pizza? Definitely a place to hit up in the Central Corridor.
Sat at the bar with my gf and we enjoyed everything that we ate. The service at the bar was attentive and friendly, the pizza was great as well as the ambience. Will defiently be back.
We love going to this spot. Smokin deal mid week on wine and pizza. Super cool ambiance - service is great, so is food

I'm giving this place 4 stars for their food. Their pizza was wonderful. However, the service there was horrible. My waiter pretty much forgot about me, hardly ever checked on my table and never refilled my drinks. I'd rather have an over caring waiter or waitress attend to me than one who doesn't care at all. Over all the atmosphere of this place was good. If you like good pizza and don't mind crappy service, then I'd try this place.

I can't believe this place is in business. Absolutely the most disgusting "pizza" ever made. I had a $50 gift card so I thought I would give it a try. Glad I didn't spend my money on it. BTW there is still $22 left on the gift card and I will never use it.
By far my favorite pizza joint!  Great location, great casual atmosphere, drinks, and fabulous pizza.  A bit pricier than your average pizza place, but totally worth it!

Tonight (Friday) was our first time to try Federal Pizza. After reading the rave reviews on here, we were excited! That excitement dwindled the minute we were put on a wait.   We sat outside to wait and all of a sudden a brunette bar tender comes storming out of the restaurant with the manager, cussing up a storm. She complained about Chris (I guess another bar tender) for a good 10 minutes - about how he would cuss her out in front of guests, how she was going to leave immediately if the manager didn't send Chris home and more ranting.   After that episode we were seated inside and literally waited TWELVE minutes before we were greeted. Yes it was a Friday night, but they were half full at the time. Being a waitress myself, I was appalled no one had even stopped by.  We ordered the chop salad which is incredibly small for $10.   Honestly - the wait staff really didn't have it together. They seemed completely unorganized. A waitress came up and asked if we wanted to look at a dessert menu and we didn't even have our pizza on the table! Seriously?   The pizza was good - small, but had a nice flavor.   Overall, the service was terrible. Since my husband and I frequent Postino's quite often, I expected much better service. Bartenders - get your shit together.

Probably my favorite pizza place in the Valley, great service and great food! I've been here multiple times with different sized groups and never been disappointed.  The cassanova pizza here is the best, I would recommend it to anyone!

This might be my favorite restaurant in Phoenix right now. My boyfriend and I have had multiple wonderful experiences here. The food is always SO good - mussels are a must have. I love the vibe, and I like the staff's attitude: casual, friendly and often a bit playful. I regularly spend more here than at any other restaurant. My only gripe, and it's a small one, is wtf is that wall of apostrophes? It's so random and unattractive hahah

Absolutely love this place. Always delivers every time we go.  We only go on Mon. and Tues. evenings after 8p to take advantage of their epic pizza + beer/wine deal. Solid pizza and a pitcher of good beer? Hell yes!  Pizza is good. Crust is a bit soggy from time to time, but not chewy. They do have some repugnant, overly hip pizzas on the menu, but the meatball and peppers is our go to.   Service is always good, sometimes great. On point staff. Love the restaurant inside and out. Very low key and comfortable.   The mastermind for all 5 of the spots in this area really has it dialed in. Definitely one of my favorite places to eat and drink in town.

New favorite happy hour spot! We had wine (Sean Minor Pinot Noir... wonderful stuff...) & pitcher of beer for 5 each. We tried the little gem caesar, federal chop salad and side of beets. Federal chop was the favorite, we had the big star pizza and I loved the olives (really great flavor deep emerald green olives). Crust was good, maybe not as spectacular as a NYC pizza oven, but close.   Beautiful space. From what I saw you can sit outside, inside in booths (most booths are for smaller parties but I did see one large booth) at the bar and at a smaller bar by the kitchen. I think the parking might be valet for dinner... but at happy hour it appeared to be self park.   The service is top notch, it's actually why I wanted to write this review. Our server was great and so were all the food runners, bartenders and other servers we interacted with (really rare among good looking hospitality industry peeps in phoenix). Oh, and we live walking distance away and I am wishing they had a bike rack... Service is so stellar... my boyfriend (who is a chef) and I are still talking about it.

While visiting Phoenix, my friend introduced me to Federal Pizza. OMG! Loved this restaurant. It was a refreshing break from all the chain restaurants in the Phoenix suburbs where we had been staying.  Funky atmosphere. Very friendly service. Reasonable prices. The best veggie lasagna I've ever had. The polenta sticks were awesome as well.  Everyone at our table loved their food.

Federal's "Casanova" pizza may just be my favorite pizza of all time. Savory prosciutto, spicy arugula, and then little bits of sweetness from the ricotta & dates ... pizza perfection. I could have a Casanova pizza every day and be one happy camper.  But seriously, I've been here multiple times, and each time the food and service has been excellent. I'm not a huge fan of pineapple pizza in general, but I tried their "Pineapple Express" for the first time yesterday, and now I've officially found one that I've liked and would even order again.   I've also done takeout and taken advantage of their drive-through (!), which is super convenient and also allows you to avoid the cramped parking lot / valet.

Very delicious!  The Burrata and crostini is The Bomb!  The Burrata is super creamy and melts in your mouth.  The crostini is the perfect compliment.  The pizza is very good. We had the four cheese with mushrooms.  Fantastic.  I wouldn't say it's the best pizza I've ever had, but it sure is close and I cannot wait to go back and try a Stromboli.  The service deserves 5 stars just on it's own. The entire staff was super friendly.  We cannot wait to return!

I was a fan of Federal before, but now that they've started a new late night special on Mondays and Tuesdays, I've fallen head over heels in love! A pizza plus a bottle of wine (or two pitchers of beer) for just $20 after 8pm. Best of all, the deal is available for takeout too. It's really an incredible deal. You're basically paying retail for the wine and getting the pizza for free!  And it's really good pizza. It might even be my favorite, but I can't bring myself to make that kind of statement on the record. The crust is so flavorful and crisp. I'm glad they don't shellac it in oil like they do at LGO, another contender in my favorite pizza category. While Grimaldi's might be my favorite pizza close to home, Federal really has them beat when it comes to toppings. I've had the sweet potato, veggie, potato and date pizzas so far, and I've loved them all.  Is there a way to bottle the wine coolers to go? If I could get a growler full of the watermelon mint variety, my summer would be complete.

I just moved down here to this area. So I biked here. from my place off of 4th n roosevelt.   I met my neighbor, had a few beers and pizza. It was a joy to enjoy pizza this good, and I'm from Brooklyn, NY.   I recommend anyone in the area that enjoys pizza and beer to stop here.

Recently came here for dinner because I received an email from upward projects for a free pizza from Federal Pizza. Upward projects generally has cool concept restaurants with good food so we decided to try it out.  The restaurant is located across from Windsor, another upward project restaurant, and like all of them, it has a cool, hip vibe with a cute little patio.   As for the food, we tried the "big star" pizza & the "tlc" salad. I gotta say...food was great! The big star pizza is a wood fired pizza with a yummy combo of toppings...sausage, pepperoni, bell peppers, onions, mushrooms & olives...I can see why they call it the " big star". And the salad was a nice refreshing blend of arugula, spring greens, beets, pears, almonds, fennel and cheese all tossed in a light citrus shallot vinaigrette...yum!   So if you've been to the other upward project restaurants & like them, this will be another one you will like too :)

I will be dreaming of the pizza I had here for weeks to come. My Labor Day weekend vacay to visit friends in Arizona was basically a gigantic tour of all the wonderful food that Phoenix has to offer. They definitely knew how to sell their city.   So, here we have Federal Pizza, a place that seems to have floated into a Portland Portal and ended up here. Part of a grouping of amazing restaurants all owned by the same people, Federal Pizza definitely brings something different to the table. Unique. Affordable (like everything in this state). Comfortable setting. Gender neutral bathrooms. Staff with tattoos everywhere. Killer food and drinks made from scratch. Perfect vibe.   There were two awesome Must Taste Items on the menu:  1. Homemade "Wine Coolers," in several flavors. I tried the apple cider and strawberry rhubarb. Had a hard time choosing which one was better. Mmmm.   2. PIZZA. Very VERY Mod Friendly Pizza. We did a meatball pizza with sliced POTATOES and CORN, and a veggie pizza with onions, garlic, and ROASTED brussels sprouts.   You basically choose everything on it, kind of like the blaze/blast/pieology craze we have here in Sac, BUT it has thicker, delicious crust and is slow baked the regular way.  One of the best pizza experiences I've ever had, and I've had me a lot of pizza experiences.  Freakin' Phoenix!

Great atmosphere, great food and to top it all, great service.   It is always good experience for me especially seating at the bar when either Chris or Josh are working.   Keep up the good work Federal!

I am so lucky to live in the Upward Projects Group Triangle--With the addition of Federal Pizza--my little part of the world has three great restaurants in walking distance--Federal Pizza is my favorite because i don't have to cross central and its the closest to my house.:)   Anyway--on to the food we shared a salad and a pizza and both hit a perfect note--salad had beets and pears in a great citrus vinaigrette--just enough to clear the palate--tonite we had a margherita pizza--crust was perfectly done and held up under the flavorful juicy tomatoes-- my only suggestion is that I would appreciate if there were a couple of wines by the glass and a price point closer to 7 instead of 9--but other than that--the restaurant itself is great looking as well, casual and modern.  It was also nice to see lots of folks who seem to know each other--certainly a great addition to  our neighborhood.

Flash back to about a week ago. My friend invited me to dinner here because she had a coupon and they had a special going on. Double deal (we thought). She raved about the pizza so I was pretty excited... Who doesn't love carb night?! We sit down right away and the waitress flies by and explained the drink specials in a way that didn't make sense to even my friend that had been there before! We wait and wait and finally put our order in. This is the last time we see the waitress for a long time. Some other guy brings out our wine and we quickly realize that the table/sidewalk is slanted and the bottle and are glasses are headed in the direction of the ground. Same guy finally brings out our pizza. Pizza is super soggy and my friend had to ask for ranch 3 times. It was just ok. Disappointing actually with it being so soggy.   Waitress dropped on bill and disappeared for another long period of time. We put out my card and my friends coupon. Waitress says they can't take coupon during a time they offer "specials" even though the coupon does not say this at all. She looks at my friend and asks if she just wants to run HER card. Big mistake. Never assume who is paying the bills, especially with her bad attitude. She runs my card still and I asked to speak with the manager about the coupon issue. Waitress says "I just keep striking out with you guys!" I respond yes even though her interaction was so minimal it was rather pathetic. This manager could care less about any customer satisfaction. In fact I don't think he cared about the business in general. All I got was a smug look that he got what he wanted. In the end I didn't give the waitress who didn't do anything a tip (which I hate doing).   This was truly a heinous experience.  And with the sheer number of people that talk to me everyday  about where I travel and restaurants I visit I have so far and will continue to tell everyone to avoid this place. Go to Cibo (or Pizza Hut) instead.
My boyfriend and I went to Federal Pizza last night for a cheat night meal. He ordered the Big Star and I got the Casanova and added Pancetta. The pizzas were amazing and definitely worth it!

By far, THE best pizza ever! Seriously! The crust is slightly crispy, and the pizza just melts in your mouth!  Great, fun environment for the whole family. Great indoor and outdoor patio space. I've always had wonderful and friendly service here. They also have a drive up window, so order ahead and just drive up and pick up the best pizza in town :) Doesn't get better than that!  Also, who doesn't love wine and pizza night? Great price, great food, it's a must try!

The pizza is good but the rest of the food leaves a lot to be desired.  Good beer on tap. The one thing I couldnt get over was that it seemed dark in there.  They use ambient light during the day and there isnt enough.  Parking is decent though.

Federal Pizza is incredible. Out of five stars it deserves ten, all day long.  Amazing food, spectacular service, beautiful ambiance.   The pizza here made me completely redo my Phx pizza rankings. This place is just impossible to beat. The cherry on top is that they have call ahead AND drive thru service. You can get world class pizza and beer, without leaving your car. What a world we live in.  Give Federal Pizza a shot, you and your taste-buds will be ecstatic that you did!

Federal Pizza is north of camelback on the west side of central.  It is clean, trendy, and hip.  The music is fresh and they play hip hop and modern rock.  The servers are welcoming and professional.    We ordered burrata, olives, the five star, and the manifesto.  The burrata was Amazing. Fresh, soft, silky with some olive oil and crisp bread.  The olives were excellent and had a touch of sea salt.  The five star pizza had sausage, pepperoni, bell pepper, mushrooms, and onions.  It had tons of flavor and the crust was excellent.  The manifesto had goat cheese, sausage, fennel, and mushrooms and was just as good and savory.  The goat cheese put it over the top.  The price was spot on.  Worked out to be 50 bucks with drinks.  I would have given it five stars but the table was wet, the waitress brought me a frozen glass for my sculpin ipa (alcohol abuse), and they didnt take discover card.  I would definitely come back and recommend this place to others.  Well executed food and nice spot to visit.  Well done.

Federal gets five stars for delivering top notch service and awesome craft beer! The food is always consistently delish! Only one recommendation..... Love the bambolinis.... Would love to see a half order of bambolinis on the menu!  Love ya guys! Keep up the great work.

I was hoping for something more.  Lunch, on a Friday, was very busy and loud.  I like a restaurant that smells like good food.  What first assaulted my nose was a familiar, but not pleasant smell.  We finally realized it smelled like olives.  It was a briny, olivey odor.  We ordered the pizza with Brussel sprouts and  pancetta.  Again, although tasty, it smelled like baby cabbages.  I think the place lacks ambiance.

Federal pizza is delicious. Every time I come here, everyone is so nice! I've never had a bad host/server here. Great job on customer service.  They're food here is STELLAR! I've had the pepperoni pizza, margherita pizza, cassanova pizza, lil' triple dessert, and bomolini dessert! All of it was delicious and was fair in price.  Have you ever been to a pizza place that has a drive-thru? Yeah, me neither. Well Federal stands out because they have a drive thru and it's AWESOME! I don't have to get up out of my car to get my pizza! YESSSSSSSSSS!  I love you Federal. XOXO

This place is great. It is next to Windsor. I give it 5 stars for everything. Well done. Once again.  Owners: Craig DeMarco, Owner of Postino Winecafe. `Opening day for Windsor and Churn is scheduled for Monday, April 25, 2011. `Federal Pizza Opening Monday, October 22, 2012.  Met one of the Chefs, 'Monster.' He was intense and forthcoming. A fellow human with zest and energy should be mentioned in everyday conversation.   He recommended the Casanova (Prosciutto + Dates + Ricotta + Arugula+ Pecorino 14) also the Sweet Potato (Sweet Potato+ Sage + Ricotta 13)  If you are Vegan he recommends:  `Brussels Sprout (Roasted Brussels Sprouts + Pancetta + Manchego + Roasted Garlic + Lemon Zest 13)   `At Last (Broccolini + Roasted Corn + Goat Cheese + Fresno Chilis + Basil + Lemon Zest 13)  Also, if you have not already succumb to the Paleo diet, and you can imbibe the sweet pinch and light taste of carbs, then eat this.  `Garganelli (Broccolini + Lemon Basil Pesto + Pine Nuts + Oven Roasted Tomatoes + Red Pepper + Pecorino 11)  `OrECchietti (Schreiner's Sausage + Swiss Chard + Shallot Herb Broth 11)  Enjoy.  RL  NOte. When a customer asks a bartender what the alcohol content is over the special beer, the correct responst is not, "uhh I don't know, Google it." cough.
Absolutely amazing pizza but the grilled artichoke is to die for. A definite must for any pizza lover

It is no secret that I'm a huge fan of this restaurant group - Postino's, Windsor, and now Federal Pizza all have prominent spots on my date-night list.    I was lucky enough to be dining out with a birthday girl during their first week, so we snagged a reservation.  It was awesome to skip through the long wait and get straight to the good stuff.  Our server was just the right percentage hipster without being too much.  He was friendly and knowledgable, and we had a few good laughs with him throughout the night.    We ordered the burrata appetizer, which was delicious, but we needed more bread to go with it.  Don't be skimpy, Federal!  The date, ricotta, and arugula pizza was incredibly delicious, but was a tad heavy on the dates and needed more prosciutto.  I'm more of a fan of the fig spread that can be found at Postino's... the dates are just a bit too chewy and strong.  A swap out would be good!  Best part?  The absolutely divine homemade wine coolers.  The combination of flavors were perfect (we sampled them all between all of the girls at our table).  This alone would make me return!   Well done, Federal.... well done.

I was visiting from out of town and this place was already on my itinerary. I was excited to try the grapefruit ginger wine cooler, and it did no disappoint. I had the Casanova pizza. I loved the use of ricotta and dates. It was such a unique combination and I am still thinking about it. Yum! I had the grilled artichoke as well, but it wasn't quite what I expected. Everything was good, but man the pizza was divine. I would gladly go again.
This is hands down my favorite new pizza place!  The food was awesome and the customer service even better!  Such a great experience, we're going back in a few weeks for my birthday!

Phoenix is apparently the pizza capital, so I have gathered some recommendations from my coworkers since I'm new to Arizona. Federal Pizza is by far the most agreeable top pizza joint in Phoenix amongst my group of friends.  The dim lights and classy wooden architecture makes it a great place for family, friends, or any other occasions. They also have a to go option.   I have picked the pineapple express because pizza is always better with pineapples. This is not fake news. In addition to the juicy pineapples, the hand crafted pizza consist of prosciutto, calabrian chili, and chives where an explosion of flavor is experienced in each bite. With no shame, I have demolished the entire 12inch pizza by myself in one setting. 2,000+ calories later, I still highly recommend this place. I'm happy to continue my search for the best pizza in Phoenix.
Been here twice second time pizza was a little soggy, great atmosphere, nice wait staff, great apps good wine.  Try it
Everything about this place is top notch, atmosphere, service, and food is second to none.  Will definately be coming back time and time again.

I've been here a few times and service has always been top notch, even with a party of 8! Everyone is super friendly and on top of that their food is always great! Love their style of pizza, not too thin or thick crust, a perfect chewiness, very flavorful toppings and sauce. I also love their polenta sticks with the red pepper sauce they serve along it. Yum!! Always a good time when coming here
At last pizza is really good. Blueberry hibiscus wine cooler is awesome. Quick service.

This is one of my favorite spots in Phoenix! The food is awesome and the staff are always super quick and nice. The hostess usually over estimates how long your wait will be, which I think is a good thing. Last weekend I was told it would be 1 hour, but since someone takes your drink order while you wait, it was no problem. We ended up being sat right when we got our drinks - it couldn't have been more than 20 minutes or so.   The burrata is a must. It pretty much melts in your mouth. What I like most about Federal is how easy they are about subbing and changing their pizzas. Obviously you can make your own, but if you want to sub out things on pre-designed pies, it's no big deal.  I usually go for the manifesto and add an egg on top. If you're into eggs on things it's a must try here. One funny thing is that they don't have hard liquor - only wine and beer. However, they have a selection of house made wine coolers. Grapefruit ginger is perfect for summer.

After only reading the rants & raves, I finally came in to experience Federal myself. MIND. BLOWN. Or taste buds. Whatever.  As many have said before me... not surprised by how good this place is based on its creators. If it is possible for food to not only look but TASTE beautiful... this pizza is proof. There are so many exquisite flavor combinations to choose from it's hard to narrow it down to one decision - which is why I suggest you do what I did and bring friends to order everything else you want off the menu and then share all of it.  We had the Sweet Potato pizza (sweet potatoes, ricotta, and sage) and the Margherita (fresh basil and roasted tomatoes). I don't usually like tomatoes as a pizza topping but, HAVE MERCY, this pizza is probably the best pizza I have ever had. Ever. Watch out, Italy.  The house made wine coolers are also ridiculous. Making it a point to go back until I try every single one... at least a few times.

Finally had the chance to take the family and some close friends and check this place out for lunch. It's been on my list of new places to try out for a long time. Not to mention we had a $50 gift that was screaming to be used up.  This location is a masterfully transferred old federal bank building that used to do business here in another lifetime. It has everything from the old drive thru to the super old metal covered parking area for the previous bank employees.  Inside is themed with the current hipster vibe and they did a great job exploring ways to make both the decor and the food interesting and great tasting at the same time.  We started with several appetizers and decided to share most the food. Ordered the F&A Veg Board, the Wedge Salad and two plates of the Arancini. They were all very delicious and left us in the mood for some main entrees.  Next we decided on the Lamb Bolognese, a Big Star Pizza, a Meatball Pizza and a Casanova Pizza. Everything was very good and we really enjoyed all the fresh ingredients. Even the grand kids did a great job of polishing off their portions.  The pizzas were also tasty but the dough and crust were not anything special and different than what we were used to eating. We all generally agreed that we preferred more of a Chicago or NY style pizza crust during our drive back home.  Service was friendly and the food came out hot and ready to eat. We did have a small problem trying to talk over the loud music. My wife even ask them to turn it down a little bit and had no luck. The music was so loud in the bathroom that I started having psychedelic flashbacks from my college days. Nice!  Overall we had a fun time and would most likely go back again. Get your buns over here and show this place your dance moves. They also have a large selection of spirits and other alcoholic beverages that you can enjoy. Maybe the loud music is more appealing when you are three sheets to the wind? BEER ME!  3.75 STARS

I live in Austin TX. First time, we went to Phoenix, was hungry for pizza, found Federal Pizza place. First bite, I almost choked because it was so good that I couldn't believe what I was eating...After that we came back to Austin, trying to find a good pizza place which compatible to Federal Pizza, but we could never found any good pizza compare to that. Now we go back to Phoenix for pizza when we want a good pizza. Wish we had good pizza like that in Austin TX.

First visit here - their lunch duo for $10.50 is the best deal in Phoenix. The service was inintrusive but outstanding. Had the 1/2 Manifesto pizza and 1/2 Federal Chop salad and was not disappointed. Partner had the whole Pineapple Express pizza and a side salad and they were winners also. The best part is you can park right there. None of the valet parking nonsense that is happening all over Phoenix. If the restaurant requires you to valet then I don't spend my money there. Excellent place to eat and we will be back soon.
Food was delish and service was Awesome!!! We had the Casanova,  Big Star and Pinapple pizza!!  Thanks Nicole

Lots of already great reviews, so I'll keep it simple.   My! I love what you've done with the place FP! Looks like it was once a drive-thru bank...thus the name "Federal" Pizza. Ceilings are partly exposed, partly textured. Awesome light fixtures. Interior is well done!   Burrata appetizer - Amazing...could have eaten the entire thing alone. MINE!! Don't forget to enjoy the basil "garnish" with the cheese. It really brings out the flavor.   Corn "coins"  appetizer - Meh! Next.   Cassanova Pizza - VERY good but the a typical ricotta, date and arugula pie.  Brussel Sprout Pizza - My favorite mostly because it was unique. Little bit of a lemony tang on the sprouts + salty from the pancetta. Also could have eaten alone! MINE! MINE!   Enjoy!
So far it's amazing!!!!! A short wait, good music and just been seated! Great servers!  I know this is silly but their Coke is perfect!

This place never disappoints me! Foods always great, no matter what i have tried, its all been amazing! Love the atmosphere and the staff are so great! Don't forget to try the berry cobbler....its beyond delicious.

If I were cruel, I would say that the pizza crust is orgasmic and just end the review here.    But, I'm feeling generous so...  go here.  Today.  They had a great beer list as well as homemade wine coolers.  I had the blueberry hibiscus and it a perfect concoction.  The margherita pizza was delicious.  They were not stingy with the cheese or the basil.  My husband had the sweet potato and ricotta pizza.  He quite enjoyed it and considering he's not the biggest pizza fan, that's kind of a big deal.  We shared the 'Lil Triple for dessert and it was wonderful as well.  Oreo crust, chocolate creme and toasted marshmallow...    Service was a teensy bit slow but to be fair, they were quite busy.  It was a beautiful day outside but we opted to sit inside as the patio was quite loud since it's on the street.    I realized shortly after being seated that this must be the brainchild of the same folks who run Windsor and I was correct.  (I think the gum wrappers in the sugar containers may have given it away.)    Can't wait to go back!
Great place, excellent food and happy hour prices that can't be beat! A large variety of beers and super scratchmade wine coolers!

Nice place to have lunch.   Got the Modesto pizza, substituted the goat cheese and fennel for olives and pineapple.  Asian chili and mild wings - Better than the pizza in my opinion. Drumsticks are very meaty. Only downside was that the carrots were really soft.
Service was fast and amazing. Food was delicious. Will definitely be going again. We got the meatball pizza. The fingerling potatoes as an app. Mild wings were the best wings I've ever had.
Pizza .  Amazing .  Homemade wine coolers.  Amazing .  Nice music playing.  Nice patio.  Will be back!

I proudly demolished almost an entire margherita pizza from Federal the other night and don't regret a single bite. Decent beer selection, great service, crowded but pleasant atmosphere, and a creative pizza menu.   On Mondays and Tuesdays Federal offers a pizza, 2 pitchers of beer or 1 carafe of wine for $20.

This is my favorite local pizza place! The prices are comparable to any other pizza joint in the valley, but their pizza surpasses them all. They also have a grilled veggie board served with a slightly tangy dipping sauce that accompanies the vegetables perfectly. While some frown on dipping pizza in ranch dressing, I highly suggest ordering a side or two of their garlic ranch...it's scrumptious! My husband and I always order the same pizza which is the Big Star, no olives. This pizza comes with a plethora of veggies, schreiners sausage, and red sauce. Our friends ordered the meatball pizza and raved about it as well.   The atmosphere is hip and cool with a large bar and booths that run down the middle of the restaurant. An open kitchen is on the North side of the restaurant allowing guests to watch their pizzas being made. They also have a quaint outside area if you prefer to enjoy this beautiful Phoenix weather.   If you are too busy to dine in, call in your growler and pizza order and visit the drive-through. While I prefer dining in, this is a great option!

My wife and I live less than a mile from Federal Pizza and never had a chance to give it a try. Well, it was a hot and sunny afternoon on a Sunday and we figured it was worth the short drive.   Upon arrival, I noticed the plentiful parking, especially the covered parking spaces...no doubt, from the building's former life as a Federal Savings & Loan.  As soon as I stepped in I immediately knew we were in for a great experience. The interior is bright, casual, and unique in furniture and decor. The booths are perfect for two. The service was great, multiple servers eager to take our drink orders. I ordered the Pilsner from the Czech Republic which was on draft. Delicious!   We ate the Mister Mister app, which consists of fried vegetables (it is delicious and unique). As for pizza, we got the Manifesto. Again, it was great. Saucy, not overdone with toppings, and the pizza dough was crispy and light. We finished it off with a doughnut and chocolate dip dessert. This place exceeded my expectations. I'm not a huge fan of italian/pizza joints but this is a fantastic lunch/dinner choice and is casual enough that you want to come back over and over. I like this place better than The Parlor. Overall 9/10.

We wanted to sit outside. Had to wait 45 minutes even though there were empty tables. Grabbed a beer at the bar while we waited. Not a very good bartender. Not helpful explaining the various IPA beers. Seemed frustrated by our questions.   Finally seated.  It was sonority inside with really bad music that we hoped sitting outside would be better. Only minimally. Not sure how anyone can carry on a conversation in this place!  Pizzas were ok. Had heard about the Brussels sprout pizza so tried it. Hardly any sprouts on the pie. Very unimpressed. Never had water refills.   Won't be back. Way better places to spend our time and money in in this city of great pizza joints.
Really good pizza and sandwiches. My friends and I ordered the meatball trio to split and it was divine with the polenta. Good service and great food!

Very good food its my second time there and i loved the food both times cant go wrong with the pizza we also got wings and some potato thing they were very good my husband is kind of picky when it comes to food and service he was satisfied with both and the lemonade is amazing

I genuinely love most pizza places. This one falls right into my love for pizza.   However my first trip here was with a group of co-workers and the service was flat out awful. She was rude and forgetful. She forgot to put one of our pizza orders in now granted the manager made up for it and sent us back to work with a couple of free pizzas.   I did decide to them another chance and just chalk my first experience up to a once in a blue moon mistake. Every experience after that was amazing. The pizza a lit more greasy than I would like but otherwise great food. The service has been amazing since and it also helps that I have only been waited on by male servers.
Great place for beer and pizza! They have $5 32 ounce draft craft beers from open to 5PM. Great salads and lunch specials. Best meatballs in town!

I don't go much unless my friends insist. I'm gluten free and Federal Pizza refuses to offer it. Every time I go, I ask and get a variety of reasons --from we're working on it (a year ago) to its not anything that we're planning (most recent). Tired of waiting, Spinatos, Sauce, LGO (the best GF pizza btw) will do.

Our first time. Amazing service! What a great team of people. They are all very attentive, know their menu well and sociable. This made a huge impression on my husband and I. We will be back for sure. Thank you, Kara, Ari and Angie! You were all so friendly.   The food was unique in the ingredient combinations. We ordered Brussels sprouts and cheese/risotto balls (Arancini) appetizers, The Magnificent sandwich, Chef's Whim pizza (chicken, collard greens, ribeye gravy, pickled watermelon, cheese), cannoli and Bombolini (homemade donuts and chocolate sauce). We loved everything we ordered. It's nice to find original menus that make you want to try everything.   Ari was kind enough to make my wine selection effortless by choosing for me. I had the new Rosè wine. Perfect pairing with my meal and refreshing.   Relaxing and casual atmosphere. We were on the patio. I usually worry about patio service but they didn't miss a beat and our drinks were always full. We were even there during a shift change and didn't feel a thing in our service. Ari was amazing and Angie stepped right in and was just as awesome. Kara stopped by to check on our experience a few times and was very personable.   This restaurant is 25 miles oneway from our home. Worth all 50 miles. We highly recommend.
It's now becoming my regular dinner place. Love the food and company, anyone wana join?

I'm normally a more traditional type of pizza guy, but their Casanova pizza...dates, pecorino, prosciutto, and arugula was amazing.  Service was top notch.  Atmosphere was unique and even with some background music you could still have a conversation.  Great selection and prices on beer and wine.  We will definitely be going back!!!!  It has the same owners as Postino's and a similiar feel.

Stopped  by for a quick  lunch . The place was about half full  but got much busier.  The waiter kept  giving me water with ice when I requested  no ice.. I ordered  the wedge but  got a sliver.  I ordered  the meatball  pizza but the meet was not evenly distributed.service was average

Went with my roommate for the Monday/Tuesday special, which is a pizza and two mini pitchers of beer for $20. Even at normal pricing this would have been a great deal. The food came out fast and was delicious, the service was terrific, and they have a good selection of craft beers on tap. Excellent experience, I give it 5 stars with nothing negative to say. We will be back!

After hearing/reading that Federal had one of the better pies in town, we decided to give it a try for lunch when we were in that area this past Sunday.  They did a really nice job with the layout and décor, an all around inviting atmosphere.  We ate light and shared the seasonal salad and their margarita pizza adding roasted garlic and prosciutto.  The salad was a nice mix of greens and other veggies with goat cheese and avocado, everything very crisp & fresh, a nice size for one person, but we managed to make it do for two.  The pizza was wonderfully tasty with large slices of ripe beefsteak-like tomatoes that tasted like they came right out an east coast garden, and the prosciutto added just the right amount of salt and meat to make it virtually perfect.  It might have been able to stay in the oven another minute, but I'm NOT complaining!  The crust was almost perfectly crisp, and I could have licked the olive oil off the pan for dessert!  We're now fans and will be back again.

Great food. Great service. The wildfires pizza had excellent flavor. The beer selection was pretty good too. We had no less than 3 people that served us. Never ran dry in hydration. The place isn't that big so I would reserve a day in advance. Indoor and outdoor seating. We were in town for business but if we come back I will be sure to eat there again.

You looking for a pizza place to go to?  While you should totally go to Federal Pizza, it is the BEST pizza place in Arizona.  They have an awesome selection of pizza's you can choice from.  So, far I have had the Meatball, Big Star, Brussels Sprout and Manifesto.    The Meatball is my favorite pizza; if you add Brussels sprouts to the pizza it's even better.   Even the staff is awesome too; they make you feel like you are only one in the restaurant.  Your water glass is always filled and the pizza comes out quick too.    It may be in central phoenix, but it is totally worth the drive.  Federal Pizza is a locally owned company.  They are part of the Upward Projects; all of their other restaurants are great too.   So, if you have not tried Federal Pizza.  Then you are totally missing out.

I had the best experience eating at Federal Pizza! I came here with some of my family and we all kinda shared everything from the appetizers to the pizza/pasta. I literally had some of the best food and even better service from Kiley, Veronica, Vern, Nicole and the manager Gary!!I'll definitely be back and I highly suggest everyone visits central Phoenix best prime time Italian restaurant!!! Legends !!

Roasted veggie platter was very tasty...carrots, fennel, cauliflower and broccoli with a spicy mayo sauce. Brussel sprout pizza and sausage pizza were both very good but crust could have been crustier. Our waiter was great.

There are good reasons why this is one of my favorite pizza places: the use of top quality ingredients is reflected in their pizzas which are really good, with a pleasant just-right char along the crust edge. Appetizers are superb, there is a good selection of adult beverages, and service is friendly and efficient - all of these make Federal an excellent place for a leisurely meal or a happy hour gathering. Oh, and by the way, their super-fresh creamy burrata is addictive!

This place is convenient ,they have a good salad and pizza lunch for 10.50.good salad and good pizza. .I don't like their Bacon on the salad as it is too salty. Service  is always  outstanding.  Place is very clean  but can be noisy.

Hands down my favorite pizza joint! If you haven't been here... whatcha waiting for? Best friendliest staff in town and the food??? YUMMY! Monday and Tuesday night special... Pizza and bottle of wine only $20!

I am going to have to join the mainstream on this one and give this place a TOP 5 Rating.  The pizza here is sooooooo gooooood.  The staff is amazing, good specials to choose from, and great location with fairly easy parking (sitting inside is cool, but I suggest getting a patio seat when the weather is rocking).    This is a great place to ride your bike too as well.  Didn't love the meatball appetizer and would not recommend that, but everything else was top notch.  Good enough to earn my highest rating.  Go there, get the pepperoni pizza straight up and tell them Attorney Steve sent you.  have fun and FIND YOUR SIZZLE.  Attorney Steve, the Business and Real Estate Lawyer.  http://www.AttorneySteve.net

I just visited this pizza place for the first time and it did not disappoint. We waited for a table for a bit, but figured the place must be that good. Everyone was friendly so big plus on the service side. I had the "great little salad" and "at last" pizza. Both were very good, so I'm looking forward to returning and trying some of their other offerings.  It has a hip vibe to it, with semi dim lights and loud music, so overall I'd recommend it as a good place to meet up with friends.

Came here last night for dinner around 6:00.   It was bustling but we were seated promptly.  We got service with water and drinks right away also.  Our server was very friendly and efficient, she gave us good feedback when we asked her about the menu items we were trying to decide between.  Our food came out quick but not overly quick to make us think we were being hustled out for some reason.  The food was delicious and plentiful.  Not enormous portions but just the right amount.  The only negative for me was  the restrooms were co-ed, co-mingled whatever you want to call it.  I don't care for that, when you have two rooms why not keep them separate?  The signs on the doors of the restrooms were cute and clever but I would prefer one gender bathrooms.

I have been here at least 6 times now.  Yes, I am a fan. But, I add a caveat, I am not a all out big fan.  Yes, I will take visitors to town here, but i myself would prefer to head to Pizzaria Pomo or La Piazza Locale downtown for more authentic Napolitano pizza.    I guess the loud noise, the pretentious atmosphere and staff (are tatoos a requirement for employment here?) and the a bit too exoctic pizza don't do it for me anymore.    On the plus side, It is a nice place to take first timers.  It is kind of a destination type of restaurant worth the short supply of parking, noise and location.  We enjoyed our appetizers of Burata and crustinis, grilled veggie board and the olives.  Two times I have ordered the meatballs with polenta and been disappointed both times, nothing too interesting in that dish.  So as you can see I am torn.  Interesting but not the best in town.    Extra plus note - last night they gave us the wrong pizza (it was missing onions), we had not even noticed.  They realized their mistake and brought out the correct pizza and did not charge us for it, we took it home, I had some for breakfast today and it was pretty good cold.

Incredible music is constantly playing. I heard the clash and Johnny Cash while eating. The porchetta sandwich is a must have and I also had the mister mister which was freaking delicious and growlers to go. This place is going to be hard to beat.

Fantastic, gourmet pizza in an uber-hip atmosphere inside what used to be a federal bank. Love the idea of re-using a space rather than knocking it down. The wait was very long on a Friday night, so I would recommend going at another time. But it was still fantastic. OH, and get the blackberry rosemary wine cooler. You will not be disappointed.

Solid 4 Stars! We were seated rather fast on a very busy Friday night. The salad was fresh and the pizza was very tasty! The cold beer complimented a lovely evening at The Federal Pizza. Don't forget they do have a drive thru! I highly recommend this establishment.

We only had salad and pizza here, and both were great! Service was okay, drinks weren't bad at all. I loved their pizza dough. Crispy and fresh. Margherita pizza had no pizza sauce on it.  I'd say this is my #2 choice for pizza after Grimaldi's.

To confess, I came here only because the wait at Bianco was 2-3 hours, but I was pleased with the outcome. The beet starter was delicious - a lot of flavor packed into small dish. The grapefruit ginger and strawberry rhubarb wine coolers were wonderful - light and refreshing. My party shared two pizzas: the Big Star and the chef's daily selection, a vegetarian selection which apparently used to be a regular on the menu, with roasted corn and arugula. Both were very good although I probably would have liked a bit more corn and a tad less arugula on the latter. I'm an out-of-towner but definitely would not hesitate to return because so many other items on the menu sounded enticing. Service was efficient with two minor complaints: one of the three starters was delayed; and when I asked that the check be given to me (as opposed to someone else in my party), because of the team service model, my request wasn't fulfilled.

This place rocks for lunch! They have a pizza and salad special for $10.00 that allows one to pick from a yummy list of both. Frankly, for as long as I've lived in Phoenix, I'm not sure why I don't lunch here more often. This is a correction that will now happen! Excellent food and service. I'll be back!

The pizza was delicious and the environment was fabulous.  But the service was so bad from one particular server today...I just can't give this place anymore than 3 stars.  We were a party of five and each person in my group was appalled at the service.  I have never left a zero tip before but just for the principle of it...all I could do today was leave her a note. I won't replay all of her issues of unfriendliness and inattentiveness on here because she's well aware of her mistakes....if not, than she's even worse than a zero tip.    We hope to return sometime but for now...take-out will be our only reason to return.

Best pizza in Phoenix! The crust is incredible. I highly recommend the Casanova, but Add Apples and Sausage. To die for!!!!  Only downside is parking, it's a challenge but the Pizzas worth it. Trust me!!!!

Yes, it is that good!  Pizza was very good the second time though not as spectacular the first visit. I think the kitchen got rushed. But all is forgiven, Everything else is perfect. Love the chop salad. Great beer. Great wine.  Gorgeous date.

Great food, great atmosphere & great service, what else is there to say?  Oh yeah & a great beer selection! We managed to get seats at the bar because the place was packed on a Friday night - always a good sign. The bartender recommended the burrata, which I was cheesy awesomeness that I would highly recommend. Our pizza was the big star, I don't normally like green olives on pizza but they added just the right amount of saltiness. Can't wait to go back & try something new!  My only real complaint was that after putting our name down for a table, the hostess seemed to lose track of us so I had to flag her down to make sure we weren't forgotten. It ended up being a non-issue when we scored two seats at the bar & had fantastic service from the staff.

There is something about woodfired pizzas that taste so good! The atmosphere is very cool and they have a drive-thru! Something I have never seen in San Diego. The servers and cooks are so sweet and get your food out fast!

This place is always delicious, I have had almost everything on the menu and there have been NO disappointing experiences. I love the cozy feel of the place, the integration of the cobbler from churn, and the neighborhood view is always nice.the kids menu is proportionate, fair, and well priced. Always leave with a smile and a full belly. Always accommodating to large parties too.

Final dinner with my roommate and my best friend to cap off her New Year's visit.  And what a good choice!  For starters - how can I not adore the concept of picking up amazing food and a bottle of wine or growler or beer from a drive-thru if so desired? Admittedly super lazy, sometimes I want good food, but don't want to give up the comfort of my slippers to get it. Federal is the perfect solution!  The roommate and I shared the corn coin appetizer - not bad at all, but I think it would have been amazing if prepared more elote style. Next time I'll get the beets or sprouts instead. We also decided to split one of the pizzas. With MJ Bread responsible for the dough and Schreiner's doing the sausage, no big surprise that it was a hit! (And doing fresh grated parm from the big block directly onto the pie was a nice touch that makes a big difference to this girl!)  Also ordered was the roasted veggie board - with sprouts instead of potatoes. It was big and beautiful and super tasty! I suggest this for any celiac, vegetarian, vegan or anyone who likes amazing veggies and every combination thereof! HUGE winner in this dish!  As DD, I was sticking with iced tea - but look forward to exploring some of the beers and checking out a couple of their wine coolers.  And getting that veggie board again!

Hands down one of the best new places in town. Excellent food, great vibe, terrific staff, valet parking, decent prices, central location. Had the broccoli pizza and the sausage pizza with a Caesar salad. Will definitely be back!
Tonight's the night, bucket list time at the Federal. It's Cioppino with a frosted mug of their Amber Ale. Talk to ya later...

Definitely coming back. Standout is the service!  Attentive, provide feedback, knowledgeable about the wine offerings and clear on options with pizza (such as "feel free to do a 1/2 and 1/2 pizza!"). We had 1/2 pepperoni and 1/2 Casanova with a Federal Chop salad.  No complaints on the quality nor quantity of any of the food.  Looking forward to a future visit and trying something new.

Excited to go to another Upward Projects place as Positinos and Windsor are already a favorite.  Great thin crust...and lots of unique toppings.  All the servers seemed to help each other out and were attentive, tho, no personal touch.  Busy, hopping, great location and food, tho.  I will go again.

I rarely give a 5 star review, but I honestly couldn't find anything wrong this place! From the menu to the service, we were kept happy during a busy lunch hour on a Friday.  I met a friend for lunch, (during  office hours) so I couldn't try any of their drinks, but their pizza selection was so intriguing that I didn't even care.  I went simple and boring...  a margherita pizza with green olives, but I thought I would see if they could get the basics right before moving on.. . They nailed it! Probably the best I've had in a really long time.  My lunch date had a "Abbey" Style beer which she enjoyed (Yes, right in front of me ! It's okay Mandi B. I still love you=D) and the Brussels sprout pizza with arugula and prosciutto.  She said it was delicious.  After I ordered, I smelled and saw all of these wonderful concoctions of pizza, roasted corn and salads... none of which I ordered.  I don't regret my order, but can't wait to go back and try something new.  Maybe Sweet potato and arugula pizza? Stay tuned...

Got a Federal Pizza gift card for Christmas so needless to say I was eager to give this place a try.  This a pizzeria set in what used to be an old Federal bank just north of Central and Camelback.  Its one in a growing megaplex of hugely popular concept restaurants owned and operated by the group Upward Projects (purveyors of restaurants such as Windsor, Churn, Postino and Joyride Taco House).  Living in Downtown Phoenix, I'm something of a pizza connoisseur as there's great pizza everywhere.  So how does Federal stack up?  I got their margherita pizza as that's usually a good measure of comparison.  It's simple, clean, and (when done right) hits the spot.  The tomato and olive oil are notes you definitely pick up with Federal's version, though the cheese and basil are far less pronounced than other places I've tried.  Tasty, but I've had better.  For dessert, I got an order of their Bombolini.  Essentially giant donut holes you dip in chocolate sauce.  Holy moly is there a lot of sugar on those!  I probably could've wind sprinted the 3 miles back to my apartment I had such a sugar high after eating those.  Huge portion too.  I also got a four kings cheese blend pizza to go for dinner.  Once again it was a tasty pizza, but I've had similar cheese combo pizzas at other joints that can stack up pretty well.  The restaurant itself can be described as hipster or trendy chic, but its very family friendly.  The wait staff was extremely friendly and along with some fun overhead music ranging from classic rock to modern pop, the place has a very fun vibe about it.  Definitely has a modern urban neighborhood feel.  From the orange booths, to the seemingly endless bar, to the kitchen that looks right out into the restaurant, to the relaxed patio looking out towards Central Ave, this place has quintessential Upward Projects creativity written all over it.  So to summarize, five stars for the staff and the atmosphere.  But I only give three stars for the food.  From my own experience, you can find better quality pizza and sides at places like Pomo, Cibo, Pizzeria Bianco, or even La Piazza Locale.  That said, I love what Upward Projects has done with this building and the Central/Camelback corridor as a whole.  It's great to see historic structures preserved and repurposed for something new and innovative.  Can't wait to see what they come up with next!

It seems this is the place hipsters go to get their pizza, kind of like how Gallo Blanco is the Hipster Macayo's.  They're so hip that they don't even put the name of the restaurant on the building!  That pretty much guarantees an overinflated Yelp rating, because a lot of hipsters have trouble thinking for themselves.  But I digress.  If you read my last few weeks' worth of reviews, you'd know that I have been eating a lot of pizza lately.  We are on a sort-of pizza quest.  I had high hopes for this one, and the menu actually looked really awesome.  I went with the Casanova, which is a white pizza with ricotta, dates, arugula, prosciutto, and pecorino.  I also had a ginger ale to drink.  The ginger ale was probably in the Canada Dry tier.  That means so flavorless that they're willing to serve it for free on an airplane.  The difference between a fountain and microbrewed soft drink is probably more profound for ginger ales than any other soft drink variety.  As far as the pie goes, the toppings were excellent.  Go here if you like the focus of your pizza to be entirely on the toppings, because the crust sucks.  It was a little too tough, and the flavor was worse than any other artisan pizza I've had.  This was not knife-and-fork pizza; it was pick-it-up-and-eat-it pizza.  That's how you know the crust is subpar.  Besides that, the ambiance is a little too modern.  When I sit down for a nice handmade pie, I like it to be warm and cozy.  This place is trendy, with loud music blasting in the restaurant.  They need to dial it down a notch.  Of all the wood-fired pizzas I have had in Phoenix, Federal was one of my least favorite.  Maybe better than Cibo, but not as good as Pomo, Bianco, or Il Bosco.  Or even Timo's flatbread pizza.  The chef might be creative, but without a good crust or a good restaurant, eclectic toppings become a bit of a gimmick.

I had a great time last weekend.  My hubby had been talking about Federal Pizza and I have been reading all the reviews, that I couldn't wait to visit.  We were worried we couldn't get a table, because I've heard the wait it a little long.  We decided ahead of time that we were going to sit at the bar.  When we got there, we valet, got inside and there were two seats open right in the middle of the bar area, score.  We ordered the Manifesto, and since lately I've been easing my way into beers, I asked for some advise and the recommendation was great, it was the Sierra Nevada Kellerweis, I liked it a lot.  My hubby had the Four Peaks one.  The place was buzzing with energy and the servers were working really hard.  It had been about 20 minutes after we ordered and I saw a pizza coming by, it went straight from us to another person at the bar who I thought had gotten there after us, hum, ok, maybe I didn't realize they were here.  Ten minutes later, a server/manager? approached us and apologized for having given our pizza away and they made another one and they told us it was on them.  That was very classy, because I really didn't know it that pizza I saw go by was mine and they could have just said the kitchen was backed up.  Thank you again, Federal Pizza for being so aware and caring about your performance.  This was a Saturday early evening and there were people from every age range.  We also had the chopped salad which was delicious and for dessert my hubby had been raving about the berry cobbler.  I can't wait to come back.  I have so many items I want to try.

Yup. Federal Pizza is a great restaurant with a nice atmosphere.   I've heard about Federal Pizza for a while and finally had the opportunity to stop in for dinner. I heard they get pretty busy, but when I called to make a reservation they told me that it wasn't necessary. When my friend and I got there, we were greeted by two gals at the front counter and were told to wait for a few minutes before they could seat us.   We opted for a patio seat since it was so nice out that evening. The outdoor seating is my favorite because you get a good street view, but it isn't too loud. The ambiance of Federal Pizza is also very cozy and it feels upscale. We had two people serving us that evening and both were attentive and honest about what they recommended we try from the drink menu.   Our food and drinks were both great. The pizza was definitely fresh and unique, but also not too filling like a lot of pizzas. I am a big guy and it was enough for me and a second person. The drinks are also nice -they do some wine coolers that are refreshing. I did just go with a beer that our server recommended that would go well with the pizza we ordered. And it did.   We did order an appetizer as well, which was good but probably was the least exciting part of the night. In terms of desert, we ended up getting the doughnuts that they make, along with a chocolate dip. I know right?! Doughnuts for desert. That's a win in my book for sure. Overall, the food was nice, albeit it wasn't the cheapest meal I've ever had.
