The only drawback I can see to Federal Pizza is the fact that parking can be difficult to attain in the evening, forcing you to park on a side street or across the street. Other than that, I found the atmosphere, food, and staff all excellent. I would definitely come back at some point, just to try another combination of ingredients on a pizza.   ...And the doughnuts. I would come back for the doughnuts.

Came here on a Monday night for date night after having amazing service and an overall great experience a few weeks back at Postinos and Joyride! My boyfriend and I are pizza fanatics and are always looking for a wood fired pie. The pizza is amazing (we tried the Casanova and the meatball. Both uniquely delicious) however, our service at the bar wasn't all that great. Overall, we will absolutely be back! Decent craft beer selection and even better pizza! Probably just going to sit at a table next time unless we see a new face at the bar!

I visited Federal Pizza on a trip out West to see family.  When my brother suggested going to a pizza place I was thinking, no way!  I eat at some of the best pizza places in the world on the regular out on the East Coast.  Federal Pizza more than met my high expectations.    The Pizza was perfectly cooked and wood fired.  The toppings were inspired.  I was very impressed with their appetizers and salads as well.  It was so great that I went back again before leaving.  The Burrata with fresh baked bread was a great start.  The cheese is mild and spreadable and the bread is toasted to perfection.  We also cooled off with happy hour house made wine coolers.  They had a great beer selection as well.    I tried the meatball, manifesto, big star, and casanova pizzas.  The casanova and meatball were perfect for sharing because of their more intense flavors.  The big star and manifesto were more traditional, but with an artisanal kick.    Another great bonus with this place is that they source some of their products locally.  The sausage is made right down the street at Schreiners Sausages.    The staff is definitely hipster cool, but really helpful and excited about the food and drinks.  They made some excellent suggestions and made sure we had everything we needed.   The location is the perfect fit.  It's in an old bank building from the 50's and helps make this place have mid-century charm.  The decorations are also clearly somewhat Mad Men inspired.  But, the whole place feels so modern and clean at the same time... it's no time capsule.  You really can't go wrong here.

How have I not written a review for Federal Pizza?! Federal Pizza is definitely in my top pizza places of all time. I love this place. Everything from their pizza,  pasta, appetizers and drinks are utterly delicious. I first tried Federal Pizza when I moved to central Phoenix a couple of years ago. I wanted to try this place out so I ordered a few boxes for my sister's surprise party. EVERYONE at the party could not stop raving about their food.  I always order Casinova. This is a sweet pizza and is my absolute favorite. The prosciutto, arugula and ricotta taste so perfect together. You must order Casanova, you will not regret it!  You can never go wrong with the Big Star (For ya'll meat lovers), and one of their newer ones Pineapple Express.   My boyfriend loves the chicken parm. The house breaded chicken is perfectly cooked and pairs well with the salad. I've had the Mickey White before and I enjoyed it. I usually don't like heavy pastas, but it was pretty good. I always order crisp fingerlings on the side and have tried to replicate it at home but have not been successful!  They allow you to order two different types of pizza in one, and also have some great deals on Mondays and Tuesdays. It gets pretty packed on those days since it is $20 for one pizza and a bottle of wine! You can't beat that!

Some might call me a super-fan, but when Upward Projects does something, you can't help but love it. In the game of artisan pizza, Federal kneads out the competition.   Having tried most pizzas from their menu, I've landed on the Manifesto as my normal order. I love the Manifesto, with exception of the mushrooms, so when I order it, I always sub for brussels sprouts instead, sometimes I'm feeling a little frisky and have them throw sweet potato on there too. Not only are they happy to make these changes for me, but the server usually says something like "That sounds delicious, I need to try it!"  The manifesto, with goat cheese, red sauce, fennel, schriener's sausage, and brussels sprouts is delish. The toppings are always super fresh, the crust is a bit crispier than most other artisan pizza's from around town and the service is always excellent.  $12 - $15 will buy you a pizza sized well enough for one hungry dude or in my case, large enough for two to share. Joining their email posse will usually score you a free pizza once or twice a year for things like your birthday or promotions they feel like running.  Their vegetable side is neither here nor there in my opinion, likely because I don't love carrots, but the broccolini were delish.   If you're a dessert fan (remember two deSSerts and one deSert, in case you can never remember how to spell dessert or desert for that matter) they generally always have a fruit cobbler of some sort. If it's mixed berry, you must order it, dessert fans everywhere insist. Oddly enough, I don't order dessert at many places, mostly because I'm generally looking out for my figure, but in this case, I wouldn't be eating pizza either, but when I am, I sometimes order dessert. Go all out right? ;-)  Enough rambling and back to the part we're all waiting for... the end of this review.  Always delish, always fresh, and no one has ever actually gotten fresh with me while dining here, not yet at least.   Happy Yelping Phoenix!

After constantly hearing amazing things about this place, my wife and I had to give it a try.   We went in on a Wednesday night around 7pm and waited just about 10 minutes. The host was extremely friendly (Kylie, I think?) and even gave us free dessert (the sugar dusted donuts which were freaking crazy good). We each got our own pizzas and they did not disappoint. I went for the meatball and she got the casanova-both were so different but complimented each other nicely.   This place has a fun ambiance, great service, and delicious food. Definitely our new go to pizza joint!
Great food, great staff and AWESOME beer! keep up the good work! We will always stop here on our way to Sedona! the polenta was amazing an

I live around the corner from LGO/Postino Arcadia and am a regular and fan of both. Windsor is great as well. Federal is a disappointment and tragedy. I'm not sure whether all these positive reviews are paid for by Federal or sponsored, or just by clueless foodies because they are outright lies. For a restaurant group that makes amazing pizza's at LGO, I'm shocked as too how disappointing and what a big letdown the pizzas are here. They are all overly oily and soggy in the middle. I've tried four different pies on two separate occasions and everyone in my party felt the same way and it didn't sound like anyone was going to go back for a while until the soggy dough and oily topping issues were fixed. When I was there on 11/08/2012 a co-worker had a stellar meatball sandwich, soft airy fresh baked pizza dough as the bread, fresh melted mozzarella, great meatballs and sauce, simple, traditional and delicious. Went back on 11/11/2012 to have the meatball sandwich that looked so good a few days earlier, talk about being letdown. For some reason the sandwich had been reinvented, it now had barely any meatballs on it and they had been supplemented with a ridiculous amount of caramelized like onions and the bread which was amazing on the previous occasion was hard as a rock. What in the world, massive amounts of onions on a meatball hero with barely any meatballs to be found, confusing. The pizza was no better, still soggy in the middle and disappointing. All restaurants have kinks to work out when they first open, but for a successful restaurant group that's hit homeruns with pizza before, there should be no kinks to work out with the pizza, nor should the simplest thing in the world, a meatball hero go from amazing to gross in three days. Another issue we experienced both times there is the service. Plenty of staff onsite, the problem is finding someone to help you or them coming back to check on you. Both times we sat around with empty drinks for a half-hour and had to hunt down someone to get a refill or the check. Plus this staff is very different than the staff at their other establishments, seems like a bunch of self-entitled hipsters that are too important are running the show. I'll stick to LGO for pizza from this crew; hopefully they don't experiment with that perfect formula.

Went there for a pizza fix and glad I did. Place was cozy and staff was great.  My husband and I both got a beer flight and both of our beers were warm which was so disappointing. Who likes warm beer??!  We started off with a chopped salad (which they separated in two bowls) and Arancini (fried risotto balls). Both were yummy and definitely would order the arancini again.  We couldn't decide on which kind of pizza to get and was split between 4. The waitress gave us the option of getting all 4 different styles in two 12 inch pizza. Score! We got the at last, casanova, manifesto, and Brussel sprouts pizza. Yes we were starving. They were all surprisingly good. My favorite was the Casanova because of the subtle sweetness to it from the dates. Of course we ended up taking it home because our eyes are always bigger than our stomachs.  We topped off dinner with a berry cobbler topped with Madagascar vanilla ice cream. Wasn't my favorite but my husband liked it.  I would definitely come here again for their pizza.

First of all my welcome was a well come...my server right away helped me with picking different selection of beers. That's a start. The meatball pizza is absolutely delectable. Actually it's the smiling cozy server that makes the food appetizing. Definitely coming back here again.

First of all YOU CAN GET GOURMET PIZZA, BEER AND WINE IN THE DRIVE THRU!!!  That alone gets them some stars in my book!!!   The staff have always been good.. Even when I was with a group of NINE eight year-old boys, our waitress had the patience of a saint.  The people eating there are usually pretty friendly - more than what you normally find randomly dining  - just lots of super chill folks there... My theory is that the place is so good, it puts guests in a good mood so everyone is happy and friendly.  Or maybe it just makes me feel so happy that I see it all that way, either way... a good experience all around.    My favorites here:  The "At Last", "The Answer" and "Sweet Potato" Pizzas - all very unique and unlike your average pizza joint.  AMAZING!  Oh, and I hate brussel sprouts but the way they make them, they are actually good to me - so I am no longer a "brussel sprouts hater"

$5 pitchers all day til 5.  Count. Me. In!!!!  They have outstandinf beer on tap. I love the collete beer! I try everything once, I ordered a pitcher of a local brewery I hadn't heard of and the buyers were actually there. With that being said they bought my pitcher and I didn't know until afterwards. The patio is great for people watching, Postinos and Joy ride are around the corner if you want to hop around.  Food. You literally cannot go wrong with anything off the lunch menu or any sort of pizza. Their sauce is amazing!

Omg!!! I love their pizza!!! I actually don't eat pizza because I love rice! I can eat like 6 bowls at the same time but I never have been able to eat more than two pieces(sad I know). But guess what? I ate 3 pieces tonight because it is really good!! Ohhh yeah I'm in heaven now. Okay okay and the service was very friendly as well!

This place is awesome. Great food, service, atmosphere,and drink choices.  Parking can be improved and can the prices lowered.  Many options to pick from to include a variety of appetizers.  A definite 4 star pick and on my list for frequent return visits.

There's just something about this whole part of town I enjoy.  I haven't had any food in the area that I haven't liked yet.  I was invited here by some friends and was blown away by the choices.  The crust was perfect, the service was quick and their beer selection, while small, was great.  I look forward to many more visits in the future.

So I was bouncing back and fourth between Federal Pizza and Lou Malnati's - Come to find out Federal Pizza has this awesome deal, which includes a bottle of wine and pizza... I mean, how can you beat that?! We decided on a bottle of still rose, which was recommend to us by our server Nicole. I was damn near starving, so we ordered the meatball trio and OMG so freakin' yummy. There were so many tasty looking options, so I just told our server to pick a salad and a pizza for us. She did not disappoint!!! She brought out the chop salad (a salad with soppressata?! YUM!) and the Casanova (sweet AND savory). We left with full tummies and the service was just so on point! Big thanks to Nicole for rolling the dice for us. This deal is on Mondays and Tuesdays, but our experience was so great, we will go any day of the week!
Awesome atmosphere....great specials on Monday and Tuesday's.  The service and food were on point all the way around.  Will def repeat when back in the area.

One of my all-time favorite pizza places! If you're looking for craft beers, excellent wine selections and creatively inspired pizzas then Federal is perfect for you. If you're looking for the standard pepperoni pizza and a Bud Light... well... maybe not the place for you.  Their roasted Brussel Sprouts and Smashed Potatoes are excellent appetizers - I could eat them all day long. As a vegetarian my favorite pizza is the At Last!  Layers of goat cheese, broccolini, corn, fresno chilies, mozzarella, lemon zest and a garlic olive oil sauce make this a party in your mouth. (Like I said, creative and inspired pizza!)  Happy Eating!
Delicious olives and the wine and Casanova pizza was absolutely delicious! Happy service, wonderful night.

Sat at the bar on a busy Monday night and ordered the balsamic vinegar roasted Carrots and Broccolini.  Good not wow!  Nicely roasted but rather simple which is nice too.  Didn't get much of the balsamic but still enjoyable.  Then the Meatball Pizza. Please keep in mind that I have been incredibly spoiled when it comes to pizza being from NY and having traveled throughout Italy.  Overall, very good and a premium product. Sauce could have a bit more Pop however the understated tomato sauce let the very delicious meatball and caramelized onion flavor sing!  Crust/dough, also very well done but not the best I have had either.    Overall, very enjoyable and great service from Josh at the bar!  Well done guys.   Your Truly,   The Official Pizza Snob : )

I went here with a group of friends for an after school lunch and we had mediocre to low customer service. When we were paying, the waiter came and told us to go home and talk to our parents about proper tipping and reservation etiquette.... we are 18. We had made reservations a day before and tipped 20 percent which was very generous considering the lack of service we received. He came back and gave us money that was supposed to be for the tip and told us that we were rude and kids like us need to learn how to tip. We very kindly and calmly told him the money he gave us back was for the tip. He told us that "if that is the case then I eat my words" but never actually apologized for the incident. He then proceeded to walk away and not thank us nor apologize to us on our way out. He had no right to talk to us like that nor tell us that "he would like us to go home and talk to our parents about it".

Discovered this one on Yelp! This place is awesome; it's my goto place now to satisfy a pizza craving. This place would be perfect for a happy hour -- there are so many pizza and beer options, it was actually hard to land on something. After my friends and I got our pizzas though, I realized I would have enjoyed any of the options. You really can't go wrong. The atmosphere is dim and intimate, yet it still feels friendly enough to invite your coworkers. The décor is trendy and a lot of seating options inside and outside. I expect to come back here a lot, especially after discovering it has a drive-thru!

The food was good.  The service was better.  I ordered the Big Star pizza, sans mushrooms and olives.  When it came out, there were no mushrooms (allergy) but there were olives (preference).    The manager came over and rather unexpectedly comped our dinner.  That was totally unnecessary!  I'd have just picked the olives off, and would have paid for the pizza.    What it shows is that this company places excellence above all else.  I'm in.  I'll be back.  Oh, and I left the server a great tip.  The entire staff deserved it.
The pizza is delicious and I love love love the wine coolers. The atmosphere is trendy but relaxing.

Never knew great pizza until I tried this place. Simply tasty, especially the local sausage. Yes, they messed up the order so we waited a bit for our food, but they were honest about the mistake and gave us a bill credit. Anxious to return!

Another great restaurant by Upward Projects!  This location is in a great neighborhood situated off central in a remodeled bank of architectural significance to Phoenix. The Federal is a great urban, trendy pizza restaurant that serves unique, gourmet pizza that your chef creates with customized fresh ingredients unlike any other in town save Pizzeria Bianco. Even the crust is tasty and cannot be left on your plate. There are so many choices and the atmosphere us young and hip. I do love the background music but it could be played a bit lower to allow conversation. I will go back again and again!

Where do I begin...We went for dinner and got a Caesar salad with a Margherita pizza. The Caesar salad wasn't dressed well, whatever, it was just a filler for the pizza we were waiting for. Here's the thing, what we ordered was definitely NOT a Margherita pizza. Sure I have high expectations for pizza coming from NYC but this was far from Margherita; no red sauce, cheese and tomatoes for toppings? The crust was VERY doughy and not at all well done. Nope nope nope. Good service though but definitely wont be back.

Never disappointed. (I'd say that about all of the Upward Project restaurants though.)  I've been to FP a few times now and have to say, its always been a pleasant experience, good wait staff, chill vibe, not to loud and not rushed.    Today I had the salad chop, it was good, I can't figure out the dressing but I have no complaints, I'll let them keep their secret.  We had the brussel sprouts with pancetta, a little bit heavy on the lemon but we still ate the entire thing.  The beets with pears was strange, good, but strange, not sure I would order it again.  The wine list is good, I'm particularly fond of the Sivas-Sonoma Cab.   I'll be back, no question there.
Wandered in after a miss at Joyride and we were happy we did.   The beer selection was great, the service was solid, and the pizza was pretty good too.   Will definitely visit again.

Federal Pizza is located in Midtown Phoenix in a busy/congested area. It can be difficult to park, but there is a special lot directly east of the restaurant. The service was great, our server was attentive and the food was solid. The pizza was very good but not the best I've had, that's not to knock it but I've spent a lot of time in Chicago and New York, prime pizza capitals. The wings were awesome though and this spot is definitely worth a try. Keep up the good work guys!
The food, cocktails and ambiance are fantastic! I love the open kitchen concept. The large parking lot is a plus.

My husband and I ate here on a Friday evening.  Not too long of a wait, so that was nice.  I had a pepperoni pizza and he had the Pineapple Express.  Both were quite good.  The service good as well, the waiter was attentive and kept our drinks full.  The atmosphere was good and interesting to see how you turn a bank into a restaurant!  The only reason I decided to go with 4 stars was due to the parking.  Unfortunately, my husband is picky about who drives his car, so he won't do valet.  The parking may not affect everybody.  We would definitely go again.
I have been here a number of times and it is consistently excellent. I love their pizza and they have very interesting drinks. The only thing that can be disturbing for some is that it is very loud.

I wanted to love this place more than I did.  Self parking is a bit tough.  Ended up having to park across the street, cross the major road in front of the gas station and then walk down the block and around the building.  The ambiance is nice.  The service was fabulous and friendly.  We decided to try a half and half pizza.  We went with half patata bianco and half sweet potato.  Both were pretty bland.  We also tried the loaded brussel sprouts and they were amazing looking and just okay tasting.  I did love that they have butter for me to put on my crust.  Big star added for that.

Great new addition to the Central/Camelback corridor!  The group behind Postino, Windsor and Churn have certainly done it again!  The atmosphere is great...very busy and good vibe.  The service was friendly, efficient and made great recommendations.  The food was very tasty too...definitely try the meatballs and grilled veggies as an app and the big star and brussel sprout pizzas were a hit too.  Be prepared to wait 30+ minutes for a table...at least on a Friday night, but it is definitely worth the wait.

My boyfriend and I have been here several times now and we love this spot. The food is delicious and fresh and never disappoints with every new dish we try. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to try a spin on classic Italian food!

I've been meaning to go here for at least year, but almost always wound up at Joy Ride or Postino. Now I grieve that year that was without Federal! I was having a bad day and did not feel like cooking at all or interacting with any more people, and remembered this place has a drive-thru. It took me awhile to figure out what to try, but the girl taking my order on the phone was super patience and helpful. My order was ready when I arrived 15 minutes later and the smells that filled my car were purely intoxicating. When I got home and finally was able to try the handmade ravioli I was starving, but the flavor was so amazing and unique that I had to eat slowly and savor it. Truly one of the absolute best pasta dishes I have had in my life. Italian food in PHX tends to be below subpar, but this, this is a stand alone. I was so blown away I saved a few for my husband for when he got home later. It was still incredible warmed back up. I also had the Great Little Salad, which lived up to its name nicely. Can't wait to go eat in soon!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would. I feel like this pizza was so special, every bite had so much flavor and the crust was not left on my plate. Of course I like add an egg to my mostly vegetarian pizza,  and also you can get pitchers of beer for supercheap. The parking is pretty stupid, but that won't stop me from coming back!
Excellent service, fun bar & delicious food. I go almost every week with friends and everyone always has a fantastic time.
Great selection off beers. Awesome food. Wish they'd build one in the east valley! Hint hint
Really great food and beer. Any place with hoegarden is fine by me but the grilled veggie starter was delightful.

My friend/coworker took me here for lunch today cause she really likes it and knew I had never been. The staff was friendly and attentive. We both had ice tea and it was very refreshing. The orange slice in the ice tea gave it a little extra something. Then we started with the Mister Mister appetizer which was a combination of baby zucchini, artichokes, sweet potatoes, and mozzarella cheese tempura'd served with two different sauces. For our main meal we shared the Federal Chop salad and the Casanova pizza which had dates,ricotta cheese, prosciutto, arugula, and pecorino. Everything was amazing and I would definitely go back and recommend to others.

This place is really good!  The location is perfect and the atmosphere is really urban with a hipster feel to it.  We went during the week and it was semi-busy but we sat at the Pizza bar in front of the kitchen.  The guys in the kitchen were really nice and super talkative which was an added addition.  We ordered the Meatball pizza and the Cesar salad to share.  The salads are a big portion so you can share or have as an entree by itself.  The pizzas are also big enough to share.  The dough had a really good crisp texture and the toppings (cheese, sauce and meatballs) were really fresh and flavorful.  I cannot wait to come back and try some other items on the menu.  I have to agree that the waiters were not overly friendly, they were not rude but didn't go the extra mile to be friendly.  The guys in the kitchen rock though!

Had a fun time at Federal Pizza the other night. For the most part the food was great, I loved the arancini and my friend thought her pasta was excellent. I ordered the cioppino and thought it was okay. My main complaint was that it was seafood in a tomato sauce, as opposed to a stew with broth. Not quite what I'm used to, but it tasted fine. The atmosphere is great and the staff is wonderful. Next time I think I'll go with the pizza which looked delicious.
Such a fun spot! Good beer selection and delicious pizza :) we got the meatball pizza and it was so good! A little on the pricey side, but the atmosphere makes up for it!

This is the best pizza I've had in Phoenix. I don't say that lightly, I've eaten at pizzeria bianco, cibo, spinatos, pizza a metro, and the like. At Federal they use fresh ingredients and it was tasty. Hipsters have infiltrated this establishment though. So if you have a fear of hipsters this isn't the spot for you. The house-made wine coolers are nice as well.
Absolutely great from start to finish appetizers were great as well as the pizza and hand made wine coolers definitely a place to come back to.

Federal Pizza does not disappoint! We live down the street and walk to dine-in at least twice a month. There pizzas and salad are delicious! Their pizza crust isn't too thick and we love their unique topping options. The federal chop salad and the classic caesar salad are our go to options.  We have a toddler so we tend to go around lunch on the weekends or the occasional evening and we have never had a long wait. The staff is friendly but it can be slightly slow at times, but not slow enough that deters us from going back time and time again. Another splendid restaurant from the Upward Projects team.
I love the crispy polenta sticks, could and would eat them everyday. The pizza is really good too. Goat cheese and broccoli on a pizza...yum! This is not your typical pizza joint.

Another Upward Project gem (Postino, Windsor)... This time they take on pizza! And as usual, they know how to tantalize the taste buds. My husband and I sat right up at the counter overlooking the kitchen & wood-fire oven. It was busy & lively. I had a mushroom & green pepper pizza which was good, but I think I will go for one of their pizza creations next time. They look interesting & possibly delicious. I was really impressed with their "Great Little Salad" for $4... It wasn't your usual iceberg, carrot & ranch dressing side salad. It truly was a great & a cheap addition to my pizza! I cannot wait to order a pizza for pick up & pick it up via their drive-thru. How cool huh? Every parent's dream!!! ;-)

group of 12 of us had a great time and great meal.  ordered lots of appetizers that went around the table - tasty assortment!  several craft beer fans in the group were very pleased.  one person ordered a wine cooler which came in an interesting bottle and it was very good.

Just really good pizza and great beer!!! Chicken parm is perfect, don't care that it might cost a lot it's amazing. Pineapple express was great and had a nice kick to it. Will be back at least once a week

A little slow on the service (~10min to get our drinks) , but once the six giggling co-eds left, our server had plenty of attention to give.   The pizza was great, brick oven style. Great selection of house styles, baked fast. Would probably try them again when in the neighborhood.

I thought this might be between a four or three but felt  it earned a four. Service was just a little spotty but you can tell they care and want to run a top notch eatery and that comes through.   Our day started here for lunch before a visit to the museum. We shared the meatballs for an app and the fried polenta was near life changing. I would go back just for that.   For entrees we had salads, me the chicken panzanella and wife had the chopped. Both solid. I appreciate when a place like this, known for pizza in this case, also has good salad and healthier options.   I would go back next time I'm in central, but I would eat at their sister lgo in the neighborhood.

Super fresh, high quality food. This would also make a great happy hour location and can we talk about the awesome lunch specials? For $10.50 you get half a pizza and a salad of your choice and they always have creative choices in pizza. Today I had the patata bianca which is a white pizza with fingerling potatoes, ricotta, prosciutto, and rosemary oil.   First bite:  This is weird.  Second bite:  This is weird and really good. Third bite:  Is there crack in this? Fourth bite:  I love this f#cking pizza!!!!  I like this place, so much YUM!  Also, they have a drive-thru window.  Smart idea, Federal Pizza.

I've always been obsessed with this place because of the pizza. The meatball pizza especially is unbelievable. Their crust is great - wood fired. And the marinara sauce is amazing. Plus their pricing is reasonable.  Not until our last experience did I realize how above and beyond this place is.  My husband and I placed a carry-out order.  We drove up, got our food, and left. As soon as we got home, I noticed I had a missed call. It was Federal - they had forgotten to give us part of our order, and we hadn't even noticed.  They asked if it would be possible to come back by. We came back, got our food, a big apology, and a voucher for a free meal for our next visit.   Best pizza place in Phoenix for sure.
Love it ,from Boston' and went with 7 of us and ate like kings and queens,bartenders,manager,servers,1st class,decor great,food a 10 , this is gonna be are 3rd time back,outdoor seating,love it !!!

I asked my girlfriend is she wanted pizza. We searched by reviews as well as a new place to try and found Federal. Tucked in a quiet and beautiful neighborhood, it was daunting at first to see a full parking lot. As we walked up we noticed a Drive Thru of a sort which makes to go orders fast and easy.  FIRST THINGS FIRST: If you want a hole in the wall, mom and pop, Italian kitchen greasy pizza, this isn't your spot for today's meal.  HOWEVER:  If you want something filling, light, gourmet, and unique to your taste buds, I highly recommend Federal Pizza.  Pros: Everything tastes as if it's made in house. Flavor crossovers I didn't think would work on pizza, but absolutely do. The cooks can be seen making your food. There are handmade wine coolers for the day drinkers. The plating is lovely and the portions are good. The atmosphere is very hip. *Emily is a great server.* There are yummy vegetarian options.  Cons: aside from the alcoholic beverages in which I do not partake, there are limited drink options to the fountain standards. There aren't jalapeños or blue cheese which are a must when I snag a pizza (but on that note, this is the kind of place where every meal or pizza is specific for a reason, and that works in a place like this.)  We got the lunch which is just under $10 per person for a half pizza and your choice of salad or soup. Girlfriend got the soup which was a cauliflower fennel combination (weird but satisfying and vegetarian.) I picked a salad with citrusy stuff in it. The pizza she chose was a cheese pizza (she fears change sometimes) and I snagged one with goat cheese, lemon zest, OMG other goodies.  4.5/10 give it a shot for new and hot.

I am not really a huge fan of fancy pizza, but this pizza was quite delicious. I went for the classic pepperoni and cheese and it was really good. It's a pretty big personal serving of pizza; most likely you will need to take half home. It is on the pricy side, but you can tell the ingredients are fresh and high quality. This restaurant is really cute and right next to a bakery, which is convenient for the sweet tooth after. It was good and I will be back, just not on a regular basis.

AMAZING food here! Chefs special with squash, bacon, arugula, balsamic reduction, and lemon ricotta is to die for. If that pizza isn't available the sweet potato and Brussel sprout pizza are equally as good. Always satisfied!

Amazing pizza place with lots of tasty extras.  Excellent happy hour price for pitchers of good beer ($5).  For pork belly lovers, try the porchetta sandwich.  The beets w/pear side dish is fantastic.  Awesome brussel sprouts with pancetta.  Regarding their pizzas, we almost always get the Casanova, the sweet potato/sage/ricotta and The Answer.  We visit here every 2-3 weeks and have never had a bad experience.

The service was good, and the atmosphere was ok but the pizza was kinda eh. I'm not a fancy ingredient kind of guy so it didn't appeal to me but if that's your thing you'll love it. Kind of a hipster joint lol so the beer list was good.
Wow! So delicious! I actually had a dream about it after eating there last night so it was like reliving the amazing pizza all over again. I will never eat at another pizza place.
Love this place! Cool little hipster spot! Great pizza, great service! Me and my gf love this place.
First time, and I'll be back! The beet salad and roasted veggies were wonderful. Really good desserts too. Service was excellent, unlike Windsor, there is plenty of parking.

Since going to Federal Pizza for the first time last Thursday (as in July 25th) I have now been there three times in the last week.  3!!  I am addicted to the watermelon and mint wine coolers (only $5 at lunch).  I have had the meatball pizza, margarita pizza and caprese sandwich.  ALL DELISH!!  Obviously I'll be back...tomorrow perhaps :)

I have so much love for the Upwards family, and Federal has been a favorite for ages!  Our favorite is to come by on a Monday or Tuesday and split the Big Star, well done, with a pitcher of beer. The pizza is consistently perfect and we love the rotating seasonals. The Brussels are an awesome side!   Today - PLOT TWIST! - we got two lunch specials and shared a pitcher. Half a pizza and a salad for $10.50, no brainer!  I was surprised that the pizzas were literally single pizzas, half of the normal size. I kind of chuckled to myself, imaging MJ shaping little football sized pieces of dough for this purpose. Ha! Delicious anyway.

WARNING! The gluten-free crust looks and tastes like pre-made frozen crust. It was flat, flaccid, deflated, and perforated--just like boxed gf pizza. The toppings were skimped on.   The rest of the pizzas looked delicious. Places can and do make delicious gf pizza that tastes like actual human food. Federal can't do that. If you want a gluten-free pizza that doesn't taste, well, just bad, go to Cibo.  The delicious-looking pizzas in all of those photos are not gluten-free.

I ordered chicken parmigian,  chicken Ceasar salad and Margarita pizza.  Chicken parm was burned to a crisp,  completely unedible,  Ceasar salad was drenched in lemon juice, completely unedible  (chicken for salad was good,  came in seperate container) and the pizza,  the whole thing had about a 3 dimes (size wise) of cheese.  We called the restaurant and they said "take up your concerns with uber eats".   ZERO customer service or care.  Don't bother with this restaurant, everything from the food to customer service was unbelievably terrible.   Mistakes happen, but the level of not caring about our experience was off the charts unexceptable.

My husband and I stopped in for our first experience last Sunday afternoon.  AMAZING!! My husband mentioned it may be the best pizza he's ever had.  We had the Patricia Jane salad and a Casanova Pizza.  They were both very good with a lot of fresh flavor.  The flavor combination of the Casanova was the perfect combination of sweet and salty and the crust was perfectly soft crust but crispy edges and not to chewy.  I would highly recommend FP if your looking for a great pizza.  And they have a drive up window, how cool is that!  If only I lived closer.
Place always delivers.  Solid beer, solid pizza, solid meatball sub, etc.  They don't have gluten free pizza, but they will in July.

I must need to try this place again. Either that, or I just don't get it. The atmosphere is pretty chill, really low lit at night. I liked that. Our server was really nice and attentive. The food wasn't bad at all. We got the Margherita pizza and I just didn't really think it was that great. The wine coolers weren't as amazing as everyone made them out to be either. It felt like I was drinking wine watered down with juice and ice. They do come in cool bottles though. This place is totally good, but I just wasn't blown away by it.
Best pizza in Phoenix forget Bianco. This is the spot. Get a veg board app and thank me later
My favorites are the Brussel Sprout pizza and a growler of Chubs. Couldn't be any better.

11/13/16 I'm from the East Coast.....so.....my search for pizza like home has been on the 4 months that I've been here. I've tried Barros and NYPD...both disappointing. This pizza right here definitely hit the spot. I HATE doughy pizza and this pizza was the total opposite of that....SCORE!!!! I ordered the lunch special half pizza half salad. Caesar salad and pepperoni pizza. The dressing was on the peppery side, but not too much where it killed my taste buds...very flavorful. The pizza was tasty and thin just how I like it. Cant wait to try some of the unique combinations that they have on their menu.  When I called to place my order, they were friendly and professional. That drive thru is tricky...I was looking for a window, but it's a door! The person who took my payment and brought my food out  was friendly as well.

Great service! Great Food! Fabulous ambiance! Fabulous attentive staff; Not pretentious at all. These UPWARD PROJECTS Group are smart, innovative and awesome. Wish them much success. Can't wait to try their new venture, Joy Ride Taco right next door.

So I have been to Federal a couple of times before for their drinks with friends and was always happy with what I got. Their wine coolers are delicious and since they have been open for a while now I think they may have gotten stronger (liquor wise). HOORAY because for me 8 bucks for that drink is a lot. But I feel it is well worth it now. :)  Now for the food, yummmmy! The Burrata is amazing, then we had a chop salad and the margherita pizza with prosciutto. It was all so yummy. This was shared between me, my husband and a friend and we all left very satisfied.   Here is my ONLY STIPULATION. The pizza's are so small for the price. I understand a lot of places are going this "we use top quality ingredients for our toppings" however, they did not put enough prosciutto to make me believe it was worth the overall 15 dollar 12" pizza size. Just my opinion.  Otherwise, atmosphere nice, people friendly and staff pretty friendly too. Just be prepared for the crazy parking!

I'm so glad that I finally got to try Federal Pizza!  I had heard so many good things about it over the years and can finally be one of those persons that spreads the good news.    Our server was wonderful.  He gave us some really good recommendations, like the pizza.  He recommended the Brussel Sprout Pizza.  OMG.  It was perfection!  I love anything brussel sprouts, but was still was a little skeptical about it.  Now, I would recommend it to anyone.  If you like brussel sprouts and pancetta, this is the pizza for you! You can't beat the $5 dollar pitchers of beer for happy hour.  They do offer happy hours on the weekends on pitchers of beer, coolers and glasses of wine.    I can't wait to come back!

I have written one good and one bad review about this place.  This time it is neutral.  While the food is awesome, the service theory works best when the place is mostly empty and fails when the place is busy.  The have one point person but everyone is suppose to work for your table which causes people to be over served or under served.  I love the concept but it needs to be determined is it the servers or the practice.  Maybe it would be better to split the floor on busy nights having 4 people for half the place and 4 for the other half.  As always the food is awesome.  Oh yeah, as you can see in the pictures, they are very unprofessional and do not make the pizza look as good as it tastes.  I saw a guy in there taking new pictures with no imagination so I take it those pics are going to be even just as or more disappointing.  Do not let them distract you.  The food is fresh and their take on things is awesome.
I was really looking forward to this place, as I'm crazy for Postino's. It was alright.  The pizza was just alright in my book.  I enjoyed the wine coolers more than the pizza.

Highly recommend, wonderful food, adequate wine selection and atmosphere that wasn't too loud for conversation but still was rockin'  Ms. D and I were busy running errands in the area and didn't have time to cook so she suggested we turn to Yelp and have dinner out.  A quick look in the area and we decided to try Federal Pizza (noticed Federal was near our favorite Postino).  We arrived in casual clothes and although it was a 30 min wait we were seated quickly.  I was starving and we got on our orders of The TLC Salad and a Big Star pizza.  For a first visit we nailed it; the salads was fresh, crisp and flavorful while the pizza was amazingly wonderful crust with fresh ingredients.  The sauce was the only ambiguous part of the meal as it didn't really come through; not that this is a bad thing just that the fresh toppings and the wonderful crust was so overwhelmingly good.  Ms. D enjoyed her Home made cooler and I thought the Primitivo wine wasn't especially great.  But did I mention the crust on the pizza was tasty (LOL).  Parking is a bit weird and while they have complimentary Valet which only allows one way entrance I did not really want to check my car that evening.

Love this spot. Great food, service, and atmosphere. My favorite pizzas are the Manifesto and the Casanova. They have a drive thru for to go orders and serve growlers. I've sat at the pizza bar area a couple times and enjoyed watching the pizzas being made. Overall, I'd highly recommend.

Probably the best pizza in town.   We stopped by after a day at the pool at a buddy's place and we had a great time. The beer selection was outstanding, the staff was super friendly, and the pizza was superb.   We also indulged in the bombolini, which was a perfect way to end a meal.   We'll be back for sure.

Federal Pizza is truly awesome.  I am a fan of the marguerita pizza, I like to keep it simple when it comes to pizza.  The tomatoes are so fresh, it really blew me away.  Everyone at the table loved their food.  I've been in three times and each time Federal Pizza blows me away.  The staff is supper friendly.  One more recommendation, the doughnuts are fresh, soft and fluffy.  Not to be missed.

LOVED IT!  It was a perfect dinner!  I went with a group of 5 and we each picked a different entree and a few appetizers to share, we also got a few pitchers of beer and my friend and her date got the wine coolers.  Everything was delicious, fresh ingredients, the service was amazing.  John, was the server who showed us to our table.  What a gentleman, very courteous and knowledgeable!  Ask for him when being seated, you won't be disappointed.  I have a habit of drinking 6-8 glasses of water during dinner and my cup was refilled promptly and I never went thirsty.  The pizza was AMAZING!  The feel of the restaurant is very cool, the lighting is great, I would even go there on a date.  I can't wait to go back!  I am not sure which of the pizzas was my favorite since I tried 3 different ones and they were all amazing.

I can't tell if it was high expectations from all the hype that caused my disappointment or the food in general.   After hear a lot about how good this place was I decided it would make a good spot for date night. Came in at 6 on a Sunday and were sat immediately.   Having previously stalked the menu I asked about the Mister Mister appetizer. Was given a vague description describing it basically as a veggie plate with some dipping sauce. What came was actually pretty good but it was cheese sprinkled crispy veggies (I think lightly fried) with 2 dipping sauces it was pretty good.  As for the pizza we got the Casanova and Manifesto. The casanova was fine but I felt like the dates had over powered the prosciutto (which seemed to be lacking some flavor) and the combo wasn't anything special as I feel like every place has a bruschetta just like this. The manifesto was also okay but I felt like the sausage was very bland and plain and the goat cheese didn't mesh well with the other flavors. The mushrooms were the star of that pizza by far.  On both pizza's i felt like the crust was good but soggy in center. I think overall it was somewhere between thing crust and regular which is a no mans land for pizza crusts. The flavor was good but not amazing.  Dessert may have been the most disappointing thing. We got the Lil' tripple which if you have ever had jello chocolate pudding with an oreo and some cool whip you have already experiences. I was expecting some more unique flavor from this but really oreo pudding snack packs have the same taste.  Maybe my expectations were too high for this place but I walked away feeling like for the money there are other places I would rather go and it isn't even in the league with Bianco. For me it also isn't somewhere I would being making the trip to go to again except for maybe a happy hour if other people where there. There is nothing wrong with the pizza but I think the place is overhyped.

Four stars for the pizza. Three stars for everything else.   Walking in, I couldnt help feeling that this place was a chain (like a national chain). I dont have much to say about this other than I never felt completely comfortable. Our waitress was decent at being cordial, but she didnt seem very attentive during our meal. I had to flag her down twice for water and the check. I like that they have craft beer on tap, but their selection was not my favorite. I ordered the half pizza half salad, since they dont do by the slice. The pizza was actually pretty damn good. I like the combination of toppings they offer, as well as the additional items you can add. Granted the good stuff to add makes the pizza way more expensive but thats just the way it goes. The bread was soft yet firm, and the veggies were fresh. The salad unfortunately was drenched in dressing and lacked much flavor. If i were you, I would skip the salad all together.   Come here for pizza. Other than that, I would be careful of what to expect. It might be enjoyable or it might be just OK. I wouldnt mind trying thir other pizzas though.

Super good! We went during happy hour- we both got drinks/split a $16 pizza/got the fingerling potatoes/ kid's pizza and it was $40. Service was fast and super personable! Also they make their ranch and it's THE BOMB, weird but trust me get some just to try it.
Awesome.  I know it is strange to say but this pizza joint had the best cauliflower I have ever had.  Great service and excellent food

Damn good pizza and unlike joy ride next door, darn good service. I have absolutely loved it every time I have been here and i keep coming back for more. The bar tenders are friendly and know their stuff and make excellent pairing recommendations.   The pizza is absolutely wonderful and I cannot say there is one I do not like. If I did not feel like one topping or the other they are always happy to accommodate and swap it out for something else. My only complain is that this is the place that makes you want to bury your diet kind of pizza so be warned you will wind up eating way more than you thought.

The meatball pizza here will change your life. I've enjoyed every pizza I've had here, and there are so many unique styles to choose from. They also have a great beer selection and offer growlers. If you order pick up, there's a convenient drive through.   On top of the delicious food, the staff is always cheerful, friendly, and efficient. Food is delivered in a reasonable amount of time, my water glass was never empty, the hostess smiles and welcomes guests with a genuine smile, and the waitress was upbeat and helpful.
Cool pizzas, all kinds of different blends. Shared a couple of pizzas with my friend and both were really good. Had the meatball pizza and "the answer", can recommend them both.

Schooled in Napoli but not beholden to its rigid regulations. Sourced locally and allowed to be as creative as our current tastes. In short another great addition to a city already steeped in world class pizza.  The place has a non pretentious  community feel and it gets added points for having a parking lot that hasn't been commandeered by Valet profiteers.
love, love, love. get there early for a table outside (before it's hot). pizza's are great, and we usually do pepperoni + peppers + basil and it's delish.

I went here for the first time today for lunch. The food was amazing and the service was outstanding! We shared a pizza which was a perfect size and also ordered the wine coolers. The wine coolers were GREAT! I had the raspberry and lavender wine cooler and am now trying to figure out how I can make them at home! I am looking forward to making this one of my new regular spots. Can't wait to go back!

5 stars to Federal. By far my favorite pizza jaunt in Arizona.  They are legit. From recommendations about drinks to the pizzas and small bites.  Had a meaty pizza by suggestion from the bar staff and it was perfect. The crust crispy the meat was a higher quality and you could taste it.  Had a few beers and great conversation with the team that took care of us.  I've been here many times and every time it's a blast and we are able to grub happily. Keep it up.
We sat at the bar as we only went for a beer and dessert. We had the triple berry cobbler which was good. The pizza looked good, but we were full already.

It's adorable, it's tasty and they have great deals!  Love this place!  FOOD: The pizza crust is lovely!  Ask for some olive oil on the side if you're into dipping.  After several visits with a vegan friend,  I can personally assure you that the At Last and the Sweet Potato taste great vegan-ized.  They pile the veggies on more generously to make up for the missing cheese, which is really nice.  The At Last tastes wonderful with the cheese, as well!    Last night we also tried the tender, tasty Pumpkin Ravioli (without the pancetta, which might make it even better).  It had a lovely, creamy flavor and delicious chunks of  weird veggies (like turnips and rutabaga) on top.  It wasn't too big to finish all by myself.  ATMOSPHERE: The decor is 50s and a little swanky, but the atmosphere is perfectly casual.  There's a TV over the bar so you can catch the D-Backs score, plus cozy booths and a real candle on the table for romance.  The service is top notch - genuinely nice people from hostess to server to the nice lady who kept filling my water.    DEAL: Monday and Tuesday nights, you can get a bottle of wine (or two pitchers of beer) and a pizza for $20.  They'll even cork the wine so you can take it home if you don't polish it off.  I think the pizzas are supposed to be 12 inches but seem bigger to me.  Looking forward to our next meet-up there!

YUM!  Things I love about Federal Pizza: Casanova pizza, Wedge salad, using the drive thru to pick up a pizza AND a bottle of wine (that is 1/2 price when bought at drive-thru), Tuesdays pizza and bottle for $20.  Things I don't love: I can't eat pizza every day.
Always great service and terrific food...definitely my favorite Upward Concept! Fun and relaxing atmosphere, very friendly down to earth employees too.

Yep, I love it!  In fact, I have found my new favorite cocktail, the Grapefruit Ginger wine cooler.  I do not care that I am not supposed to have grapefruit juice.  It is so worth it.  I started with 5 stars for this drink.  As for the pizza.  I apparently like roasted brussels sprouts, at least when paired with pancetta, manchego, and garlic.  The Manifesto was not to be outdone, though. Schreiner's sausage, mushrooms, goat cheese...a big ole slice of good.  My husband, the pizza purist, gave high marks to the pepperoni, too!  And these are good-sized pizzas.  Three pies for three people was ridiculous, but we all wanted something different.  My arm did not have to be twisted to take the leftovers.  I only wished we had tried the polenta sticks.  Next time.

Federal Pizza is a wonderful, cool and hip place. Service is excellent and welcoming and the food super yummy and flavorful. I highly enjoyed the ambiance of this place and the Staff.  My friends and I had a fantastic time and it was my first experience here.  Take advantage of their Monday and Tuesday night specials that include: pizza and either your choice of a bottle of wine or 2 pitchers of beer for ONLY $20!  I heard they also own the Joyride and other neighboring restaurants, I MUST check it out since this place was a hit!   We had a very opposite experience earlier today at Cibo and this place definitely made up for it!  Thank you Federal Pizza and friends that made this evening GREAT. We'll be back!!!! :)

I have yet to find anything here I don't realllly enjoy.  Last night the bf and I shared the campari tomato appetizer before chowing on pizza.  This is sort of their caprese salad... They roast a few campari tomatoes and serve them up with fresh mozzarella, a healthy portion of aged balsamic, drizzle of olive oil and a few basil leaves.  That cheese is seriously melt-in-your-mouth delicious. And the buttery-ness of the cheese goes jut perfectly with the acidity in the tomatoes and balsamic.  A sprinkle of fresh-cracked pepper and sea salt is the cherry on top.  If you're an olive fan, it should go without saying to try Castelvetrano olives as well.  As for pizzas, I absolutely love the Casanova.  The Answer is really good as is the Manifesto.  I even enjoy the Brussels Sprout pizza.  I'm leaning toward the Sweet Potato pizza next time with sausage added to make it a bit more savory. As with most restaurants, I have yet to make it to the dessert menu... If you are in the mood for adult beverages, their house made wine coolers are light and refreshing.  They have a good craft beer and nice wine list too.  On Monday and Tuesdays after 8pm, you can get a pizza and 2 sm pitchers OR a bottle of wine for only $20.  If you don't want to drink and then drive, you can get this same deal through their carry out window.  Winning!!

Arrived on a Saturday night around 8pm and the restaurant was full with a 30 minute wait.  Not sure what I was expecting, but was surprised, as moving to uptown Phoenix recently, I have found most restaurants close early and restaurants seem to clear out by 9pm.  Federal Pizza is an exception as it stays open as late as midnight on Friday & Saturday nights.    The evening started out perfectly, as once we checked in, we were offered drinks while we waited.  Time always seems to go by quicker with a cocktail in hand.  After about a  20 minute wait, we were seated.  The restaurant is beautiful, clean and smelled great.  We ordered a combination pizza and a couple appetizers.  The pizza had wonderful flavors but the only flaw was a less than crispy crust, that I blame on all of the toppings.  Next time we might try something without so many toppings.    As parking is tight in this neighborhood, you must use the valet or expect a bit of a walk.  As I have mentioned in previous reviews, I am not a big fan of valet and even worse, the valet guy called me "Boss" which for some reason rubs me the wrong way.  Message to valet guys, I prefer to be called "Sir" or 'Your Majesty"
Great ambiance with mediocre pizza. Neither my friend nor I were particularly impressed with the food.

If you're a fan of Windsor or Postino and love pizza, just go to Federal Pizza already. The spot is owned by Craig DeMarco's Upward Projects, too, and it has the same hip vibe all the other restaurants do -- with good food, as always, too.  The interior actually reminds me a little of Chelsea's Kitchen, with warm lighting and a homey feel. There's a bare bones patio facing the street, and the servers tend to be young and have their own style because of the lack of uniforms. The joint is casual -- I even went right after teaching a workout class, and no one seemed to care about my grungy attire.  The drink menu is simple, with beers and flavored wine coolers. I got a lavendar raspberry one, which was delivered in an oh-so-cute little jar-like glass. The cooler was refreshing and tasted like flavored Sprite -- I'd recommend trying one.  I started my meal with an appetizer -- foolishly, considering just about everyone at my table got individual pizzas, which are way too huge and should be shared! I got vegan black bean soup of the day ($3), which was decent but a little bland -- I loved the crunchy texture of the soup from the veggies, though.  For my pizza, I got a simple cheese pizza with olives ($12), which I could only eat two out of six slices of. The pizza was really crispy, almost burnt on the edges, and it just wasn't my favorite type of pizza -- I much prefer the floppier style of Cibo.  Still, it's nice to have another central Phoenix pizza option, and it's right across the street from the to-die-for Churn -- which alone makes the trip to Federal Pizza worth it.

Is this good pizza? Is this great pizza? Could it possibly be superb pizza? Nope, this is quite honestly the melt-in-your-mouth, gobble up every bite, ditch the diet type of pizza and I'm completely sold!   I came here for the first time on a blustery, windy and rainy day. After jumping through raindrops, I stepped foot inside and was immediately welcomed by a scent of pizza dough baking in the oven while warm air welcomed my cold toes. They seated me in a cozy table that allowed a visual of both the restaurant and the kitchen, so I was able to see the action come alive!   After looking at the menu, my lunch guest and I decided to share the Big Star pizza and the Chicken Panzanella. Both were spectacular! The Big Star pizza had a perfectly baked crust that was the ideal blend of chewy and crunchy. Layers of cheese, olives, peppers, pepperoni and sausage topped the pizza crust. It's the kind of pizza that makes you sneak a second and third piece on your plate. It's the kind of pizza that makes you forget about the wedding dress you have to fit into in two months. It's just that good! The salad was also delicious but obviously didn't compare to the pizza. However, it did fill me up so that I stopped myself from consuming yet another piece of the pizza! The chicken on the salad is grilled which gives it a smoky flavor and the vegetables add a nice flavor. All I can say is that the Postinos/Windsor family have done it yet again! They are really making the Camelback and Central corridor a foodie's delight!   One other item I'd like to note: Are you a beer drinker? Not only do they have a detailed selection of craft beer, but they also sell growlers that you can take home with you. If you pick up food to-go, you can fill a growler for half price. Not a bad deal if you ask me!

Great vibe and decor the pizza was great so was the pumpkin ravioli.  The wine and beer selection was more than adequate. The service was great very attentive and friendly. I would highly recommend a visit you will be glad you did

Took a co-worker for lunch here and it never disappoints! We sat up at the bar and we both ordered the lunch special (any 1/2 pizza and 1/2 salad of your choice). I decided to keep it pretty basic this trip and just get the pepperoni pizza and caesar salad. My co-worker got the caesar salad and the margarita pizza. She really enjoyed it as much as I did too. The bartender was great too! Her customer service was top notch!!  I will certainly be back soon!!!

It's been a super long time coming but I did want to update my review. After I submitted my first review the company reached out to me maybe 3 days or so after I posted the review and offered me a gift card to come back and try again.   So I did, and this time instead of sitting outside I sat at the bar so it would hopefully be a completely new experience. I didn't have to wait as long for food or anything this time however the bartender seemed uninterested in us at all. I am not a very demanding person, nor was my company however it's nice when you are checked up on and that your drinks are full. Maybe it's just me, but the person I was with commented on it before I did.  I like the location, and overall I really want to like this place. Maybe I've just gotten some bad luck but it still has deterred me from going back.

I went here on Veteran's day and sat on the patio to watch the parade. The service was good, but a little slow since we were on our lunch hour and needed to get back to the office. The pizza was so yummy! I went with two friends, and we each got different pizzas to try them out, and swapped leftovers to take home a variety. Yes, it was good even when I heated it up later.   I'll go again at dinner time and post a follow-up review once I try drinks and maybe a salad.

Drive thru pizza, beer and wine to go? ?,you've got me! !! Refurbished bank, now a cool pizza place.  The bartenders are super nice,  they have a good beer and wine selection.  They also have a $20 dollar deal for pizza and bottle of wine on Monday and Tuesdays.  Try the margerita pizza with pepperoni, is not in the menu but they will make it!
Great Tap selection priced right beer outside seating.

Had been wanting to go to Federal Pizza forever and finally was able to get a sitter on a weeknight and took advantage of the pizza and bottle of wine for $20. Got the Casanova and it was great! Although my husband loves dates (and ricotta and prosciutto) he was a little worried but it was amazing! A sweeter pizza, but the creaminess of the ricotta, the saltiness of the prosciutto and the freshness of the arugula were great balance. We ordered the Brussels sprouts w/ pancetta on the side (mostly because it was a toss-up for the Brussels sprouts pizza) and they also helped balance the sweetness of the pizza. Can't wait for the next weekday date night :) so we can try all the pizzas.

Took my family here while they were visiting from Michigan. To quote, "I think this is the best margherita pizza I've ever had." and "Why can't we have cool places like this at home?"  Service was great, food was awesome. The homemade wine coolers are the bomb dot com. We ordered the grilled veggie board, fingerling potatoes and three different pizzas - all was exceptional. Pretty good sunset view too!

Hoeegarden on tap and Ayinger bottles! Awesome! Some of the best pizza Ive ever had, completely different from anything else there is.  Owned by the same people who run Postinos and Windsor, so this trendy little place gets packed.

Underwhelming.    After reading reviews I was super excited to try this place, but it was just okay- mediocre if anything.   I tried the manifesto and it was pretty bland. The sausage was good but there was only a couple pieces on the whole pie, same for the mushrooms.   Normally I make my own pizza from scratch and grill it, but I had a craving and didn't feel like cooking. Maybe I just caught them on an off night, but I can't really recommend the place.   The atmosphere and service was great - I walked inside to get my takeout pizza.    Not awful by any means, but not worth all the hype and $14.

Don't stop here.   I had the grilled artichoke and it was not cooked all the way thru.   The Caesar salad was mostly wilted lettuce and I had to ask for more dressing.   I am sorry I wasted my time and ate here.

Federal Pizza. The place is located right and feels very well built.The material- and color composition makes sense to me. Great center booths. I like the menu and the pricing is very reasonable.  Despite the fact that the participated evening was the "soft opening" night I think the team handled issues with grace. I will be a fan and a frequent guest! Keep it "up" ;)
Loved this place until the Bartender not only had major attitude - She filled up her personal water bottle at the bar and stuck the soda gun all over the rim of her water bottle - yuck !

This place is dynamo for lunch or dinner and is really as good as it gets.  This restaurant group is amazeballs to begin with (Postino Wine Cafe, Windsor, Churn and a taco joint in the works) and Federal Pizza is another bright star shining in their sky.  The prices are reasonable for this wave of artisan pizza that we are all drowning in, but in my mind so, so worth every penny.  Perfectly thin and crispy crust with delicately distributed toppings and gooey, melty cheese battle for control of your tastebuds in a war where everyone wins. We've tried the sweet potato pizza and brussel sprout pizza and both were unique and taste-tastic.   The service is always top notch and I definitely recommend the fried polenta as an appetizer. Get over the hipster crowd and maybe-too-loud music and enjoy the damn good food.

We tried this place for the first time a few days ago, and it was delicious! We split a pitcher of beer and a Meatball Pizza that was so good. It was pretty messy pizza and the cheese and stuff kept sliding off, but it was still super tasty :)   If you sign up for the email rewards you can actually get a coupon for a free pizza, which is what we did and it was awesome!

Amazing!! The entire pizza menu is so unique- love me boujee pizza options. The whole pizza menu is paired with beers / ciders too! Love that.  Gluten free pizza is an option for an additional $3. Very fair.  Federal pizza, joyride tacos & postino are all part of the same company - so if you like any of those you'll probably love here too!  Super amazing staff too.  Great experience & food here

In the past when I have been here (on a Saturday night coincidentally) the service was excellent. Tonight, the service was terrible. We had to wait for a long while before ordering, before our food came and after we finished and were waiting for the check. No one ever checked on us during the meal or asked if we wanted another glass of wine. Not sure if I will go back or recommend it again. I can get bad service and pay less at Pizza Hut.

Tried Federal Pizza for the first time tonight. Atmosphere is nice, though the restaurant is so dark, its very hard to read the menu. Service was good and food was brought out in a reasonable amount of time. We ordered a pepperoni and mushroom pizza. While my wife enjoyed it, I found it to be way too salty. The pepperoni and the pizza sauce were both too salty for my taste. My wife enjoyed one of their signature 'wine coolers' and the prices on everything was just okay. Overall, they have the location, the atmosphere and the employees - now all they need to do is put the same amount of effort in the food.   Incidentally, when the waiter asked if we wanted Parmesan cheese with the pizza, we expected him to come back with a shaker. Instead he has a cheese grater and cheese and starts grating it over the whole pizza. (My wife wanted parmeson, not me). So that was an unexpected and unnecessary surprise. Best to leave the Parmesan with the customer in case they want more later and can put on as much as they want. This makes more sense with a pasta dish...
The pizza wasn't as good as expected,  very thin crust not to my liking. Might come back to try something different on the menu

The wine coolers! Oh, YUM. If Federal Pizza let you order the wine coolers via take-out, I would be in big trouble.   Don't really like overly dark restaurants, so I've opted to order out, which can be tricky. Their pizza combinations and flavors are good, but the crust doesn't always hold up for take-out. It should be a bit crispier to accommodate for pizzas with heavier toppings like meats and sauces but since you won't have trouble holding back, just make sure to pick it up right when they tell you to so it won't sit overly long. If you're dining in, the crust probably isn't that big of an issue.  I recommend the The Answer (with sausage, apples, fennel, candied... pecans, I think, gorgonzola, and spinach) and Sweet Potato (sweet potato - duh - ricotta and sage). Also check out the Chef's Whim. Have never tried it personally, but I heard the Casanova is also really good!

Love this place!  Great atmosphere food and house specialty drinks.  The pizzas are fantastic here.  My favorite is the Big 5 with sausage pepperoni bell peppers onion and roasted corn.  Please make sure to ask for a side of marinara for the pizza crust which you'll totally going to love...
We were excited, but the vibe and service was not what we were looking for.  We decided to skip on ordering food - great HH drinks tho - could be a better draft selection.

Pizza has definitely improved. We eat here fairly frequently and always bring out of towners.  My parents come from the midwest every winter and stay with us for 1-2 months, and it is a MUST have for my dad...he absolutely loves (and claims to dream about!) their iced tea.  So imagine his excitement, when after telling our waitress how much he loves it, that she pulls him up a growler of the stuff AND sends home a package of the loose leaf so he can brew his own back home.  He literally hugged the waitress and the manager, he was so happy.  THAT, is customer service.  The Manifesto pizza, the sweet potato pizza, and especially the Answer pizza...to die for. And ALWAYS order the meatball appetizer, even if it is just to eat the fried polenta!  Thank you, FP, for making my dad's experience unforgettable.

The BF and I decided to FINALLY venture over to Federal Pizza for a yummy Friday evening.  I've been waiting to try this place for a while, as I LOVE all the Upward Projects restaurants, and have heard rave reviews about their wine coolers and pizza.  We arrived around 8:30pm and the place was hopping for a Friday night, mid-summer... Always a good sign. The hostess greeted us with a warm smile and informed us that we could wait about 20 minutes or we were welcome to sit immediately at their pizza bar or the main bar. Both were full service so we opted to sit at the main bar, and forego the wait.  As we bellied up, Josh, our friendly bartender sporting a bright colored Hawaiian shirt, was quick to say hello and get us started with some waters while we looked over the menu. After a few moments of sipping on a blueberry hibiscus wine cooler and a draft hef, we quizzed Josh on his favorites and decided to start off with his recommendation of Arancini, delectable Fried Risotto balls, with Herb-Stuffed Parmesan & Mozzarella, finished off with Pomodoro Sauce, a sprinkling of Grana Padano. Normally I'm not a huge risotto fan, but boy oh boy, this was a crisp and flavorful delight.   Next, we decided to order the Meatball pizza sans onions, sub mushrooms. The perfect 12' pizza arrived in a prompt time of 15 minutes, with gooey, bubbling mozzarella and the plethora of toppings. I was particularly excited to read on the menu that the handmade dough they used came from MJ Coe, and if you are familiar with that name, you know it's going to be good, and I was right. Normally I'm a crust tosser, but not this time!   We decided to skip on dessert, however I really want to go back and try out their bombolini, described as "warm donuts with chocolate dip"... Umm, yes please!   We finished off with another round of drinks, however I switched from the blueberry hibiscus wine cooler and tried the strawberry rhubarb... Which is now my new favorite drink. It's house made, bubbly and refreshing, even the BF liked it.   Did I mention they have a drive thru as well? Don't feel like dining in? Call it in and pick it up! Definitely coming back to Federal when I'm craving some good pizza and cocktails!

Had a great lunch there today. Pizza crust was chewy, veggies on top of the pizza had great flavor. We ordered a salad with dressing on the side but they brought it out with the dressing mixed in. They quickly made a new one for us and didn't charge us for the salad. Most places wouldn't do this. Class act.

Great service and great food! We ate the Brussel sprouts, side salad and the Casanova pizza  the loaded brussels were a little salty but other than that everything was great. Looking forward to next time!
I love this place! Pizza is top notch. I had the Big Star...wonderful combo of toppings, with the Great Little Salad. Can't wait to go here again!!! And the beer on tap...home run!

Federal Pizza is giving my beloved Parlor pizza a run for its money.  The pizza's are great (I've had the LoneStar, the date and proscuitto as well as the brussel sprouts).  The borrata appetizer is great and they've finally caught on that we need more than two slices of MJ's bread.  The ambience as you can expect is fun and whimsy, this is from the LGO guys after all.....for a casual wine and bruschetta night I'd still go to Parlor.  (Parlor also has better dessert and cocktail selections) but for lunch, or a quick bite I think I'd lean towards Federal if not for the beer selection.

I love that they allow dogs at this restaurant.  The staff are way friendly the food was great. You can't go wrong with any pasta and pizza on the menu.  Today we had the Manifesto Pizza, At Last Pizza, Federal Chop salad and the Lamb Pasta. I totally recommend all of them.

(Lyrics - Olivia Newton John - Physical)  I'm singing all the things that I know you'll like Making good Yelp reviews I gotta order you just right You know what I mean  I took you to a pizzeria  Then added suggested toppings There's nothing left to talk about Unless it's next to Postinos Unless it's horizontally  Let's get Federal, Federal (pizza) I want to get Federal (pizza) Let's get into Federal (pizza) Let me hear your palettes sing, you palettes sing Let me hear your palettes sing    Federal Pizza is in the heart of Phoenix's food mecca; close by to Joyride, Postinos, Lou Malnati's, and Hula's Modern Tiki just to name a few.  I came on a Monday night with a group of friends.  Every Monday and Tuesday after 8pm is pitcher of beer and pizza for ONLY $20....what a deal!  Too bad we came at 6pm haha!  Needless to say, they have a decent selection of local brews.  I ordered a crispy dark lager that night along with some appetizers to start; brussel sprouts and arancini.  The brussel sprouts came well charred and topped with pork belly bacon and sliced almonds.  It was doused with a lemon aioli and came with dipping sauce; it was alright.  My favorite bite of the night had to be the arancini; a fried and breaded risotto ball stuffed with parmesan and mozzarella cheese on a bed of marinara sauce and basil!  The crispy breading with the subtle warm bite of the risotto and cheese melted in your mouth.  I'd be done with this but hey we at Federal "Pizza", so have to try out the pizza.    For our pizza we ordered the Pineapple Express.  Topped with prosciutto, pineapples, calabrian, chili and chives; this was a flavorful pizza.  The prosciutto was salty while the pineapples gave it a sweet bite.  I thought it was alright still thinking of the risotto balls haha!  In the end, Federal Pizza definitely has a great deal on a Monday and Tuesday night.  I thought their pizza was doable, but nothing too special.  Coming back for the arancini for sure! - Enjoy!
Excellent pizza. The menu is short but the options are all very interesting and quite good.  Great service too.

I will put the time to fully explain why this place is way too cool for it's own good. But for now, just understand that it's amazing.  If you don't believe, check it out for yourself, go on a monday or tuesday and get their 2 pitcher / 1 pizza combo for $20 and the mouth dropping experience will begin.

I've heard a lot of great things about Federal Pizza and it kind of lived up to the hype.  Our group ordered three different pies: Casanova, Brussel Sprouts, and Margherita.   Both the Casanova and the Brussel Sprouts pizzas were fantastic and unlike any other pizza we'd ever tasted. The Margherita was good as well, but was a taste we all knew very well.  I also love the modern/classy/artistic feel of the restaurant itself. The prices are reasonable and the staff were friendly enough.  It was an overall good experience and we'll definitely be returning.

A friend and I came in with 5 children between us and two of them busy toddlers.  We felt seemingly out of place in this hipster locale.  But we had the best service!  Our pizzas were perfection, our salads amazing and our server was top notch.  We cannot wait to return again and again!

Federal Pizza is my favorite Upward Project. Cool and casual, with bike parking and comfortable Central Ave patio seating, the food and drinks are always excellent and the service is great.   I highly recommend the Casanova with dates and ricotta cheese. Coupled with their wonderful crust -- it takes like heaven.   Just be aware that it gets busy, especially on the evenings with their pizza+drinks specials.

I really wanted to like this place, but when you serve HAIR with the pizza, it's hard to like. My fiancé and I decided to finally try Federal Pizza a few months ago. We arrived on a Sunday night and it was very busy. We were promptly seated and started with the Mister Mister, which was over breaded and over cooked artichokes, baby zucchini, and sweet potatoes. The batter was so heavy and very underwhelming in flavor. The presentation was done well, but the execution was poor. We then shared the Chicken Panzanella salad. The salad was fresh, the only thing we didn't enjoy about the salad were the stale croutons. Now, here is where things go completely downhill. We order the Manifesto pizza and the 4 Kings Cheese pizza. I watched the manager on duty, checking the pizzas before they were brought to our table. At one point I witnessed her actually touch our pizza with her bare hands. Being a cook in Maricopa county, it is against health code violation to touch ready to eat food with bare hands. Well, our pizzas, which were raw in the middle, and passed the manager's quality control, were delivered to our table. We immediately pointed this out to our server and they took the pizzas to be cooked more. The cheese pizza arrived both times with a very large and unattractive grease puddle. I know pizza is greasy, but if you are using the high quality ingredients, you state you use, why is there literally a grease puddle.
