The Manifesto, arrived after being cooked more, my fiancé was trying to enjoy his slice, about that time the manager came to our table. As I am taking a bite, and she is asking us if everything is better now, there is a HAIR on my slice of Manifesto. I look at her and say, It would be better if I didn't have a hair on my slice of pizza. Her response was to LAUGH and tell me I'm jinxed. Really? At this point, we were both so turned off. We just wanted to leave and never return. My fiancé argued he didn't want anything free, that he wanted to pay and never would we come back again. She insisted on taking care of everything and gave us two coupons for pizza. We wouldn't go back even if it was free. Needless to say, I gave the coupons to a co-worker.
Yummy is all I can say and the wine beverages are to die for!  Great happy hour and wonderful service too!  Don't miss this place or you will loose out on some really good food.
My new favorite. I'm a regular.  Veg board, wine coolers, and Old Chub all day everyday.

Stopped by Federal Pizza for work function and had the chance to try a couple of their salads and pies. I liked the vibe and staff, but food carries the weight in my reviews and I overall think the grub was just okay.  Here is my thoughts:  Federal chop salad-was the better of the two salads I had. I recall it had pepperoni, pepperoncini, provolone, and a vinaigrette among other things. It was good and had the flavor of a antipasto salad but just lacked substance in my opinion.  Harvest salad-It had squash, pumpkin seeds, blue cheese, etc. but just lacked the strong flavor I was expecting. Okay, but not great.  Sweet Potato Pizza-Again I was expecting strong flavor but it was just okay. I assumed it would be on the sweet side which I was hoping for but felt it was bland.   Sweet Corn Pizza-It was better than the sweet potato and had stronger flavor. Would never think of ordering this type of pie but it was pretty good.  Meatball Pizza-The big winner amongst all the food I tried. The meatball was very flavorful and the cheese was on point. The sauce was bold with this pie and really what I was looking for. Five star worthy.  Overall, would I stop by again? Maybe. I just was not blown away with this gourmet pizza establishment and would prefer a few other joints instead.

I will start by saying that I am a BIG Upward Projects fan, so I might be a little biased. Windsor and Postino are two of my favorite restaurants, so I was extremely excited to try their new venture - Federal Pizza.  Our waiter was fantastic, recommending selections from each section of the menu. Because it was a work lunch, we didn't sample one of their wine coolers that consist of a house made infusion and sparkling wine, but I WILL be back for happy hour one day to try them out.  The atmosphere is really great - the windows fill the whole place with light and mid-century modern decor is abound. One of the small details I loved is that each table has a different style of salt & pepper shakers, so it was fun to look around and see the fun varieties. Being an Upward Project, the restaurant features cozy & comfy seating as well as a fantastic bar set-up and patio.  For starters we got the corn coins (marinated/cheese covered corn cobs sliced into coins) and they were delicious. Sweet & salty. We also got the baratta and bread and it was also tasty. If I had to chose one, I would get the corn coins since they are not something you see on other menus in town.  We decided to skip salad this trip and split two pizzas - the Casanova (featuring dates, prosciutto and arugula) and the Manifesto (featuring Shriner's sausage, mushrooms, onions and cheese). Both were incredible, and how could they not be on the doughy yet crunchy Michael Coe crust. It's my favorite crust in town now, so look out Parlor!   I already am excited about my next trip there. If you love Windsor and Postino, run, don't walk, to Federal Pizza. You won't be sorry!

The pizza was good. Although it was super thin and I feel like even a personal pan pizza won't fill me up. I like the meat one and the taste was good. There's other options too! Somehow, I feel like Bianco would still be my pick for this type of pizzas. I just like the way Bianco makes it in their brick oven, but this place is good too. I could come here every so often for variety.

Unique and delicious pizzas.  This is our go to place for Pizza.  We love the Casanova pizza.  It leaves you satisfied and feeling good about what you just ate.  We also enjoy the TLC salad.  The golden beats in it are awesome.  The staff is always very friendly.  The owner must treat there employees well because the staff always seems happy!!  The sweet potato pizza is also really good and our two year old loves the spaghetti on the kids menu.

I went here for dinner with friends last week and there were some definite ups and downs.   We arrived around 7:20 on a Thursday evening and the place was packed. The owners own several restaurants in the area. They bought a lot across the street and made it into a parking lot but it was packed and there was limited street parking and they didn't have valet that night like they do on the weekends.   The place was a little too loud for my liking, but I'm sensitive to loud places.  My friend and I split a pepperoni pizza. It was good, but not so good that I would make an extra effort to go here over another  pizza joint. Other people in our group had pasta and they looked really good.
My husband and I had dinner here a few weeks ago and it was amazing. The food was spectacular. The service was what really drove it home for us! She was incredibly knowledgeable, attentive and fun!

The pepperoni pizza is good but the crust is the scene stealer here!  If it wasn't for the crust, I would have rated it a 3 for "meh" just for the pepperoni.   The next time, I will try one of their specialty pizzas to see if its more creative and flavorful.  Until next time...

8/2/13 Ease of Parking . Busy but given a table right away. Staff pleasant. Olives good. 4 cheese pizza...not so great. Crust in middle kind of flabby. Sauce was so bland it had no real taste. Where was the cheese??? dough itself pretty good. pretty pricy for quality of food. wont go back.Also very noisy.
Sounded yummy: too bad they have us waiting 8 minutes on the phone and then the call just ended. A world of unfulfilled promises!

One of our favorite places to go.  Whether you sit at the bar, a table, or out on the patio, you can't get a more inviting atmosphere.  The staff are all fantastic from the personable bartenders to the "hands on" attentive managers.  Food is fantastic and they go out of their way to make sure you enjoy what you are eating or drinking.  If you don't have time to sit down you can always grab your meal (and a Growler) through their drive thru. My only complaint is they need to bring back the Answer Pizza!

I highly recommend visiting Federal Pizza in Phoenix.  The food and service are consistently outstanding.  Gary, Manager, Brandi, Server, and the entire team at Federal Pizza always exceed my expectations.  I look forward to visiting Federal Pizza many times in the future.

Brussel sprouts and sweet potato on my pizza? OK, Enough is enough. The crust is so-so and while I really wanted to like this place, it didn't rock me. We had the meatball pizza and it was OK. I would love to see a real NY or Chicago pizza restaurant in this town. The Wedge salad was good but I do not like dates with my blue cheese dressing thank-you.   Service was good and my friends liked the beer, large and varied selection. On to another pizza place.

Good pizza and great beer selection! I didn't get a chance to actually try their beers because I ordered food for take-out, but I saw what they had on tap and they were all solid options. The pizza was pretty good, we had the manifesto which I liked and the meatball one which we both thought was delicious and the best out of the two. Also got a caesar salad which was $10 and was just lettuce, croutons, and caesar dressing. You can tell the dressing was made fresh, but aside from that it just seemed like a plain caesar you would get for free as a side. As for the service, I can't really say much about it, but it did seem like it was lacking a bit. They didn't bring me any utensils, even though I got a salad, and they didn't bring me a bag to carry all of my things in. It wasn't crowded at the time so I don't think there should be any excuse of forgetting those things unless they were just not used to handling take-out orders.

Meatball sandwich or the meatball and spaghetti are delicious. For pizza, the Big Star and Margherita are done in a nice stone fire oven. We had the burrata for a starter and it was excellent. Great spot for all ages, loud and lively with plenty of tv's to watch the game.

First things first....AMAZING SERVICE. Team style....and right on! Everyone was so friendly and informative. My drink was constantly refilled, and that's big for me.   Now...food....AMAZING!!! Best margarita pizza I have ever had. It tastes so fresh.   The donuts were so good.   Great deal on Monday and Tuesday. $20 for pizza and bottle of wine or two pitchers of draft. If you don't finish the wine...they cork it and send it home with you!   Will be back for sure.

Upward Projects -- I'm obsessed!  I've been a forever fan of Postino, and Joyride is another family / friend favorite... the Windsor is a fun and tasty place and Churn... well just look at the line at any given time. -- what's not to like when you can get freshly churned ice cream?!  It may have taken me a long time to make my way to Federal Pizza, but it's now going to be added to the regular rotation of places we eat out... with friendly staff (shout-out to Richie), a decent sized menu with fresh ingredients / delicious food for any palate (even my picky kids), wine, beer, and so much more, Federal is fabulous!    I love the casual, hip environment and both indoor and outdoor seating options.  In addition, FP offers a drive thru so you don't have to get out of your car when you order ahead and swing by to pick up your food!  On a recent visit, my family of four had a Federal Chop Salad, an order of Polenta Sticks, a Big Star Pizza, a kids pepperoni pizza and a kids buttered noodles.  It was plenty of food, so we had leftovers the next night.  FP is moderately priced as well.  Insider tip:  check their website for specials -- there are some really good ones!  And join their eposse for some additional sweet deals and freebies on occasion.  Enjoy!

The service is great. We came in a few minutes after the kitchen closed and they stayed open for us. A great way to treat some out of towners! If I'm ever in the Phoenix area again, I will definitely be coming back. Food is good.
I am a big fan of the wine coolers, beet salad, and mozzarella cheese sandwich. Yummy!

My mother and I hopped between a few different Upward Projects restaurants. Federal Pizza was our first stop.  We split an order of the brussel sprouts and the lunch meal deal.  The brussel sprouts were very flavorful and the garlic aioli that came with it added a good punch.  The Casanova pizza was great. I would say go for a full pie because there's a little bit too much crust to filling ratio but the flavors were great. I will definitely order a full pizza next time.

I like eating here. It's good hipster pizza, even if the toppings don't always stay on. Good for individuals, dates, or groups. You probably want to figure on about a pie a person if you're at all hungry. My only real quibble? The music is always too loud, which when it's busy, makes it almost impossible to have a conversation, if you're in to that kinda thing.  I'm personally a huge fan of the buratta and the Manifesto pizza. Dip your crust in their ranch if you're in to that thing. It has a bit of a lemon-dill taste to it that's surprising in a good way :) They also have a great special on Monday and Tuesday nights, and a happy little happy hour.
The Margarita pizza and berry cobbler are a staple if I am stopping by here. It is so good that I can't change my order (and I am notorious for getting something different every time).
Pro Tip -- go for lunch and get the double down special! You can't beat a half pizza / half salad! Add $5 glasses of wine and you're set

Note: We will no longer give any business to Federal.  This was a bad experience with the food. Sad, but its ruined all our pizza cravings for now. So, good luck w the place..but we will find a new spot the next time we want pizza.

To the owner: I just left your restaurant, & my total was half as much as it could've been because of your wait staff. I was never offered another wine cooler, even though mine was empty through the entire meal. (would've had 2 or 3). Was never offered desert, & I'm still waiting for bread that never came. The food I did have was good, but it was my first time at your restaurant, & I would've liked to try other things. This can't be good for business. I just wanted to let you know.

Stopped by to grab a bite here with my daughter. The ambience is nice and I really enjoyed the music selection they had playing. The food quality was good, but a bit expensive for what I received. Didn't get a chance to try the pizza, but will on a future cheat day. I'd re-visit, but wouldn't make it one of my regular spots to hit up.

I'm not a big pizza person and this place still gets 5 stars.  I actually even chose it for my bday luncheon with the family (not that their fantabulous bar had anything to do with that choice...) ;-)  Brussels sprouts pizza = heavenly.  Wine coolers = YUM!  I'm a strong drink kinda gal - gimme an Old Fashioned any day.  BUT, these coolers redefine what you think you know of as a wine cooler.  Its not that they're super strong or anything, but they are beyond refreshing on a hot day.  (Or a cool day for that  matter.)  I highly recommend the Grapefruit Ginger as long as you aren't a super sweet-tooth.  Atmosphere is great, people are friendly, food and drink are yummy.  Go now!

Dude..... the crust.... it is so different, but very very yummy! It made my 1/2 casanova very enjoyable.  I would be drawn to that style of pizza on their crust more than the traditional saucy pepperoni stuff.  It seems more fitting to me.  My Hubby had the pepperoni and something just wast quite right.  It wasn't bad at all.  The salads and appetizer selection were like dream worthy! So unique! I will be back for those for sure! We sat at the bar, and the bartender was fine.  Not rude, no problem, but not nice, disengaged with people maybe.  Huh, I don't know... Maybe I am needy... Haha!

Friday night around 8pm and this place was packed with crowds waiting out front. Valet was the only option- don't bother driving around to find a spot. I figured that was a good sign and considered us lucky to grab two seats at the bar. The staff is friendly and the music is FANTASTIC- old school Cyprus Hill, Beastie Boys had us in the right mood.  The menu looked good with so many options that it actually took a while to decide. But in the end, I can't say I was impressed.  - We started with the veg board. Best were the roasted carrots and potatoes. The cauliflower and fennel would have been better with a bit more time in the oven because they were still really al dente with not nearly enough of the golden brown I hoped for in a dish described "wood roasted" - Kindly- the server offered to make our pizza half and half. We chose the sweet potato/ricotta/sage and the brussel sprout/pancetta/manchengo/lemon. Both good in theory, but failed in execution. The slices of orange spud and creamy ricotta were both tasty, but toppings were limited to the very center of the pie, leaving at least half of each slice naked and flavorless. There were barely any brussel sprouts on the other side, though the lemon flavor was tasty and something I would try to repeat at home. The crust was a real issue- undercooked and doughy. Just poor execution of an otherwise good idea. - Side salad was fine and priced right.  Overall, happy to leave this place for others who enjoy it more. Though they win the prize on music selection, there are many better pizza options in town.

Who am I kidding with my original four star review??? We all knew I'd be bumping it up to five stars eventually.   Well, looks like that eventually has come sooner rather than later. I decided to go back today (yes, for the second time within their first week of business) and try out a few other menu items. I also wanted to check out their patio on such a lovely Sunday afternoon.   I am not disappointed to say that I thoroughly enjoyed myself once again. Our server was Jet (a staple at all Upward Projects restaurants) and he is always on top of his game. I'm glad to see he'll be hanging out at Federal Pizza...that means the staff will be as excellent as what you can find at all of their restaurants. I tried the caprese sandwich this time around and was pleasantly surprised. Pane Bianco may have a competitor here...the mozzarella was super fresh, the basil was fragrant, and the tomatoes were juicy and tangy. Not to mention the deliciously charred bread that was drizzled with olive oil. So tasty! The drinks were as lovely as before and the patio was perfection on a sunny fall day.   So hurry over my fellow Yelpers...I promise you'll enjoy every bite!

My sister and I decided to come here for a girls day, we both love trying food so we tried the seasonal burrata and the polenta, both very good! The service was good, other than when we asked where the bathroom was from the host she acted like it was an annoying question. Anyways we order a half the answer pizza and half Casanova ugh to die for!  Such good flavors on a little slice of pizza. If it was closer to where I lived I'd go here again! It's worth a try!

If I were reviewing Federal Pizza for the food only, I'd bring my review up to a 4 star.  That being said, we had a weird experience here last weekend.  We arrived around 6:30 after being told this was a good time to arrive (no reservations for parties under 8 people).  We had just under this amount and were told it would likely be short wait.  Well, after a 30+ minute drive, we were told we had a 2 hour wait.  After some smooth talking, it was shortened to 60 minutes and we agreed to stay.    Fast forward 90 minutes and we were still waiting for a table.  In general, it was a big deal, its to be expected in a pre-summer weekend.   The next issue was the service.  I found the front staff and servers to be a bit pretentious.  This is a big pet peeve of mine.  No one deserves to be talked down to.  Our waiter was nice in general, but was very inattentive.  Several parts of our order were messed up or not even brought to our tables.  When we asked about this, they acted annoyed.    The food was good - we ordered 2 veggie pizzas and 2 meat pizzas.  As a vegetarian, I only tried the veggie pizzas, but they were legit.  The appetizers & drinks were ok.  Again, things were forgotten so I can't give a whole review.  If you're close by & want pizza, perhaps give it a try.  If its the weekend, you're better of trying somewhere else.  The Phoenix area has so many great pizza places that I don't recommend wasting your time at a place that is more pretentious than it is delicious.

I heard nothing but good things from this local pizzeria and being that is was a Friday night having the drive thru experience when picking up a pie is ideal! Picked up a "meatball" pizza pie that was plenty of food to serve at least two. I was really impressed with the meatball slices on top of the pizza, combined with the house mozzarella, red sauce, basil and roasted onions. This combination hit all my taste buds!  To top it off all the pizza's are cooked in a brick oven,  adding the wood fired flavors! This place is worth a try if you are not in the mood of sitting in a restaurant or wanting to try out some new pizza with the drive- thru experience!

I met up with some friends here for lunch on a Saturday.  This was my first trip to any of the Upward Projects facilities since the new parking lot across the street.  Made the overall visit much nicer.  I was able to park at Federal, brunch at 10 at Windsor, lunch at 11 at Federal Pizza and dessert at Churn at 12:30 with different groups without having to move my car or deal with valet.  I got to lunch at the tail end of the group as us stragglers came in the staff just kept rearranging tables. Service was great the whole time and the staff was fully prepared to answer questions and provide suggestions.  I had already decided on The Magnificent with a glass of 8th Street ale.  Both were very good.  So now I've been to everyplace but Postino and liked all of them.  I need to try the remaining one that was really the first of theirs in the neighborhood.

Sooo good!  This is my kind of place. Everyone was super friendly and talkative. The waiter, the owner, the greeter... Super nice.  The food was awesome and the drinks were equally as good. The atmosphere was great, and the music was a good mixture. I will definitely go again. They have an awesome little kids menu and all three of my children enjoyed everything they ate.
Great pizza, I really love the sweeter sauce and sausage.  The Caesar salad was not the great.  Prices are just a little too high.

Enjoyed a late afternoon lunch with my girlfriend here. She had already been and raved about it so I trusted her choice. All options looked great but we were in the mood for some prosciutto so we opted for the Casanova. I was a little iffy on the dates but they ended up complimenting the arugula very well. Great afternoon meal out on their patio and great experience. We'll be going back again soon.

All I can say the PIZZA is AWESOME SAUCE!  :)  I got the meatball pizza.  YES!  Parking was not bad, service was good, no asking for refills, and we had a corner table so it was not loud and I can hear my fellow foodies...

Wow after reading the reviews for this place, maybe my expectations were too high.  Very bland Ceaser salad, one size pizza, which could cause more than 2 people to over or under order, and finally placing paper under the pizza, on top of the pizza pan, collecting grease, and making it difficult to get a slice without a wad of paper, since they never cut the pie all the way through.  I wouldn't rush back, and definitely wouldn't wait to spend my money here.

Super cool spot great for dates. Food is delicious . Kitchen open until 11 and bar open til 12 midnight.  Wish our pizza just came out a little quicker but it was great and ingredients are super fresh.

This place is close to my apartment so I decided to order a salad one night when I was craving a quick, light meal. I got the harvest salad with chicken. It was mediocre - definitely nothing to write home about. It was on the small size, very overpriced for the amount of food. Doesn't tempt me to go back and try their pizza.

Great pizza, wonderful beers, super service. What's not to like. Stopped in for a mid-afternoon lunch with wifey. Arrived before she did and scanned the menu for microbrews. Settled on a Green Flash IPA and ordered a pint. Server said, "that's $5, but during pitchers are $5 during happy hour, so I'll bring you a pitcher". SCORE.  Ordered a brussel sprouts, pancetta & manchego pizza to share. Amazing. Superb crust. Best touch was a touch of lemon juice on the pie, which provided just a hint of acid to cut the fat and saltiness of the cheese and pancetta. Server was really nice and fun. Tough to beat. We'll be back soon.

A really cool atmosphere (the bathrooms feel like you're at a club).   Staff is nice. Drinks are affordable. I had the chicken Panzanella salad. Good portion, good flavor - a tad expensive for what you get, but overall not a bad experience.   Stay Cheerful ;)  P.S. Someone please explain to me how this place has a drive-thru #whyyoumakenosense

Love this little area-the Windsor, Churn, etc., all great! Federal Pizza has great food. Pizzeria Bianco gets all the love but honestly, Federal Pizza was just as good, if not better. Less packed and less expensive. Great cocktails, too. Be sure to save room for ice cream at Churn across the street!

I just love this place! The veggie board rocks and their pizza is awesome! Today I had the At Last (?) pizza with broccolini, corn, basil, chilis, goat cheese, and lemon zest. It's one of my favorites! Great lunch specials too!

Best. Ravioli. Ever. We went there for my birthday celebration dinner. Our group of 6 got several things to share. Homemade ravioli, vegetable lasagna and two pizzas. Everything was very good, but that ravioli! I loved it! My mom and sister did too. The brown butter sauce and pine nuts on it were so delicious! The restaurant was very clean and nice. Great service and beer too! Definitely will be back again!

While searching yelp for a late night bite, I found Federal Pizza open 'till 11PM, so I went.  The host was a very congenial gentleman, who I later found out was working his first day there.  He should be the manager BTW, and treated us so courteously, the place was packed and although he estimated a 20 minute wait, we were seated much faster via a very high tech communications system.(Impressive!!) The bar staff, the wait staff and everyone there treated us as if we were ROYALTY and the food was DELICIOUS, especially the pizza made in a wood burning oven, confirmed by the stacked wood outside the restaurant! The specials are GREAT and I will be back for sure!!!

I love this place. The staff is very friendly, knowledgable in wines and beers, and always recommend the yummiest dishes and pizzas.   Great stop for a date or just a low key evening with friends.   Monday and Tuesdays they do $20 bottle of wine and pizza. Such a good deal.
We love coming here for lunch or dinner even though it's a 40 min drive for us! The food is THAT good!
I love this pizza! The fig with arugula - melt in your mouth! Whenever I'm in Phoenix - I make a huge effort to eat some Federal Pizza. Can't wait till next time!

Wow Upward Projects, what can't you do?  Congratulations on your take over of Central Ave.  With Federal, Windsor, and Postino there are choices for all.  Federal's pizza is baked deliciousness.  Unique combinations on each pizza and excellent starters to choose from compliment the menu and my stomach.  Sandwiches are great and all can be washed down with a great selection of draft beer.  My wife prefers the wine coolers which are very tasty I must admit.    Take home a Chub and anything from the menu.  Enjoy discounted drinks before 5pm.  Take your date here for a nice dinner.  Enjoy the outdoor seating and people, car watch with good food and drink.  Any way you choose to do it you should not be disappointed.   Thank you Upward, and my apologies to Windsor and Postino for the transfer of my business for the time present, but we will be back.
My best and I tried the Margherita pizza w/ the Mister Mister. -- Couldn't go wrong. I'm a fan!

Just relocating from the Seattle WA area back to the valley I have been missing the trendy retro places that are not over priced with good food. And I scored with this one! Excellent job with decor and coziness. Outdoor eating is an option with warmers when it gets chilly.   Had the pizza with artichoke and also the pizza with pepperoni. The kids loved the pepperoni it had a great flavor. The Brussels sprout pizza was great but you really need to like the flavor of Brussels sprouts...which I do, so marvelous! Another great touch when the kids asked for Parmesan cheese they brought out fresh Parmesan and grated it over the pizza. So yummy!  The servers were very attentive and worked well as a team. My glass or my kids glasses were never empty. So well that I was not sure who exactly was my assigned server. I loved that!

I love Federal Pizza. Always great food, good atmosphere and amazing dessert. They list pairings on their menu- which completes your meal even more. Unfortunately on one visit there was a mess up with my food, however the management went above and beyond to fix my dish and took GREAT care of us. Waits are considerably bad and with the parking lot across the street there's no more annoying "complimentary valet."  My only complaint would be the lack of knowledge many of the staff have regarding certain food allergies. If I didn't have my dietary restrictions - I could eat here everyday!!!

Great atmosphere right away as we walked in and greeted with a friendly smile. Wait staff is spot on too.    A real breathe of fresh air in terms of friendly service that is utterly lacking in Bellevue, where an air of snobbiness exists.  The beer sampler was refreshing, crisp and cold, making the pizza all that much better.
The crust of these pizzas is amazing. My wife and I agreed we could eat a plain crust with no toppings and be delighted. Great atmosphere and outdoor seating.

We tried this place for the first time for lunch over the weekend. We tried the Big Star. It had good flavor, however it lacked cheese and the crust was flimsy. I prefer not to have to use a fork and knife to eat pizza. The staff was very friendly.
My nephew recommended it to my brother,my sister in law and I. All four of us were there for the first time. What a great restaurant I recommend the Star.

Fantastic! Cool, laid-back atmosphere, personable service and great menu. We shared the meatball pizza and it was so fresh and delicious. Excellent dough with fresh, yummy mozzarella. And then the bambolina dessert - fresh donuts rolled in sugar with chocolate dipping sauce - is the best end to a great meal!!

I always get their Mickey White pasta dish, along with a Great Little Salad. The pasta is so delicious, that I always bring half home, not because I can't eat it all, but because I want to have it again soon. It's creamy and garlicky, and has chicken, spinach, and perfectly al dente noodles. The Great Little Salad is wonderful! The lemon vinegarette is the perfect balance of tart and slightly sweet, and the greens are fresh and delicious with tiny strips of yellow beats. Both are so delicious, that I never order anything else, so I don't really know the other menu items well. Service was great and they keep your fresh tasting (thank you!) iced tea filled and even offered to send some to take with us.

It was our  wedding anniversary and the kids were at Grandma's. It was a Wednesday night. We were both finally off work, it was 8pm, and we wanted to try to fit in a little date to celebrate another year down. I was in the mood for pizza, so of course, we turn to Yelp. We wanted somewhere good, but not good enough to require me to get all fancied up. The reviews looked promising, so we said "what the hey.."  The weather was just chilly enough to not want to sit outside. We couldn't find the entrance, so we walked a circle around the entire building. It was a nice walk. We got to assess (and by assess I mean "gossip about") some couples on the patio. That was fun. Walked in, greeted right away by a nice lady. Sat at a table by the patio door. The view was nice. The bar was pretty. The crowd was a little bit hipster, a little bit normal people. It looked like there were a lot of first dates happening. Those are fun to watch.  The server was super sweet, I love that they're all wearing normal clothes.   The food was pretty good. We got some sort of appetizer, I forgot what it was called as soon as I ordered it. It looked like a whole bunch of fried stuff all piled together (not greasy gross fried, just fried), with 2 different dipping sauces. One green, one red. The red was better. For an entree, we shared a pizza. It was okay. We got the Big Star because all the others looked a little too weird (apple and sausage?... hmm) For dessert, we had doughnuts with the chocolate sauce. We got them because they make a similar dessert at Olive Garden, and we are obsessed with them. Well... I hate to say this, because I love small businesses, but olive garden's doughnut and chocolate sauce is a lot better. So it was a huge disappointment, but that's not necessarily their fault. Our expectations were probably too high. We also split a pitcher of beer. The total bill was 40 bucks plus tip. Not too shabby.  When we left, like, 5 employees smiled and said "bye!! thanks for coming in!!" Where did they find such pleasant people? I like it.

Amazing food quality!   I am not eating grains or dairy for a little bit, so you'd think I would have suffered here, lol, but on the contrary! I found there was plenty of choices for me to choose from and what I ordered turned out to be DELICIOUS!   To start I had a side of Veggies, which were Balsamic Braised Carrots & Broccolini. They were cooked and seasoned perfectly. The carrots were my favorite!! I would have eaten a few more orders of those had I been wearing elastic waist pants. I made a mental note ;)   My main course was a TLC Salad. It was composed of arugula, spring greens, beets, pears, smoked almonds & fennel with a citrus shallot vinaigrette. I had them hold the pecorino & add chicken. This was one of the most scrumptious salads I've ever had! With every bite there was a different burst of yumminess! The beets (of which I'm a big fan of now) and pear really made this salad. The chicken was cooked perfectly and was not the least bit dry, which I'm always afraid of. I am glad that I added the extra protein because the salad size is not large, so I would have been starvin marvin within an hour without it.   The service was excellent. There's lots of parking in the back. Both booths and tables are available and there was an outdoor seating area that faces Central.   There's also a drive through, which is really uncommon for a non fast-food place, lol. & from what I hear, you can order kegs to go..... ask more about that if you're interested, because I didn't probe for details, I was too busy imagining someone receiving a keg through a car window :D

Federal Pizza is starting to piss me off. This is usually my go-to spot for pizza to go - my usual order: Brussel Sprout pizza and the meatball appetizer.   For the past few times, the pizza has not been good at all! The brussel sprouts weren't cooked enough, tasted raw and I had to put the pizza in the oven for several minutes before I can actually enjoy it. The meatballs are good, but the last time - the balls looked like they shrunk. What the hell is going on?!  Federal, I used to be your #1 Fan, now I am more like your #1 Frenemy.

This place was so good. The pesto pasta and margherita pizza was one of the best I've eaten. The downside to this place was the bathrooms. They were disgusting. I recommend eating here but go to the bathroom before you come.

Call me crazy but I am not a big fan of pizza which is why I found Federal to be spectacular. I ordered the chicken parm and the waiter advised me that it's not your typical plate where they place the chicken in pasta with tomato sauce all over it. He explained the way they do it and he made it sound so delicious I was sold. Let me say I am so glad I said yes because it was sooooo good! The sauce they put at the bottom was creamy with a spicy hit, the chicken was cooked to perfection. We came in to celebrate my friends birthday and everyone else had pizza and they said it was really tasty. The service was also very nice!

Ok, so I've only been here once.  It was at a meeting a week ago with my work.  Best tip is that the parking is absolutely horrible, so come early or late, because the lot is so small and there is nothing on the street.  That being said,  I arrived with 5 other people and was greeted and seated warmly.   The waitress arrived promptly for drinks and orders.  I opted to get a classic, the margharita pizza with fresh mozz, tomatoes and basil, plus I added  roasted garlic.  It was delicious, with fresh hot house tomatoes, fresh torn basil leaves, stringy melted mozzarella, with garlic cloves mild and roasted to a perfect creaminess  and the crust was both delicate and chewy, exactly what you'd expect in a well executed pizza, but the absolute STAR and the one all my co-workers remember is the sweet potato and ricotta pizza.  It sounds unusual,  and it IS! Thin rounds of sweet potato roasted into the chewy, pillowy crust with generous dollops of creamy ricotta cheese and fresh sage scattered with it.  One of my co-workers shared it, a single slice each,  but THAT is the pizza we all remember and dream about!  Sweet, but not TOO sweet, creamy and luscious! It was like nothing I've ever had before.  And at $13 I thought it a bargain!  If I hadn't been headed out of town after our meeting I would have gotten one to bring home to my husband! I hope I am able to make it that way again,  just for this luscious, decadent treat.  I'm not a pizza  fan overall,  after 16 yrs in AZ I thought I wouldn't like pizza again,  but THIS pizza is one well worth a trip to central Phoenix!

Pizza greatness! I've ate at quite a few pizza places around Phoenix and this has to be one of my favorites, as well as Grimaldis. The flavor is just what I want in a pizza. Can't go wrong. Wanting good quality pizza for dinner. Don't hesitate. Bring your a$$ down here haha :)

What a great place! Just checked it out for happy hour on Friday afternoon and was most pleasantly surprised. They have nice booths in the middle and a very casual vibe and atmosphere. You can watch the dough boys making wood fired pizza and order beer to go in a growler which is actually quite reasonable and the equivalent of buying a 6 pack. They also have a nice wine list, but didn't have the wine we wanted, Dos Cabeza, on tap so we settled for some Pinot Noir.  One thing that is very cutting edge is that there is no assigned server to your table, instead all the waitstaff pitches in and gets you what you need, wethere it's refills or ordering more food. I asked if they pool their tips and they do I much prefer this style of service as it's very fast and much better than flagging down your waiter which in America people get an attitude about. That's one thing they could work on though is attitude, it seems almost a bit too hipsterish and when we mentioned Red Lobster to this waitress she looked at us like we were crazy. Too bad, I guess that's just a human trait. Overall I give this place 4 stars for atmosphere and food.

I have only given this restaurant a 3 start rating because of the food and beer. However, the service is by far the worst! It's a hit or miss. I have been a loyal patron since it first opened its doors, however, I never know what to expect from their pretentious, hipster staff! I like to think they will always be friendly and courteous but it's quite the opposite. Sitting at the bar they may or may not acknowledge you, not that I'm asking for much but knowing that you see me would be nice. I only wish their staff would be more attentive in order to give them a full 5 star review
Sat at the bar and watched the pizzas being made, super cool. Great customer service, very attentive, funny kitchen staff!

Really great pizza, that's for sure. My server was a cute hipster girl with who seemed like she had a million other places she'd rather be. She wasn't rude directly to me, but it wasn't the friendliest service I've ever had.   Anyway, I got the Sweet Potato pizza. It tasted awesome, just not really $13 awesome. I don't think I'm too much of a pig, but I didn't really get that much food for what I was paying for.   I did like the beer selection, though. That was very enjoyable.
Awesome drinks, great food, and awesome atmosphere. Fun place to meet up with good friends and grab some sangria and share tapas or pizza. I have celiac and still found things I could eat.
I'M Italian,vero Italiano. The first time was fantastic pizza, the second time the pizza was raw.  Service 5 stars ,pizza 2 stars

The stuff needs much improvement in fact I was deemed unfit to drink anymore after I shared only one picture with a friend and I was very far from being grown also the pizza my friend found was not up to par either he thought it was going to be something else entirely but my meatball pasta was alright just be wary this is the lowest score ever given ever and there's a great cause for that

Went with family to try this place out because they got a certificate.  The waitress was pretty rude. She walked away before we were done ordering and never brought us one of our drinks. She also failed to inform us of charges for extra items. With or without  a certificate I would never come to this place or recommend it... oh and what are their staff wearing? You can't tell customers from employees and one of the waitresses had a skirt so short she mine as well be naked.
The sangrias a the best with a variety to choose from! The pizza is thin crust yet flavorful. Nice bar seating area. There is an  available patio area as well! Oh yeah, and a drive thru!!!!

What an awesome experience at Federal Pizza! We came around lunch time and just had a 10-15 minute wait which wasn't bad. The server was very friendly, suggested great items, and food turned out great! I was hesitant because I just had an unpleasant experience at one of the restaurants next door but I am happy that I tagged along to try it out!! I will definitely be back :)

This is my 3rd time ordering pizza from Federal Pizza and all 3 times have been amazing!   Best pizza in town.  And I love the drive thru. Most places are closed on Easter, but I was so glad they were open today.  Lucky me. :)

I rode to Federal Pizza on Sunday, Sep 18th for lunch around 1PM. I took a seat at the bar so I could watch the football game on TV.  The bartender tended to me quickly. I had never been here before, but heard great things.  I ordered the half-pizza/half-salad combo. The food was quite good, but what impressed me most was the service!  I was not drinking alcohol. The bartender consistently refilled my soda and water glasses, even offering me a "to-go" cup for my soda. He came back after I paid my bill (with credit card, tip already calculated) and offered to refill my glasses again. This was one of the few times I received great service even after the server had been paid. He deserved the additional cash tip I left for exceptional service.  To sum it up, while the food alone is a great reason to return to Federal Pizza, the service made the experience exceptional!
Our Thursday choice. Enjoyed the pasta and pizza. Staff was friendly.   Tried again a few weeks later but the wait was a half hour. Speaks well for the food.

My bf and I went to Federal Pizza last night for dinner. I'd wanted to try the place since it opened, but I'm not often in the area around dinnertime. We'd been nearby and decided to hit up Federal and give it a try! I'm so glad we did.  Being a Friday night, I expected the wait would be a while, and the hostess quoted us a wait time of about 45 minutes. We went and sat outside, but the wait probably was no more than 25 which was nice. The ambiance inside is quite loud, so be prepared for the loud (but good!) music and the chatter of all the happy diners. I'd tried their grapefruit-ginger wine cooler at this year's Devoured, so I ordered that to drink, and it was as tasty as I remembered. I'd heard great things about the burrata appetizer, so we ordered that as well. At first, I was a tad bit underwhemled with the burrata, but the more I ate, the more it grew on me. The bread was crispy and slightly charred, with a good smokey flavor, and the burrata was super cold and complemented the bread nicely. It was a little salty for my taste, but with some of the fresh basil added to the cheese and bread, it was mighty delicious. I'd order this again in a heartbeat.  Where pizza is concerned, I was deciding between the brussels sprout pizza, the Gemini (with potatoes and goat cheese, I believe) or the Sweet Potato (sweet potatoes, ricotta ,sage). Let me tell you, I ordered the Sweet Potato and that ricotta cheese was the best I'd ever had in my life. I don't know what brand they use, or if it's made in-house, but damn was it good! The bottom crust was a little thin, but my pizza managed to keep it's integrity and didn't get soggy. The crust as a whole had great chew, was light as air, and had a great char from the wood-fired oven,  My bf went the simple route and ordered a pizza with pepperoni and sausage. The sausage was the best part because it came from Schreiner's, and come on, nothing from Schreiner's is bad. Great flavor! I added a piece of sausage to my sweet potato pizza and the flavors worked really well together.  No room for dessert this time around, but next time I'm definitely ordering the bombolini! My only gripe is that the prices seemed a bit steep for what you get, but I guess it's all their high-quality ingredients.

We went on a Sunday afternoon. The place was semi busy, short wait to be seated. We ordered the Casanova pizza. Now my husband is a typical pepperoni and cheese, and our waiter suggested going outside the box, if we did not like it he'd put in an order for pepperoni. Man, are we ever glad we tried it! Savory, sweet, salty, fresh explosion in your mouth. That dates give it a semi hint of sweetness and the fresh arugula was just enough to give a fresh bite...  A must try!!! Trust me!!! The prices are just right, service was outstanding. Can't wait to go back.

We already have a few preferred pizzerias in town, but decided to come here for Italian fare after reading a number of positive reviews on Yelp. During this visit, the long, spacious décor was modern, impressionable, and appropriate for all occasions. There were a mix of families and young professionals seated in-between the full bar and the open kitchen, as the natural sunlight came through the windows to transcend the dim parts of the interior. It was the first day of spring, so the sunny patio was also filled with diners overlooking Central Ave.   For starters, the Polenta arrived perfectly fried to render crispiness on the outside, and creamy and soft at the center. These polenta sticks came with romesco, a creamy nut-red pepper dipping sauce, that added another element to the flavors. By all measures, the profile of the polenta was spot-on and delicious.  The Casonova Pizza ($14.50) was put together with prosciutto, dates, ricotta, arugula and pecorino. The dates and thinly sliced prosciutto were delicious, but unevenly distributed across the pie, prompting these flavors to be a hit and miss. We were impressed by the sweet ricotta to accompany the lightly dressed arugula that covered the pie. However, the thin crust was not charred crispy or elastic enough to extend the wow factor. It was certainly more consequential than our next pie, but also a noticeable letdown noted by one of the previous reviewers. Overall, the Casonova was a lighter and sweeter option than those that are filled with heavy savory toppings, which added a nice contrast to our Manifesto Pizza.  That said, the Manifesto Pizza ($14.50) came with mushrooms, sausages, red sauce, goat cheese, and fennel. The mushrooms did not distinguish in terms of textures or taste, but the superiority of the sausage and the red sauce were unsurpassed. Unfortunately, we find the thin crust to be inconsistent in-between the pies, and a major weak link in the meal. The texture of the crust was not well executed, which steered our attention to the high quality toppings and ingredients instead of the whole pie.   Service was exceptionally attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable. Every server and chef greeted us by making good eye contact with a warm smile. Our water was refilled consistently, and multiple servers came by to check on us throughout the visit. Our chef, Jesse, was so nice that he made a personalized pizza for one of our young dining companions. Their level of enthusiasm to attend to our needs was another major highlight in our visit. Interested diners can expect high quality ingredients, 5-star service, and a fantastic dining environment. 3.5 stars for the overall experience. We are definitely adding this pizzeria to the rotation as we look forward to trying their sweet potato pizza, meatball sandwich, homemade ravioli, and desserts.

This is my new favorite dinner spot! Awesome decor and atmosphere. Funky music and lively mood. Very well informed waiters. They were all willing to answer questions and take our order when we were ready. To quote my fav waiter, Jet: the food is "magic in your mouth" and he isn't exaggerating. The Big Star pizza and the veggie platter were delicious. They're not messing around in their kitchen.
Had awesome appetizers and some great beer on tap... and the pizza!!!!!!!!  OMG!  We lucked out with very little wait.  I would definatley go back!
The atmosphere and the service were both excellent, but it really comes down to the food. One of the best pizzas I've had anywhere in Phoenix! We will be back again soon.

This place is amazing! I would drive across town to eat a cheese pizza at this place!  The crust is great, the pizza flavors are creative and inventive. The ingredients are fresh.  The first time we went, the server suggested we try the Sweet Potato Pizza.  We were a little nervous because it sounded odd, but it was amazing!  We have never been disappointed!  We live in Mesa and it is worth the drive to central Phoenix for this great place!

They are usually great! The last 4 times I've been there they've goofed up. The grease on the pizza was so bad it came out orange, it was pepperoni. They messed an order up, totally off. Can't make up there mind on how thick to make the Grinder, same table, ones thick and one isn't and today the bolognese was cold. I asked the waitress if they had a microwave, she simply said no and was off. I'm gonna give it some time to change before I return. The owners are suppose to be  great guys and I'm sure they'll get it straightened up when they notice. When it changes I'll rewrite  review.

Great fancy pizza joint.  Good selection of pizzas (My personal favorite is the prosciutto and date pizza) and a great craft beer.  They also have a call ahead drive through which is perfect when you want to have a Netflix and wine kind of night.

Federal is my new favorite place to eat!  Just the right amount of great staff, awesome food and a stellar collection of beers and cocktails.  Been here several times, Federal can do no wrong. Keep up the good work!

Yay for another restaurant from the Postino people!  The atmosphere is everything you've come to expect from Postino/LGO/Windsor/Churn - hip and minimalist with lots of tattoos. The prices are excellent - ~$12-14 for a pizza that is about right for 2 people. Pitchers of beer for $5, including some craft and local brews. Growlers for $15! The food was delicious. We had a pepperoni pizza and a specialty pizza with fig, arugula, goat cheese, and prosciutto. Both were good, but I really loved the specialty pie (can't remember the name now). The crust is very thin, but chewy instead of crunchy - similar to Bianco in that way. They have many different specialty options, but you can also make your own, mixing any combination of probably 40 different ingredients. Of course they have Schreiner's sausage, since that is all the rage in Phoenix these days. They also have a great patio for sitting outside when the weather is beautiful (like Thanksgiving weekend!). Parking in the lot is not plentiful, but there's typically enough on the neighboring streets.

Good pizza though it doesn't compare to Pizzeria Bianco, Cibo, Pizzeria Locale or Pomo. The crowd is of the "too beautiful for school" variety you'll find at other Uptown establishments like Windsor, Joyride and Postino.   There's generally very long waits on the weekend. That would be fine if they'd be willing to call you on your cell when your table is ready, but they refuse. Additionally the seating/waiting area on the west side of the building is very limited (even though there's tons of room to add additional benches). So while you wait instead of being able to stroll the lovely and historic Medlock Place neighborhood you have to idle about in a hot parking lot.  Calling customers who are on a 30 minute plus wait would be a very easy thing for Federal to do, and would earn them another star from me.  I do appreciate the building its in, it's great to see an Al Beadle building adaptively reused.

I take all of the friends I can get to Federal. It may be a little pricey for a broke college student like myself, but when sharing with a friend, it is well priced and worth the money! They have great happy hour specials and the pizzas are amazing. The staff is always very friendly and helpful when it comes to suggesting pizzas. I recommend the Casanova, I get it almost every time!
I can't believe I love pizza with brussel sprouts, but I do, thanks to Federal Pizza... DE-LISH.

Favorite place in phoenix.   I am not a huge pizza fan and for me its not the pizza that makes this place.  Now the burrata cheese appetizer and chocolate dessert are what do it for me.  The burrata is amazing!  We normally don't get appetizers but went for a special occasion so decided to go all in.  The burrata is one of my fav dishes in phx.  The dessert would be my #1 fav dessert in phoenix.  The oreo crust, amazing chocolate mousse and then marshmallow topping is to die for.  Its even better than the Citizen Public Houses similar offering.

Federal Pizza is absolutely deserving of 5 stars. Amazing food, friendly staff, nice atmosphere. All around this place is great.  The boyfriend and I hit up Federal PIzza for lunch on a Saturday. It was busy but we were able to snag a comfy booth in the middle. Our waiter, I think his name was Dan, was immediately welcoming, funny and charming.   The menu has lots of yummy-sounding choices but we decided to try the wedge salad and the prosciutto pizza. The salad was a bit of a twist on the traditional wedge. It was made with romaine instead of iceberg (which was a welcome change) and had dates, tomatoes and ranch dressing with gorgonzola instead of the traditional bleu cheese. The size was generous - at least for two - and the flavor combinations worked well. A good start to the meal.  The pizza was out of this world. Loaded with fresh prosciutto, arugula, dates and ricotta cheese. This is easily my new favorite pizza in the valley. The crust was doughy and chewy in the best way possible and cooked perfectly. Every bite was delicious and surprisingly filling.  Of course we did save room for dessert (there's always room for dessert). We ordered the donuts with chocolate sauce. There were eight pretty big donuts covered in sugar and served hot. Not warn, hot. Yum. Dip those suckers in the chocolate sauce and you'll have a hot donut celebration. One thing I thought was a little weird was that they took our dinner plates and did not bring small plates for the donuts. Our table was a mess of sugar afterwards. But who cares, they were delish.  Overall I was very impressed with Federal Pizza. I already want to go back. Hopefully they will open one in the East Valley, pretty please???

This swanky restaurant boasts to be delicious, modern, & hip! It's true- the ambience is very chill & relaxed with waiters rocking their Converse shoes & edgy attire & the waitresses  sporting cat-eye eyeliners & trendy blouses. The music is amazingly appropriate, but it's the food that must be raved about.  From their Arnold Palmer drink to their pairings of beer with the right pizza, this is what it's all about.  Start to finish, everything that came out of the kitchen and onto our table was nothing short of delicious. The pizza crust was phenomenal  crunchy and just the right size. Everything we ate looked very inviting.  This place-by far- is my favorite pizza place!

Last night I was in a positively lovely mood. I'd just come from a blissful vacation, eating some of the best bar-b-que this country has to offer in Kansas City. I'm not a picky eater by any stretch of the imagination, but my tastebuds are educated and I always appreciate care and quality in a meal and yesterday Federal Pizza offered that in spades.   My lovely date and I couldn't decide where to go for dinner. She'd been craving pasta for a week and wanted something simple but delicious that would satisfy the urge she'd built up in her mind. I like subtlety, elegance, and finesse. She's not the most adventurous eater but she loves trying new things and she trusts me, so when I decided we would start with the Mussels I knew there was a bit of risk involved. HOME-FRICKIN'-RUN! I don't know if it's a common order on a menu packed with delicious options and pizzas but since we weren't getting pizza this time, I thought mussels would be a great opener and boy was I right. There's a luscious sauce that perfectly accents but doesn't overpower the mussels, and they were fresh and tender and cooked with chorizo which gave the dish a lovely flavor and spice. I like to think chefs intentionally gift you a couple mussels out of the shell that hide under the rest, soaking in the sauce and waiting for you to think you're done. It may look like a technical oversight but once you put the sauce-soaked meat in your mouth, you realize the blessing that's been bestowed upon you. To accent this dish they provide a nicely grilled lemon halve which adds the perfect touch of acid, and two grilled slices of bread which we used, of course, for sopping. YUM!  For our entrees we went with the Spaghetti and Meatballs (her choice) and their "Trust Us" special of the evening - Linguini Carbonara. I have a rule about taking chef's suggestions; Always do it. Who cares what you like?! They know their ability and more important, they know the product. Oftentimes a chef will choose to highlight ingredients they've scored in their specials, or to show off their skills in some other regard. I saw the "Trust Us" sign on the board while walking in and I knew I was getting it from the jump. My lovely date had me pick a backup dish in case they'd run out of it. But surprise surprise, people in Phoenix don't like taking risks so I was the first one who ordered it! The pasta was perfectly cooked, balanced with a dreamy creamy sauce and evenly distributed pancetta and freshly grated parmesan cheese. It came topped with an egg, poached and then lightly breaded and fried. SO GOOD! Ugh, each bite was simply heaven. Carbonara is one of the simplest pastas to make, but it's complexity is in achieving the perfect balance of flavors and texture. In this regard the chef nailed it.   My lovely date thoroughly enjoyed her Spaghetti and Meatballs too. I tried some and the meatballs were just the right size, like Goldilocks kinda "just right." The pomodoro, again a simple sauce, was executed judiciously. Fresh basil, perfect amount of cracked pepper. Primo.   Actually it was with this dish that their five stars were earned, as the portion size was large so my lovely date ended up asking for a box to take the rest home. We paid the check and left, but it took until we arrived at my place (I live a short distance away, not even three minutes driving) that we realized we'd left her box on the table. It was too good to chalk as a loss, so we turned around and headed back. Now, it would have been completely within their right to just toss the box after bussing the table. They would have lost nothing and we would have been sad but we also would have gotten over it. It's not like someone would have died. But they didn't. When I came back it was placed aside on the back register, where the nice hostess handed it to me.  I think I take for granted that I live in walking distance of such nice restaurants like Federal Pizza but I'm going to have to make it a point to drop by more often, as much for the food as for the care and thoughtfulness of the kitchen and front-of-house staff. Thank you!

I've been here a few times and it has never disappointed. The sweet potato pizza and the Casanova pizza are top two! Their coolers are also amazing and cheap, 2 for $5! Our server Jesus was a pleasure. He offered us plenty of beer samples and recommended the Casanova. He was very attentive and took very good care of my whole family. The reason for 4 stars is because they did not have Corona  or Modelo for my dad. I will be a returning customer and I will recommend to everyone.   Thank you!!

The Federal's location, (Central Ave) in northern part of downtown Phoenix, alone is desirable to folks working within Central corridor/downtown areas. Great stop for after-work apps or dinner!  I tried their Chicken Parm which had a unique sauce that made it a new experience for one of my old stand-bys. I tried my friend's Hawaiian pizza and it was thin and full of flavor. Hardly any grease.  Our server was a doll and checked in w/us frequently. On a Friday evening, I only had to wait 10 minutes for a table for 2. I also love that they offer free valet service.  Be prepared for a noisy dining experience - the place was packed and tables/booths are near one another. Try not to get annoyed (like I did initially); let the buzz of the lively patrons give you energy after a long day at work. :)

The only reason I gave it 2 stars was for the polenta sticks. Pizza was better than Pizza Hut but not by far. The salad we for was supposed to have a vinegarette dressing, it just had oil. The room was nice, the service aloof.

One of the best pizza I've ever had! I had the Meatball Pizza and it was to die for. I'm normally not a fan of thin crust pizza but the crust they make is just perfect. And of course the fresh basil was just the perfect garnish on the heavenly pizza.  I also had the Blueberry Wine Cooler and it was just perfect for me since I was in the mood for some wine. I also tried the Mint Watermelon Wine Cooler and that one has a pretty interesting flavor. You wouldn't even be able to taste the wine in that one, so be careful!  Service was also amazing! My group took a while to get out orders in but our servers were very accommodating.

This is a good joint.  Very outgoing, the staff really does seem to care about getting things right.  The first time was average enough that I waited a good 60 days before trying it again.  Good pizza, small pizza's, excellent ingredients, wonderful soups, by the way.

Ive been having a huge craving for "red sauce" these days and decided to check out a new place. I had heard a ton of great things about this place so we decided to go.   First off, good luck finding the place. There is no signage on the street or building, we actually walked through the door to the hostess and asked if we were in the right place. We were.   We were seated quickly and the staff was all very nice. The music in this place is a touch to loud for a Monday afternoon lunch crowd.   For starters we ordered the meatball trio and the fried polenta sticks. Both were freaken amazinnnnng!!!!   For pizzas we ordered the standard Pepperoni and then also the Big Star. Both pizzas were good, but didn't knock my socks off. Also they were a bit greasy and the crust was pretty chewy and hard to cut through with a fork.  The hubs and I both agreed that we would most likely not be going back unless someone invited us out and that's where they wanted to go. It wasn't a terrible experience it was just meh for us.

Ate here last night and the food and service was very good. Every body there was super friendly and helpful and they all deserve a raise. Had burratta to start which came with some grilled bread which we liked. Also had a pizza with sausage, goat cheese, mushrooms and onions. Liked the crust it was nice and light and the toppings were all of high quality. Also had sides of brussels w/ pancetta and a meatball in sauce and both were good. Other pluses were the beer list and the wine list as well as the retro diner-like ambiance. Overall I would definitely recommend this place and I will be back but I must warn people who read reviews that compare this place to Bianco that it is not at that level. Not that they themselves are claiming that its just that every time a good pizza place opens up some yelp reviewers claim that Bianco has been bested or equalled and it just isn't the case. As long as you don't go in with those expectations you will find some pretty delicious pizza and some great drinks in a nice atmosphere.

My first time here! Ordered half Casanova (no prosciutto) and half At Last. They accidentally gave us half The Answer (they sound similar) and were awesome enough to bring out a free pizza to correct the error. I didn't care for the At Last, I don't like corn on pizza or in pasta and I had to add salt for flavor. My friend loves it, though. I loved the Casanova, goat cheese and dates are an amazing combo. The bombolini dessert was yummy as well. Great, attentive service! I hope to come back soon, loved their crust.

Dinner for 5.  - Ambiance (5/5) Loved the outdoor patio  - Service (5/5) Super friendly, super fast service.  - Manifesto Pizza, $14 (4/5) Really great mushroom, sausage, and goat cheese toppings.  A tad bit soggy though, with toppings sliding off.  - Sweet Potato Pizza, $13 (5/5) Otherworldly delicious.  My colleagues kept raving about it, and now I understand why.  This one had perfect crust too.    - Value (4/5) One pizza is big enough to serve 1.5 people, so it's pretty decent value.    - Final Word Great pizzas (even for a self professed CT pizza snob).  Will be dreaming about that sweet potato pizza for a long time.
We had the best pizza EVER and the best spaghetti and meatballs EVER!! Great atmosphere, and Isaac made the experience worth coming back.  Great service too!

We went during the first week it was open. We LOVE Windsor and Postino's so we really wanted to try out their new spot! The food... DELICIOUS! WE had the veggie board, and the sweet potato pizza. Both were great! I loved the food. :) The hostesses didn't seem to be on the same page though. We had one tell us we would be in a booth, and ask if we needed a high-chair, another come after to take us to our seats outside at a table, for 4 (we were a group of 5)  and again, ask us if we needed a high chair.  I will let all that slide since it was their first week. One other suggestion though.... Bike rack! Great location for bikers, but no place to lock up!  Also it seems kinda odd that there is no entrance from the street.   Overall, great food! Can't wait to go back and try some other pizzas!
Great place for a craft beer and fresh pizza. Classy joint, but not too pricey. They even have take out too!

After having made the wonderful discovery of Joyride shortly after moving to the midtown area, my fiancée and I were very curious about the pizza joint next door. We had put it off for a few months, because frankly there are a lot of really good pizza joints in Phoenix. Thankfully she suggested it tonight, because I really love Federal Pizza now. The ambiance was cool, TVs has March Madness on, and the food was really good. Our server was top notch, knew all of the specials, and was quick to make suggestions if we were unsure what to order. Excellent beer menu, if you're into craft beers, and the fiancée really enjoyed her wine cooler, per yelp suggestions. We had the Brussel sprout appetizer to start, which was good, but not mind blowing. The pizza though was top notch. I got a plain ole pepperoni and she got the At Last pizza. So freaking good. Both of them. I liked hers possibly more but I can't because I'm a meat eating beer drinking man. Jk but seriously good. You should try federal pizza. We want to eat outside next, I'm sure it will be great.

Pizza is delish. Salads are great. Beer is amazing. Service is good.  Covered parking.  Lunch specials. Happy Hour. Beer growlers available. Drive thru. I love this place.  It one of my lady's favorite spots.

Changing my review to 5 stars! After I left my previous review someone from Federal reached out to me, agreed that the meatballs cost too much and offered to send me a $50 gift card. I provided my address and received the gift card within a couple of days. I am so impressed with this restaurant and sincerely appreciate the awesome customer service! Thanks Federal Pizza!!

My daughter and I were attempting to try Windsor across the street but they had a wait so we decided to try out Federal Pizza.  I wasn't really in the mood for pizza (weird, I know) but Joyride looked super busy.    I ordered the caprese sandwich and my daughter ordered the margherita pizza.  The sandwich was good, just your normal caprese though,  nothing special.  I tried a slice of pizza and I immediately fell in love!!  This thing literally melted in my mouth.  It doesn't look like much but this is an example of "it tastes better than it looks".  The olive oil they put on it is so rich and yummy and added a great touch!  Good crust and the cheese is yumm.  Service was great, our drinks were promptly refilled and everyone was super pleasant.    I think this might become my new favorite pizza place but just to be sure I have to come back and make sure.

Best lunch ever! My boyfriend and I went had such a great experience. The pizza I had was so fresh and delicious as was the salad -- super crisp greens and perfectly tossed with a yummy dressing. He had the meatball sub and it was to die for. Great service, really nice atmosphere, highly recommend!
Everyone super nice, appetizers good, but the pizza was not good, it was soggy. Ive been in the valley my whole life and have eaten at differnt pizza restaurants and we still have our favorites.

Buy a growler and take it home...okay you got me.  I was wary when I ordered my chef's whim pizza. I thought it literally was going to be made on the fly and whatever he felt like. It's actually just a daily special pizza. No you don't get a unique pizza to you. Sadly...thats what i was hoping for.  Instead it was a very vegetarian sounding pizza. It had beets and corn in it..which scared me.  I have never eaten beets before...so i was kind of scared. I went through with my decision...mostly because my wife made it for me. Good thing because the pizza was delicious. Not sure what beets are supposed to taste like...i thought they would be red, they were yellow..and sweet tasting. Is that normal? not sure but the pizza was good.  Anyways...ended the night with my growler in hand...+1 for me.

I had been meaning to try Federal Pizza since they first opened up but kept putting it off because I felt like it was just going to be another pizza place. Boy was I wrong! Those guys and gals at Upwards Projects definitely know how to create a winning restaurant!   My husband and I stopped here for a late lunch and can't wait to come back. Since it was such a nice day, we sat on the cute patio and were able to enjoy the slight breeze. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. We ordered the Mister Mister - a platter of deep friend goodies. This included sweet potato, zucchini, artichokes, and mozzarella. The mozzarella was definitely my favorite. I liked the other vegetables as well, but the artichokes (which I normally love) didn't really do it for me. The leaves were too crispy.   For our pizza, we ordered the Brussels Sprout - roasted brussels sprouts, pancetta, and manchego cheese. Oh. Man. New favorite pizza. The crust was soft and crunchy, the sprouts were well cooked and tasty, and I loved the bite of the cheese. Mmm. We took home our leftovers and ate it for dinner that night! I would go back for this pizza alone, but they also have several other pizzas that look delicious.   I also want to go back to try their cobbler dessert (made with Churn ice cream) and I heard their homemade wine coolers are good. I'll definitely be back and soon!

Been dying to try Federal Pizza...since we love Postinos, Joyride Tacos and Windsor. We met some of our foodie friends there, which was great because we got 4 different pizzas and shared...we all eat vegetarian too and there were such great options!  Here's what we had: -Gemini- excellent flavor - my husbands favorite...the Gorgonzola was the perfect cheese mixed with the other ingredients -Margherita- great and simplistic -At Last - super tastes with all the veggies...wish we would have not left off the goat cheese, but not everyone was a fan of goat cheese -Brussels Sprout - had to get it without pancetta...this one was my favorite! Super super flavorful...  The dough for the crust was delish! I would say this place ranked above Pizzeria Bianco for me...and I love Biancos.  We finished off the meal with dessert: Bombolini. Warm sugar donuts with chocolate dipping sauce...great end to the meal  I would highly recommended FP to everyone!!

Came here for the first on Friday the 25th of January. I came with two friends and we were pretty hungry. Since they only sell 12" pizzas we decided to forego any appetizers and decided on two Pepperoni pizzas. The service was good, I like how they do team service. A few different waiters/waitresses came by to address our needs and to bring us drinks. One waitress would say do you guys need more drinks and then a totally different person would come by with our drinks. The Pizza itself was pretty good. I was a big fan of the giant pepperoni slices that cover the entire pizza. The sauce was ok, but the thing that endeared me to this pizza is the crust. The brick oven does wonders for it. It was crispy with some slight burnt spots on the outside (which I like) and the inside was nice and delicious. All in all this is a solid pizza spot.

I've had the opportunity to visit Federal Pizza several times since they first opened a few years ago. I hate admitting this, but on every single visit, I always end up leaving just a tad disappointed. Mind you, I've never wanted to confess why, as I feel doing so just makes me seem out of touch with what's trending in downtown Phoenix. But I'm going to go ahead and just flat out say it:  Their pizza just ain't that great. Period.    But that doesn't necessarily mean that it's a bad place, because I do feel that there's a lot of things that Federal does right. It's just that the one thing that they fail to do right, just happens to be the most crucial.  Located within a rather trendy area off of Central, Federal operates out of a building that used to be an old bank. The place has that manufactured retro design that fits in pretty consistently with the cluster of other restaurants in the area. Which makes sense, since they're all owned by the same company. Whether or not those things painted on the wall are quotation marks or floating sperm is currently debatable.  One must keep in mind, since these restaurants are all owned by the same company (Upward Projects), this somewhat sterilizes the whole "local business" feel. In other words, Federal never really had to "grow" as a business in order to build a core customer base. The advantages were already in place from the beginning.  But let's get to the food. For starters, we've had the Mister Mister, which is strangely absent from their online menu. We've also tried their "seasonal" burrata.  I'll glady admit that whatever burrata they're using here is prime stuff. Dare I say, it's the best burrata we've tasted - without going outside of Phoenix that is. A creamy texture that's just bursting with flavor, complimented by the awesome fig spread and evoo, I consider it a must-order. My only complaint: the skimpy crostini is an embarrassing inclusion. You get four of them, which combined, is the equivalent of maybe one slice of bread. Sadly, it will be gone before you're even halfway through the cheese. You're then forced to finish the remainder of the rather generous portion of the serving with a fork. I'm sorry, but burrata this good should be served on some thick cuts of house made bread, not paper-thin pathetic little slices of crostini. Another disadvantage, is that it's not always available due to being a seasonal item - even though I've never considered burrata to be seasonal. Whatever.  I'm willing to give them some props with their ordering. Federal allows you to order half-half, including combining red and white sides. This is something that few pizza places seem to allow, as they've developed this uppity attitude that doing so will, in fact, "ruin" the pizza. My girlfriend and I debunked this theory years ago, so I'm glad that Federal doesn't put up a fuss.  As for the pizzas: I'm not a big fan of their margherita, as they use whole tomato slices rather than just the sauce. Not that there's anything wrong with that approach. La Grande Orange also uses slices, and I still find their pizza to be some of the best in the city. My favorite of all of Federal's option is the Casanova, with the Brussels Sprout and At Last both being clever little creations that serve their purpose. Federal uses high quality ingredients, so they at least understand that aspect of pizza making. But every time I eat here, I'm quickly reminded of why I've never become a regular. Their crust just isn't very good. I typically associate great pizza with bubbly crust that has a nice char to it. This crust is soft, chewy, doughy, and according to my girlfriend, draws comparisons to the crust you'd find at Little Caesar's or Humble Pie.     The Lil' Triple is an excellent dessert, channeling their Churn toasted fluff to be layered on top of Oreo crumbles and chocolate cream/mousse. You can't go wrong with it. But again, things always change here, so I can't really recommend anything because there's no guarantee that it'll be available.    The servers have always been polite and pleasant, despite having some extremely slow service on some pretty dead evenings. Additionally, the restaurant itself is very wisely designed, incorporating heavy sound paneling into the ceiling. This really helps keep the volume under control in a place that can often get pretty crowded.  Like I said, there's good and there's bad. While it's a cool little place that offers some pretty decent selections. Unfortunately, I just can't bring myself to give it more than three stars due to their lackluster pizza crust. If your crust sucks, your pizza sucks.    I used to say it was worth the occasional visit, but I think we've now finally realized that if we want to burn 50 bucks on a dinner, there are far superior pizza places available.

This place is the cat's meow. A delightful experience.  Atmosphere is great. Love what they did with the place. Relaxing and trendy at the same time.  We chose to sit at the bar to skip the wait.  The bartender with the English accent had a great personality ... funny, informative.   We came on a Monday and chose to partake in their awesome $20 pizza and booze special. The wine and beer selection was great and had the same thought and care to it that Postinos has. We had ourselves a refreshing white blend, perfect for a hot and humid night.   We split some polenta sticks to start. They were good but underwhelming. The taste reminded me a bit of the fried macaroni and cheese from TGI Fridays. Can't figure out if that is a good thing... Next time I think we will split a salad to go with our pizza. They look scrumptious.  We chose the pizza with the brussel sprouts and manchego, but without the prosciutto. Yummmmm! Hard to believe I hated brussels as a kid. This pizza can make anyone eat their veggies! The crust was perfect. My husband loved it too and he usually doesn't care for pizza that doesn't have tomato sauce.   Although I loved the wine we were drinking I was insanely curious about their wine coolers.
