So my husband finished off the wine and I ordered the grapefruit ginger cooler. It went down way too easy. I can see how these can be addictive. And they pack quite the boozy punch.  While sitting at the bar I noticed they have a drive through. SHUT THE FRONT DOOR!! I almost fell out of my seat. So you are saying I can get one of their delicious pizzas AND their booze to go without even leaving my car? I can enjoy it in my pajamas with my booty planted on my couch while watching my nerdy BBC shows??   We asked if their patio was dog-friendly. Why yes it is. I can picture our dog at our feet on their cute little patio that overlooks Central after the weather isn't hellaciously hot anymore.   So yes, of course we would return. Duh. I would take Federal Pizza over a 3 hour wait and a side of pretentiousness at Pizzeria Bianco any day.
Great spot for a co workers bday party.  Food was perfect.  Wait staff was Johnny on the spot with everything.  The lunch deal was perfect and the Casanova pizza was great!

Federal Pizza is honestly unlike any pizza place I've been to in Arizona. I went for my second visit last night and the Casanova keeps me coming back (try it, you won't regret it). The sweetness of the fig combined with richness of the ricotta is just absolutely amazing. And the crust... oh man it's good. We also ordered a half sweet potato and half brussel sprouts pizza which also didn't disappoint. I would choose the brussel sprouts over the sweet potato, but it was nice to try something new besides pepperoni and sausage. For dessert, you have to order to bombolini. They are amazing!  The only downside is limited parking and wait time, but both are worth it. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone.

The staff, overall vibe, tap beers, bar n all of federal is great; however, the food today was pretty weak. (I know they can do better n have done much better in the past) The pizza just had way too much crust, lacked sauce, the roasted onions had a bad after taste n there was a total of 2 olives on it. The wedge salad is done slightly diff here n it's one of my fav salads but I cld def do without the dates; untraditional, and the wedge doesn't need em.

Such a great atmosphere, amazing food, and the staff is so nice and accommodating. I had the Double Down (lunch special 7 days a week) that includes a 1/2 pizza and salad for only$10.50! I had the Manifesto pizza with sausage, mushrooms, goat cheese and fennel which was so good and the Caesar salad. I didn't have anything to complain about and will be back for sure!

I have been here a couple of times. The service was great and the atmosphere is nice, casual and laid back.  The pizza is alright. I've tried a couple different pizzas here. I didn't love the sauces they used and didn't love the crust texture or taste. However, I really enjoyed the food items that were not pizza here. Their sides, salads, and soups were tasty. I'm interested in trying their other menu items. I would come back here, but not for the pizza.

Wow!! New favorite place in the world! Have been here once before but it was so long ago I forgot about this little gem. Once you get thru the entrance (follow the arrows) be prepared for entry to pizza heaven!  The crust, it was so fresh the wheat must have been harvested that day!  Never had I tasted such good pizza 'bread'.  The sauce, toppings all were amazing. Went all veggie tonight but I had the pepperoni last time. Amazing from what I can remember.  The kids size was perfect to split (my kids are still little). If they wanted more we could have just ordered another but when I told them about the bombolini dessert (donuts) they were OK with just half the pizza each.   The dessert was amazing and a great size to share. The tap beers available were incredible. Nice strong 10%+ abv. beers as well as lighter choices. 7 day a week happy hour made a 9$ drink drop to $6. FANTASTIC SERVICE, AMBIANCE AND FOOD make this my new favorite place in the world!

Came in for $20 pizza and bottle of wine special on Tuesday night and everything was super! The service was really nice and attentive without being suffocating. The cork on my rose bottle popped as we walked 100 feet away from the restaurant. The server wasn't kidding, it really is fun!!!
Took my son out to lunch while visiting at college. Fun and trendy place.

It seems like I come here every Monday. Their 2 pitcher and pizza deal is off the god damn charts. They have quality beer and even more quality pizza.  You will not walk away disappointed if you dine here.

I was in town business and just left a Diamondbacks opening day game on March 31st. I was wanting pizza and yelped around for some places that was open. I found this place and was amazed with the good reviews. In addition this place was one of a few that was still open. Glad we picked this place. Staff welcomed us and sat us down. I ordered a pepperoni pizza. The pizza is one of the best I had. It had a unique flavor and it is wood fried. The crust is very crunchy and the tomato sauce is very good!!! The restaurant was very cozy with a lounge like atmosphere. They have a full bar with plenty of TVs. Next time I will come enjoy pizza and drink a few beers. Really cool place!! I recommend Federal Pizza to anyone looking for delicious pizza!!
Margherita pizza, meatball pizza. . Fabulous crust!  Insanely friendly service.  We'll be back.

Just went there for lunch today. They have a good "double down" deal - half sale and half a pizza for $10.50  between 11am-4pm. I had the chicken panzanella and the big star pizza. I finished most of the order. The service was good as well there.

The food was great and the wait staff was very pleasant. The atmosphere was very cozy. The only problem was needing to switch tables after ordering. We were seated outside on a beautiful night; however, there was a man sitting next to us speaking at a very high volume swearing every other word. The staff was accommodating and switched our table but the man was so loud you could hear him from inside! Aside from that they do have great food and friendly service.

Its got a cool casual feel to it..I love the "Shorty" beer glasses they have.Must have for trying on different beers. The warm donuts with the hot chocolate sauce is a sinful delight that is hard to resist.

I so wish that I could give Federal a better review but it just was so mediocre I can't. There's just nothing that stands out here to tell you about.   We had the wedge, spaghetti and meatballs, supergrinder and pizza. It was all eatable and not bad but just so lackluster.   I'll stick to Windsor or Postino.

The food here is extremely good and the service has always been impeccable.  The one time something came out that was sub par, the waitress apologized profusely and removed it from the bill.  Once they also accidentally brought the wrong pizza, but quickly corrected it and comped it.  Great atmosphere and no snobbery. Fast friendly service at lunch time.

One word: Porcetta! Probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten (even better than the Porkwich across the street at Windsor)! The pizzas here are pretty amazing as well, and if you get there before 5 the drink specials are unbeatable!

I really enjoyed my experience here, even more so than Windsor.  Fresh ingredients, yummy pizza, love their crust, and good variety of drinks.  They even have a drive through!  Similar to Postinos, they have Monday and Tuesday night specials where you can get a whole pizza and a bottle of wine or 2 pitchers of beer for $20.
I LOVE this place! the Arancini, and the Margherita pizza are phenomenal!!!!

Um, YUM!  What a great menu for unique pizza. This isn't your average pizza parlor, rather it focuses more on gourmet pizza.  I was lucky as I was on  a food tour, so I was able to really sample a huge amount of their pizzas. I was really excited for the brussel sprout pizza (say what?) as I love them, but my favorite was the Big Star. Delish.  YOu can also get beer to go now!  Heck yeah! And a drive thru is now available.

It's good, but there's better out there. I would definitely choose this place over a chain pizza place though. It is pricey-happy hour drink specials are the way to go if you are boozing a little.  Join the email club to get a free pizza which will also help on the cost.  Good Friday night place to go with a group of friends.

Dan the bartender was a pretty nice and casual guy. Music had a nice peppy rhythm to it. I grabbed a little lunch at the bar. Everything was pretty perfect including the breeze coming through the back doors.  I like this place. Very nice people and atmosphere.  I ate the wedge. Well done!

I absolutely love every restaurant these guys roll out.  They've done it again with Federal Pizza.  There are a lot of great places to get pies in this town but only a few good sit down and drink and eat pizza places.  I love LGO but it's all the way in Arcadia.  This place is just as good.    We tried the brussel sprout pizza w/pancetta (I was sceptical but it was awesome) and the meatball pizza.  The meatballs here are a 3 meat mixture including veal and schreiners sausage.  It was unbelievable.    Ok, the beer.  Growlers (64oz) of ANY of the drafts are $15 and $10 to refill.  Apparently if you order food to go you get a 50% discount on beer to go which means $5 growler refills.  I'll be coming here quite often.  The beers are diverse and unique.  I picked up a growler of Green Flash IPA (8% ABV) and because they just opened I got it for $10 to start.  Such an awesome deal.  GET OVER HERE RIGHT NOW AND TRY IT!!!!!

Love going to this local spot. I've been a few times now and was sold on it the other  night when we went for a late bite. 10:30 PM and the place was still packed. Had a pitcher of beer, shared an app, a salad and the arugula, dates, prosciutto and ricotta pizza...it was perfect! The service was great, everyone that was working was attentive and helpful. They even recognized us the next morning when we walked by on our way home to get coffee! I would recommend this place...for lunch, dinner, a prolonged weekend lunch or a quick late night meal. I will be back.

Upward Projects...I challenge you to open a place that I don't like. Actually, don't. Pretty sure it's impossible anyway.   I went to Federal Pizza for lunch with my mom today and let me tell you...I was not disappointed in any sense of the word. The vibe is laid back, the layout is open, and the decor is natural and minimalistic while being stylish at the same time. We struggled between sitting at the bar or at a table as we're used to doing bar at Postino and table at Windsor but the booth won.   Our server, Jared, gave us enough time to actually look at the drink menu without leaving us wondering if we had a server which was nice. Settled on the Sean Minor pinot noir which I kind of cheated on because I've had it and it's yummy. Light with just enough flavor.  We decided to get the margherita pizza with prosciutto and arugula on half as well as the spaghetti and meatballs and a side salad for me. The pizza was absolutely delicious...the prosciutto added just enough salt to balance out the arugula covered with lemon dressing and the crust was awesome; not too tough and not too doughy. The spaghetti and meatballs were tasty and the meatballs had a good kick to them. Side salad was pretty basic; mixed greens, beets, and a vinaigrette dressing that was really good.   Service was attentive without being overbearing (I'm a server and I appreciate check ups but not every 5 minutes. I promise I'm a little more laid back than that!). I only wish I had tried the dessert as they all sounded fantastic but this is definitely not the last time I'll be going to Federal so I'm sure I'll make room for it on the next trip.

Great thin crust pizza. Oily & messy- as it should be. I was trying to get a taste while driving back w it and it fell apart. So, i just shoved the slice in my mouth like a neanderthal.  I did that 3 times.

We were seated, were given watwr2 then ignored for 20 minutes. A waitress passed our table at least 7 times....was too busy tending to the larger parties around us. I have been here before and was treated decent. So i dont know its just an off day of us service is deteriorating. I'm very disappointed especially after telling my son how good the food was. F- today

Pizza. Perfectly charred, amazingly topped, finger licking good, brick oven style pizza. That is what Federal is servin up with every order...  I haven't eaten here enough to satisfy my curiosity with how they get all of that crunchy goodness into every. single. freaking. bite!  First time I went to Federal Pizza sonny man ate an entire cheese pizza on his own. I mean the kid likes pizza but even I was amazed that he put the whole thing away! I got a single bite of one of his slices... (** disclaimer ** my child is not obese! He's tall and lanky and has the metabolism of an Olympic swimmer)   My mom and I split the Big Star and had a few slices each to take home for the next day. Big Star is all kinds of goodness, olives, mushrooms, bell peppers, more olives, and I don't remember what else. So good! No drinks this time as I was driving home with precious cargo.  The next time I ordered the Manifesto (** I wish they would split the specialty pies. I hope they figure that out soon). This pizza was topped with sausage, mushrooms, feta cheese, and probably some other good stuff I can't recall at the moment. I also ordered the Grapefruit Ginger Cooler, be careful because this is delish and it will, I repeat it will get you buzzin.   There is so, so, so much on the menu that I am killin to try. Uh yeah and I have to get me a growler full of brew to go! Maybe tomorrow for an end of the world jam I'm going to! NTS: get growler.  You know there is something special about the decor here also. Orange booths, raised just a tad. Open view to the kitchen area. Long bar. Groovy chandelier. Amazing patio with red chairs. Love it. Like the rest of the Upward Projects restaurants this is a favourite for me in this city. Lots of hipster vibe with both the staff and the patrons. I dig it.

I have tried several of their pizzas since my friends and I like to share and every single one is delish! Don't even bother with Bianco anymore... skip the wait and crowded dining room and head to Federal instead.
This is the best pizza in Phoenix! My wife and I came here for the first time last week and were so sad that we didn't know that this place existed for the past 30 years!
Omg... this place is bomb! If you haven't been here you are missing out. Monday and Tuesday are the best specials. Check it out!

Not my favorite place but went anyway.. Waitress with an attitude!! Everything we asked her for was treated like an imposition!  The food is ok but the service is consistently  poor!  The Music blared so loud we could not hear each other talk,  we  couldn't even complain loud enough! When we asked our waitress if the music could be turned down she had ask us what we said because she couldn't hear us. (The answer was... I will ask but the owner usually won't let us....)Hard to believe its the same ownership as Windsor and Postinos!!
Best pizza crust! The fresh ingredients and flavors of the meatball pizza was surprisingly excellent! Service was great too!
Stumbled upon this place after meeting up at Lux one day. It's a nice little pizza place, overall a good experience.

My second time dining at Federal was much better.  A margherita pizza done right, a very fresh salad of beets, sweet pears and pecorino, a nice little list of local wines, and wonderful service (read: I'm an adult bartender, not a lame little hipster pretending to be one ).

THIS IS THE EXACT COMPLAINT I FILED WITH THE BBB:  Sunday, June 30th, 2013, my boyfriend picked up our favorite pizza in the valley to eat for an early lunch, the Federal.  Immediately after eating we were both feeling a little off, slight stomach pains, a little bloated but no biggie.  We thought maybe we had over eaten.  By 8:00pm that night I ended up on the floor of my house vomiting profusely into a bowl as I could not reach the bathroom the food poisoning was so severe.    July 1, 2013, I woke up to severe dehydration, and with severe muscle and kidney pain from the extensive vomiting and other lovely experiences I had the entire night.  Unfortunately, my body had gone into such a state of dehydration, that it began to halt the function of my organs. Namely, my esophagus, my lungs, my muscles and my bladder.  Unable to walk, my boyfriend carried me to his truck and sped like a maniac to the hospital.  Arriving at the hospital, the Drs did an MRI and did not like the sound of my heart and I ended up staying in the hospital getting bags upon bags of saline to aid in my severe dehydration.   After a $300 ER bill, two missed days of work for my boyfriend (he was sick too but less so) and three missed days of work for myself, I decided to email the Federal, July 7th, 2013, after recuperating for a week.  I did not ask for compensation, I was not rude or out of line. I wrote the email coming from a concerned patron that feels that something should be done to avoid this ever happening in the future.   What I got was an email back (July 12, 2013) from a Craig Demarco, an owner of Upward Projects, who vilely requested that we handle this matter over the phone.  No problem, I understand that you do not want anything in writing for me to use against you.  Even though I expressly stated I was not out to get them, I was out to incite a change in how the restaurant serves its food.  I agreed to do so and handed over my phone number and gave some times that we could talk, and said if those times didn't work, we should coordinate a better time.   It is officially one week later (July, 19th, 2013) and no response.  Not a call, not an email, not a care. This expresses a complete lack of decorum and respect for the diners that come in to the Federal, and I cannot be less impressed with their actions.  I am disgusted with how this has been handled and really do thank them for really exhibiting how they handle delicate matters such as this.  By not handling them at all.  Update: June 19, 2014 - Nobody from this restaurant or any of the owners have contacted me about my experience.  Still no love.

Best place to get pizza. My boyfriend and I come here on the regular for pepperoni, sausage, garlic, and fresh basil pizza (we build our own), buffalo wings (so delicious and addicting), and beer (they have a great selection with $5 pitchers before 5 pm). Everything is so fresh and delicious and never disappoints. The pizza dough is so light and wood fired to perfection. We once saw a man seated next to us at the bar with a plate full of pizza crusts he didn't eat, which was so surprising to us because the crust is the best part. Sandwiches are great too. We have yet to try their pasta, though. The interior has a sort of retro vibe to it with casual atmosphere. Overall a very fine establishment with amazing food. We will never stop coming here.

Incredibly innovative. Down right sexy interior, fantastic and brave beer selections and the pizza. Good lord the pizza. Fantastic service. One step through the door and you find all the worries of the world melt away. Can not wait to go back. The general manager Aj is a gem who fell from the clouds and our server was a pro.

Upward restuarants does it again.  I love the concept of revamping old buildings.  The food was good.  Service good.  We just happened to hit the first night of official business.  Pizza and friend polenta was carb over-load but so good.  Trendy and cool.  I am nostalgic for the old Humpty Dumpty building next door, that housed the closed Aeillos, this will be the next venture.  Central Avenue is moving and shaking.

Wood fired brussel sprout pizza topped with manchego cheese, lemon zest, and panchetta. Good lord this pizza is so good. For me, Federal Pizza is my favorite pizza in Arizona (okay it's a tie with Bills Pizza in Prescott). But this particular pizza-that probably sounds strange-works. The sharp cheese and hint of lemon is delicious. I am obsessed with this pizza, so much so it's hard for me to order anything else. I've even tried recreating it at home! Hands down, this pizza with fluffy crust is so amazing.   Okay so maybe you hate Brussels sprouts, I get it. But all Federal Pizza is good pizza. I recommend the meatball pizza-I love it because the meatballs aren't giant globes atop the pizza, they slice them so you get them in every bite. I also recommend their house made wine coolers which pairs unique flavors like blood orange and cardamom. Fun fact: Federal got its name because it used to be a bank.

If your on central and do not visit this place, shame on you. Get the chefs whim.  Service may seem slow but it's only because they work so hard to handle everyone equally. Atmosphere is fabulous and the $5 pitchers until 5pm are not a bad deal either.  Come soon and come often.

I love Postino, Windsor and Churn so this was next on my list to try. I had a coupon for a free entree/pasta so my mom and I gave it a shot. The atmosphere is very cute, modern and in a great location!   We ordered: Arancini - always a great appetizer, was perfectly fried and full of flavor Meatball Pizza - everything was great, pizza was a little soggy and had to be eaten with fork/knife, but didn't bother us Garganelli Pasta - perfect blend of ingredients and very light  There are many other items on the menu that I would like to try, so I will definitely be back!

After a lot of hype about Federal I was excited to try it. The restaurant was nicely decorated and laid out, we sat on the patio which was pretty noisy and had to fight some flies. I asked about the wine coolers and the waitress responded with "i hate them" I probed further and she indicated she didn't care for sweet but I was a bit surprised by her bluntness. We shared a ceasar salad which was a great portion size and very tasty (perhaps a bit salty) and a pizza with Shriner's sausage (yum) and gorgonzola. The pizza was good, one of the better ones I have had in Central Phoenix but not the best. I would come back and will probably sit inside or order through the cute drive -thru.
Really loved this place the atmosphere along with the food. We ordered the veggie sandwich and I was blown away with how good it was.  The only downside of this evening was the parking.

I'm surprised the Postino/Upward guys have put out a sub-par restaurant. Its not like them at all. Maybe they need time. If you like eating burnt pizzas in a room with the music so loud it sounds like you're in the trunk of a low-rider then this is the place for you. It was lunch time so the music should be scaled back to suit the patrons, not the wait staff. Maybe its more appropriate at night but lunch time is usually conversation time. The menu is small...8 pizzas, 4 sandwiches and 3 desserts. Just very surprised that every pizza that was delivered to us and our surrounding tables had a black, burned crust. The sandwich was outstanding....but this is called Federal PIZZA. I'll try again in a month to see if they have improved.

Four of us went to Federal Pizza for their $20 special on Tuesdays after 8pm ($20 pizza and a bottle of wine or 2 pitchers of beer) and experienced the best customer service! We were greeted immediately at the door and told about the app NoWait that enables you to "enter" the line on your way to the restaurant to reduce wait time by the hostess. Once we were seated, we placed our orders rather quickly and received a "welcome pizza"! (While it was a wonderful surprise, it is not a normal circumstance to be expected at every visit) Between the four of us, we ordered 2 pitchers of beer, one bottle of wine, 2 salads, and 2 pizzas and the food was incredible! One of the pizzas was slightly burnt (we wouldn't have complained) and the man who brought it out immediately stated that we would be getting another(!) pizza as a replacement to go since he felt it was burnt by their standards! I will be going back frequently and highly recommend the great food and absolutely superb customer service.

Been here twice now. Pizza is on point. Pizza is Neapolitan style. Service is hit or miss. Some of the servers just don't seem to want to be there. Others are super jazzed about the menu. Prefer the latter. Came for my birthday last night. It was my birthday. Had to ask for the dessert menu. Decided against dessert. Blew out the table votive candle. I guess I can say not a place for birthdays. Pizza is good. I had the Margherita.

Satisfaction Guaranteed! I was feeling Italian tonight so i insisted to go here. We sat at the kitchen bar because there was a 30min wait, of coarse dinner rush.. I've tried the margherita before so that's what I ordered and my boyfriend ordered meatball spaghetti. As expected, the pizza was good. I love how the tomatoes are cooked, blackened a little bit by the fired-brick oven. Our pasta came, so i tried it first. I don't know if it's undercooked but it was kinda hard, which I didn't mind. My boyfriend tried it and he also agreed. So we just kept eating our pizza, since we ate at the kitchen bar, the pizza chef asked us how our pizza was? We replied good! But i told him about the pasta was hard. So he told the other chef who made it. The chef then came to us and asked us if he can make a new one. I'm glad that they went above our expectations and did something about it, without us asking to prepare a new one. They also didn't charge me for the meatball spaghetti. We will definitely come back to try the answer (pizza) which was recommended by the pizza chef.

I love most of Upward Projects group of restaurants. This is one of them. The prices here are pretty fair and are about the same as all their competitors. I just got a pepperoni and sausage pizza. They use high quality ingredients in their pizza so you can tell when you take a bite how amazing each ingredient is on its own. The place is always poppin' it seems like. The layout of the restaurant is interesting, but fun. I enjoyed myself while here. They get pretty busy, but we didn't have to wait. The server was friendly and accommodating. You won't regret coming here and check out other Upward Projects restaurants while you are at it. They have some great ones!
After a few correspondences from corporate, I was sent a gift car to return to federal pizza. I have yet to do so but I appreciate the company reaching out and correcting the mistake that happened

Woohoo, I finally visit a place that's newly opened! Ahead of the curve for once! :)  Visited Federal Pizza after the great review from Chow Bella (I think...) regarding the Corn Coins. Went after work on a Thursday, and while the place was very busy, my friend and I were seated immediately.  Service was a little slow, but, like I said, it was very busy. Plus, the extra time gave us plenty of time to debate the menu and choose what we wanted!  We ended up ordering the At Last pizza, Corn Coins, and wine coolers (I had the hibiscus one-- delicious!)  The pizza was GREAT!! It has chiles on it, which adds a little spice and unexpected flavor. The crust held all the veggies really well, but the veggies didn't even overwhelm the pizza. All in all, great!  My friend didn't exactly like the thin crust, but as long as you know it's thinner crust pizza going in, you should be okay.  Disappointing? The Corn Coins. They got a great review from the New Times, but I just didn't like them. I don't know what I was expecting, but they were messy to eat, corn got all up in our teeth, and it was just generally 'meh.' If you love corn, or know what you're getting into with corn coins, go for it! I just wouldn't order it again. Also-- NOT recommended for first dates!  Unexpectedly amazing? The WINE COOLERS! Oh yeah buddy! They bring you the wine cooler in an old school glass bottle that you then pour yourself into a wine glass filled with ice.  My (raspberry? can't remember) hibiscus wine cooler was awesome!! Surprisingly strong, and incredibly delicious. I think I'm going to get 5... I mean 2... the next time I go to FP!  It was ~$20 for both of us, with an appetizer, a split pizza, and drinks. The only other thing I wasn't a fan of was the parking... I KNOW the owners of FP (along with their other restaurants) love doing the complimentary valet parking, I'm just not a fan of having to carry dollars around with me for tip. I don't really carry money around at all, and it's just something else to remember.  All said though, I'll go back. Mostly because of those wine coolers :)

So, this is for take out only. As you can tell from the 5 stars, I'm a big fan. I'm picky about my pizza, and if you're going to go avant-garde on the toppings, they had better be well thought out. And these are. Date and prosciutto with ricotta and argula? Perfectly executed salty/sweet/creamy. Brussel sprout with manchego? Well cooked sprouts with pancetta is an winning combo. Chili/corn/broccolini/goat cheese? I'm not a vegetarian, but if I could eat this pizza all the time, I'd be fine with it (watch for the slow burn, the heat will catch up with you). The crust is nice and thin, well cooked and well seasoned, and the sauce is bright and fresh. If you're looking for a top-notch pizza joint with something other than your usual pepperoni, this is your spot.

The food has always been good. This review is to echo the numerous other reviews about poor customer service.  Please address this at all levels...  It sucks when you really want to be a regular, but roll the dice when you sit down.

Amazing pizzas and Fantastic customer service. We got half Casanova and half sweet potato with prosciutto added mmmmmmm mmmmm It was amazing. This is my new favorite pizza place.... The burrata is gooey deliciousness too!
Mondays and Tuesdays are super radical.  $20 for two pitchers of beer (or a bottle of wine) and a pizza.  Too good to pass up.
So yummy....  Ate there again for lunch today.  Good service, great pizza and salad.  Great lunch deal.  Love the drive through for weekend nights.

Out of this world!  Went with the folks for lunch.  It was bustling so we sat at the bar.  Great decor, great building.  The music was too loud, but that just seems to be the way it goes at hip restaurants nowadays....They brought us out a free appetizer almost immediately. We didnt look a gift horse in the mouth and very much enjoyed the fried veggies and polenta sticks we were given.  Mom ordered the beet and pear salad and made yummy noises the whole time she ate it.  It was lovely, but then I'm a beet slut.  Dad had a pepperoni pizza and was very happy.  The pizza's crust was perfect!  I stumbled upon the porchetta sandwich and even Tony Soprano would order this from Federal on the regular.  It may be the best sandwich ever.  So simple yet complex, the bread was divine, the pork super flavorful....I want one now.  BTW, you can order takeout and they have a drive thru window.....and you can leave there with your own growler of various fancy ales.  Just awesome........kudos!

I admit there is better pizza in Phoenix than most cities I have been to, and this is not the best we have to offer.  But it's pretty good and gets 4 stars for pleasant staff and convenience of the drive through pick up.

What a pleasant surprise! My group of friends had the most friendly, prompt waitress in the history of the world. And the pizza was perfect.  GO THERE ON A MONDAY!  You can get either 2 pizzas + 1 pitcher of beer (or something like that) or one pizza and a bottle of wine for $20. And the waitress was like, "Get the most expensive wine for the best deal." So I did.  Just go. It's not too loud, not too quiet. On a steamy evening July it was a little warm inside (that's what she...never mind.). But who cares.  I'm going to have to go back and back to try the rest of the menu. Oh, and I got the margherita pizza. Everything about it was perfect. I can taste the delish dough in my watering mouth right now.  Oh, there's a drive-through!
Chicken parm dish was great!! I recommend trying one of their homemade wine coolers!!! Very cool ambiance, with a beautiful patio.
Good food and good beer. A little pricey for a smaller Sized pizza and pitcher of beer but he ambiance and customer service makes up for it. I recommend. 4 stars!
Great wood oven pizza, fantastic setting, over the top service. Mgr Tammy took extra care of us!
Because of a whole in our pizza, they gave us a whole new pizza for free which we boxed up and took home thanks FP!!!!

We ate here two nights ago for the first time. The best thing about this place and that it is a nice sit down restaurant but it also has a drive through for take out. The pizza was delicious and I would absolutely go here again and recommend this place for sit down and take out.
Beyond delicious. I sampled a few different things today and was impressed. The blueberry hibiscus wine cooler is enough to get me back there!

Tried the Casanova with all the toppings a I now have my favorite pizza in Phoenix! The crust is delicious and so Is the mix of flavors. We also ordered the Brussel sprout pizza and it is sooooi good. They also have amazing customer service. Loved it!

The pizza is great. We've come here for a couple years now. Josh (one of the people who answers the phone) is extremely rude and shouldn't be answering phone calls. This has happened several occasions and has turned us off from going/ordering from here lately. It's not cool to feel like I shouldn't be calling a place that does take out orders because the person on the other side is extremely rude!

Loved it! Went with a group of 8 and had a great time. Love the $20 for any pizza and either a bottle of wine or two pitchers of beer. You can even take the wine home if you don't finish it. Besides that, the food was delicious and the service was excellent. I'm a vegan and our server and the kitchen were very accommodating. I ordered a vegetable board, and when one of the servers (not even mine or the one I made the order to) saw that it wasn't vegan, she had them redo it and comped it from my bill. It was delicious. I also had a vegan pizza and it was excellent. Will be back!!

I've always loved pizza. It's probably the one food item I could eat everyday. Since I finally had the opportunity to try the famous pizza place in Phoenix (which I didn't care for at all), I've wanted to explore other local pizzerias to determine who really had the best pizza in the Valley. I had found Federal through a Yelp search and I've been wanting to try it for a while.  I finally went last week. We were seated on their outdoor patio right away. We went on a Sunday around 3 and they were having a happy hour. However, neither of us got drinks. I think we had about 3 different people ask us if we wanted drinks, I guess they were just being thorough. I've also been on an artichoke kick lately so we got the Big Artichoke. It was definitely big and very good. The truffle oil wasn't too pungent or strong. The seasoning was great and it wasn't too buttery or oily as some places prepare it. Just as we were about to finish, our pizza came.  We got the Margherita pizza with fresh parmesan on top. The fresh parmesan was so good and not like anything else I've had before. The pizza was also delicious. The cheese was great and had that slightly crispy burnt cheese taste where the cheese met the crust. The crust was also crispy and really good.   My boyfriend and I both agreed that this was the best pizza we've had so far in AZ. However, we do have another place I want to check out before I can officially crown Federal as my favorite. Until then, Federal is definitely somewhere we'll have to go back to. We also walked to Churn which is right across the street for some dessert which was a perfect way to end a perfect meal.

Great thin crust New York style pizza. We were looking for a quick bite and were not disappointed. We ate outside on a nice patio with a modern az feel. Good choice of beverages, but the pizza? Total yum.
The wine coolers are dangerously good!~
I would give the place 4.5 stars. The dough and quality of cheeses and meats used is just superb. Too far from north phoenix and can't get it with Ubereats!

My wife and I discovered this place recently when looking for eateries open after 9 p.m. I have heard it mentioned a time or two among friends but never tried it until now. We were both very pleasantly surprised. The food was great despite the pizza being much different than what we are accustomed to it was delicious. The prices were very reasonable as well. And to top it off the soundtrack in this place is great,  damn near the exact same tunes I play in my own business and it definitely give this place a good vibe. We've already decided that we are regulars from this point forward.

So are you guys going to to have water or do you want anything else... The food was great but the service from our server was lackluster. We got a salad, two pizzas, three appetizers, two glasses of wine and a pitcher yet our server seemed to think we were going to be a table of water and pizza. Food was great but our server couldn't get it right. Missed drinks and wrong orders; for my first time at Federal Pizza, I don't know if I'd necessarily come back as a result of the service.

I've enjoyed a fair share of pizza in my life and I have to say Federal's margherita pizza was one of the best! We stopped by for a late dinner and were greeted with a nice selection of craft brews and delicious food options. The staff was friendly and laid back and had a good knowledge of both the beer and the food. We settled on the simplest of pizzas they serve but were blown away by how good it was with juicy tomatoes and light crust. Sadly, we live in San Diego but will know where to go when we come back to Phoenix!

The pizza is AMAZING but the hospitality is even better! We were eating here for the second time this week, when a couple of middle-aged women were perpetually giving my family the stink eye as my baby made happy noises throughout dinner, I got fed up and decided to leave the table and my hot pizza and walk my baby around out front. Another woman (whom I think was the manager) made sure to stop me on my way out and remind me that it was a family restaurant and that I shouldn't worry about anyone else and that my family had every right to be eating there as anyone else.

I've been here a few times over the last 6 months, and every experience has been perfect. Nights out with friends, dates, and a fathers day meal with dad have all proved to be fantastic. The decor and atmosphere just absolutely incredible, and the staff is friendly and stylish. Be sure to ask what the Chef's Whim is.. today was SO AWESOME! Mortadella with pistachio, caramelized onions and pesto! Woo! The Big Star is my favorite. They also have brilliant selection of great beers and wines. The beers are so well priced.. you can't afford *not* to drink beer at Federal Pizza! ALSO! The SOUND SYSTEM here is incredible!

I received a coupon from Upward Bound for a BOGO for a lunch item during the week - so my husband and myself after seeing a film at the Arizona Center decided to try it on New Years Day.  It was very busy - seemed to be lots of out of town visitors.  The service was very good and so was the food - my husband had the pizza with pepperoni and I had the mushroom ravioli.  We both took part in their homemade wine coolers - my husband had the strawberry/rhubarb and I had the raspberry/lavender.  Not sweet at all and we got a deal on those too.  They were $5.00 instead of $8.00 - maybe because it was before 5:00????    Just a warning when you go, the building is not marked as Federal Pizza and the entrance is off of the (free!) parking lot behind the building - the entrance is not marked either.  Regardless, give it a try - I'm glad we did and we'll definitely go back!

You will love this place! We found Federal Pizza using Yelp while visiting our daughter at Grand Canyon University (GCU) from CO. Great food, ambiance, and the service is top notch. Kuddos to Dan and his staff!

Heard about this gem from friends. Loved the atmosphere very laid back. The price point was great. Super budget friendly. The food was really quality. Brussels were awesome, the wings were very crispy and delicious. The pizza didn't blow me away... but it was a good pie for AZ. I can't wait to go back

Can't rate the sit down experience, but the take out I picked up last night was Delicious.  The gal who answered the phone to take my order was sharp (not always the case in my experience), efficient, and professional... with a little added warmth to make you feel served even on the phone.  I arrived a little early to grab my Zaa and decided to drive to the drive up door.  I was greeted at my window promptly and my food was brought out to my car! Sadly no roller skates, but hey car side service is pretty sweet!  Pizza was really good, crust perfect, toppings excellent, defiantly fits the upper echelon pies in the area. On par with Parlor, Humble Pie for sure.  Will update after I make it back for a sit down... also I heard a rumor that they have half price Growlers for take out!  Going back for sure!

My friends and I did lunch at the newly opened Federal Pizza. It was pretty busy for 11 A.M., and after going there, I can understand why.  The decor is awesome. Unique salt & pepper shakers at each table, a long bar, open-sided booths, and an open kitchen. Plus, there is a drive-thru pick-up window.   We ordered the fig & prosciutto, the margarita, and the corn & green chili pizza. While I think I actually like Humble Pie's pizzas better (they're both of the same wood-fired style, but Humple Pie's flavors are richer and there isn't as much crust), these pies were tasty. Lots of toppings and fresh ingredients. They go light on the cheese, but that's okay. Makes you feel less guilty about eating half of an entire pizza.  The best part of the meal, though? The wine coolers. These aren't some Seabreeze or Boonsfarm stuff. These are fantastically flavored, bubbly, and refreshing coolers. And at $5 for a bottle full, they're a screaming deal.  (All their beer pitchers, wine coolers, and glasses of wine are $5 before 5 PM, FYI.)  I did see some of the pasta and salad dishes folks ordered, and they looked pretty darn tasty.  Needless to say, I'll be back.

I'm down for pizza any day of the week day or night!  I've been meaning to try this place since first hearing about it, but I never found myself on that side of town.  Lucky for me I was attending an event just a few miles from their location.  Walked right in and the place was busy.  We ended up sitting at the bar so that we wouldn't have to wait for a table.  The bartender was friendly and made us feel welcomed.  Hands down on the pepperoni pizza.  A 12" was just enough to get my fix.  We also ordered the chopped salad which was fresh to death!  I'm putting this place in my top 10 pizza joints to eat a pie.  You can't go wrong with the food or the location.    Pizza pie till I die!

While I quite enjoy the pizza here, I fail to see what the uproar is about.  The margherita pizza is good, but I guess once you've had NY pizza, nothing else can compare (my apologies for sounding like a pizza snob).  The meatball pizza is delicious, but I would recommend to get it without onions if you're not a fan because they tend to overdo the onions here.  Overall, I'd go back, but it's not a must for me.
Great food, atmosphere, and service! And Churn is across the street. The Parlor has some good competition!
Great pizza joint.  So glad we came here.  Explore the menu.  Did I mention:  BOMB PIZZA

Federal has some amazing pizza combinations. The Casanova is a real winner as well as the brussel sprout pizza for me. The Casanova has prosciutto, ricotta, dates, and fresh arugula combining sweet, salty, and a tad of spice from the arugula making for an awesome flavor combo. Love love love it. I always enjoying hearing the chef's whim which is a random pizza concoction that the chef thinks up for that day--always different, always delicious.   When just going for a snack the polenta is tasty and comes in fried little sticks with a dipping sauce, and only $4.   Federal has a great draft beer selection and as the other Upward Projects restaurants offers it's before 5pm specials... This time wine, draft beer, or in-house made wine coolers.  Wonderful place to kick back on the patio and enjoy life :)

After my favorite eatery in the neighborhood closed in 2015 I was avoiding the vicinity. But I finally returned to dine on Central and Camelback. Someone told me to stop being a pouty brat. (I can't use the exact words that were said to me because this is a family website.)  Service at Federal Pizza is a cut above all pizza joints. They treat customers like they're dining at a classy establishment. We got our glasses repeatedly refilled, dirty dishes promptly cleared away, and all the staff were aware of our table.  The F&A veggie board was good (I would def order again), the salad was good (would def reorder) and the polenta was good (would reorder). The romesco sauce was fantastic. Where has it been all my life? The pizza was so-so.  From the pictures on Yelp, I was hesitant to try the pizza because I didn't think I would like the crust. But crust tasted okay and the pizza was saucy. The downside: the crust is weak and requires some attention getting it off the tray without spilling off the toppings, there was very little cheese, the toppings were overly sweet.   So most likely I will probably not reorder pizza. But I was happy with the veggie selections and FP is a good place to be.

A lot as changed since my original review of Federal Pizza. I am now gluten intolerant. I wish that it was just a phase or something trendy that I'm trying out, but not the case. Sadly,  Federal needs to update their menu to accommodate the gluten challenged people. No GF pizza crust which seems unusual because their thing is pizza. There is a GF pasta option, but they charge an additional $3.00 for the pasta. I feel ripped off and disappointed. I enjoyed Federal for 3 years, but I will no longer be dining here until/unless they offer a GF crust and come down on the increase on the GF pasta.

I was there for lunch on a Saturday. It was fantastic in every way. The porchetta sandwich was brilliant. Would recommend splitting the porchetta sandwich with a pizza with friends. We has the Casanova Pizza. It was incredible. The pizza was like a four-part harmony with the fig as the soprano soaring over the chord. The pecorino served as a nice and sharp bass note while the rest melded together beautifully. Top 3 pizza in my life.   Had a wine cooler. Interesting, but I should've known that I wouldn't want all of that sweetness. Much more of a beer guy. Speaking of, you must get the Sierra Nevada Hefe. It's one of the best I've ever had.  Beautiful restaurant, happy people that care about the food. This is a must.  (Sorry for the shoddy writing, I tapped this out on my phone)

Awesome place! I called in to get pizza and had never been here before. Because there was a mix up, they ended up giving me two pizzas for free. Amazing customer service, fantastic management and great food. Couldn't ask for anything better. Plus, the pizza was absolutely divine. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who needs to a slice! Just be advised they only sell one size of pizza- a 12in.

I recently moved back to Phx from San Francisco, so needless to say, I'm a little spoiled on the restaurant front. So far, I've been happy with the direction that Phx restaurants are taking and I really enjoyed Federal Pizza.  A friend and I visited this weekend and we had the burrata appetizer and the Big Red pizza. Both were amazingly good. They had a great selection of local and craft beers and a good wine list. We didn't have dessert b/c we were full, but I certainly would like to try some of what they had on the menu.  They are down a star for one reason - OPEN TABLE - heard of it? For pete's sake TAKE F%#@ING RESERVATIONS, at least on the weekends. It's super good food and people are going to go there. It would be so much easier if one didn't have to wait 1.5 hours to get in. It takes the pressure off you guys. If I've been waiting for hours, it had better be some flipping good pizza. Reservations. Take them. We'll all be happier.

I knew seeing the picture of the pizza i was already going to like it. This place is amazing and on top of it they have a drive thru! Ugh yesss! The place is cozy inside and the food smells wonderful! The service is a little bit off though i feel like they are too comfortable where it takes away from the good service. I dont mind being called sister or girlfriend but if i was on a date or a more formal meeting i dont think that would be ohk.. But all in all the food was amazing! Im craving it again today and i just had it last night! Hate to say it but i ate the whole pizza to myself..

This place was so amazing! It is literally the 1st time...although both delicious...I like the crust more than the pizza. Light and fluffy while still being crispy..if that makes any sense. Coming from a true pizza snob...this place is legit. I don't know how I got so lucky to only pay $10.50 for a personal sized serving and a blue cheese and bacon wedge salad. Also had the polenta sticks that were out of this world good. This place is nestled in the cutest area of central Phoenix surrounded by beautiful trees and open windows. It's in an area with other super cool and modern restaurants. Perfect destination for a Sunday brunch!

I heard so many great things about this place! So when Joycie said she was going to have her birthday here, I was ecstatic!   Apparently they don't take reservations on Saturday so most of her party got there around 6:40 so we could get a table by 7. Well that didn't happen. We were seated around 8 at TWO different tables because they said they couldn't put two tables together because of some lame excuse. At this point, we just wanted to eat.   Onto the food! I got the margherita pizza. I didn't like it. The pizza tasted like feet. The only reason I even ate as much as I did was because I was starving. However, everyone else seemed to enjoy their food.   Service was eh. Could have been better. The prices are pretty good.   I was expecting so much more from here since I love the upward project restaurants.

My mom watches a lot of Food Network. Why does that matter? Because any time I want to have a food adventure, she's down. I call her up, say we're going to a new pizza place, and it's go time.  We came here at that weird period on a weekday between lunch and dinner, so there was literally only one other customer in the restaurant. Nice! Where I used to feel awkward being in a mostly empty establishment, I've learned there are some great things about it.  1) I can check the place out without people being all up in my way. First impression is this place is aesthetically pleasing, and there's quite a bit of attention to detail. I can see why "hipsters" are drawn here. More importantly, everything looked shiny and clean.  2) I get to see how the the place runs when everyone's not "on." You know what I mean. Things are different when it isn't showtime.   Though I'm not a big meat-eater, we went for the meatball trio and the side of beets to start.   The meatballs were awesome, flavorful, and the perfect texture, and the marinara was right on. The real star of the dish was the polenta, with a perfect crunch on the outside and creamy inside. There was a bit of fork-shoving to get the last of it.  Beets and pears are a great combination, but we both felt like it was lacking something until we snagged a bottle of balsamic vinegar.   For the pizza we shared the margherita with added roasted garlic (our server's favorite as well, what a coinkidink!). The crust was unlike any I've had before. Not at all chewy, light and airy with a nice crispiness without being like a cracker. I really enjoyed it.  I would have loved to try the wine coolers, but $8? Come on.  After all that goodness, I didn't have room to try the cobbler. The great news is, they have a drive-thru, so I'll get my chance!

Phoenix is lowkey one of the best places In America for good pizza. I've already got a half-dozen exceptional, go-to places throughout the valley, and every time I think the market might be saturated, I make my way into a new parlor that shows me we've still got ground to cover. A lot of the time, when I am going to enjoy a gourmet pizza, I want something that's 'super duper Italian' with imported everything, and crust made with Old World secrets.   Federal Pizza isn't trying to be like that. It's going its own way, and doing a fantastic job.   Ingredients are unique, and to an extent locally sourced. My friend and I split the Manifesto, with generous portions of Schreiner's sausage as well as goat cheese. On the side, we had polenta sticks. I thought these were strange, but with the dipping sauce they came with, I couldn't stop reaching for them! I must also note these pizzas are deceptively heavy, so splitting a pie and an app with a friend is not only reasonable, but surprisingly affordable.  You will be amazed at how low your bill will be as you leave satisfied.   You will be enchanted by the swift, friendly service.   And if you're like me, you're going to leave a little extra happy after seeing the small but legit beer selection.   tl;dr If you like pizza, get in here ASAP.

Nice neighborhood hang out. Only wish they had HH foods and a HH that lasted past 5pm so that those who work could attend. I really love meat loaf so I ordered that for dinner. It did not resemble meatloaf at all nor did it taste the same.  You know the taste the flavored bread crumbs adds to it.  It was more like a hamburger that fell apart. Or maybe if they called it Salisbury steak it would be more appropriate. The employees were just great as was the pitcher of beer. Due to this I will give it 4 stars. I MAY try the pizza nest time although I am a pizza snob and in my 25+ years in Phoenix have found only 1 place that makes Sicilian Pizza just like in The Big Apple. So I am not too sure that I will return here

I came here once before and thought it was good so I decided to try it out again. I brought my friend with me and we ordered half margherita pizza and half Casanova. It's my fault for not reading the menu carefully when I ordered these two because they turned out to be white pizza. The margherita pizza looked like it wasn't freshly cooked and they just threw couple pieces of basil and tomatoes on it. When I took a bite out of it, I wasn't very pleased with it. It basically tasted what it looked like, which was mostly dough lol. The other pizza tasted plain too, but once I bit the date, it tasted better. The dates had a sweet taste to it which balanced out nicely with the prosciutto. Overall, the food wasn't so great this time, but the Service was.

Pizza: Really creative combinations, all of which are good. My favorites are Sweet Potato (sweet potato, sage, and ricotta) and Cassanova (dates, prosciutto, ricotta). Even the Brussels Sprout (roasted in balsamic + garlic) is tasty. Order one per person.   Drink: Solid and cheap beer selection. Never had wine here, but they've got a lengthy list.   Service: Friendly hipster service staff.   Ambiance: Pretty standard stuff. More a restaurant than a pizzeria. The outside patio is right on Central and so a bit loud.   Price: Beer=cheap. Pizzas about $12-14 each.   Bottom line: Highly recommended.

This place is hopping and has quite the reputation for their pizza so I was excited to give it a whirl. My friend and I decided to find the best pizza places in town over the course of a week (we worked out a lot that week), and Federal Pizza was on our list to try. It was crowded when we came, but we valeted the car and snagged a couple spots at the bar right away, so there was no wait! Sitting at the bar isn't usually my favorite place to be, but it was quite entertaining because we got to watch the guys make the pizza and they gave us the inside scoop on what to order and what to drink.   We decided to order the Casanova pizza, Manifesto pizza, and the Caesar salad. We also indulged in a couple blueberry hibiscus wine coolers. The pizza took a while to come out, but they were very busy and it is nice to know you are getting freshly made pizza straight from the oven. The salad was good, but nothing to write home about, and the drinks were just so so. When the pizza finally did come we dug right in! The Casanova was fantastic; prosciutto, dates, and ricotta go together so well! The manifesto was pretty good, but not our favorite. Overall we enjoyed this trendy pizza spot, but it wasn't the best that we tried that week. For me it is all in the dough, and this dough was lacking that wow flavor that is worthy of 5 stars. If we are in the area and craving pizza we will stop in again, but we both agreed we probably won't go out of our way to come here. The atmosphere is crowded and loud, so picking up pizza to go might be a better way to go.

I love postinos.  I love Windsor.  I love Churn. I knew I would love Federal. What I did not expect was for it to introduce me to my absolute favorite pizza in the world.   The aptly named Casanova stole my heart. As I read through the list of pies all sounded good, but the Casanova was a notch above the rest.  Its description read like a really alluring internet dating profile.  Prosciutto, dates and ricotta might as well have read well educated, good family, great smile, arugula was just icing on the cake, like having the same favorite band.  I was sold.   We all know a well written e-harmony profile does not insure success.  What looks great on paper does not necessarily equate to that special spark.  I nervously waited for my pizza, hoping it would be everything I hoped for.  Meanwhile I enjoyed a wine cooler. Not the "hey look guys, I totally scored us some booze" Bartles & Jaymes wine coolers of my teenage years, no these were more sophisticated and much tastier. I went with the raspberry lavender and was very pleased.  17 year old me was soo jelly. Then he arrived.  On time, dressed neatly.  I coyly eyed him before grabbing a slice, then dove right in. People, the sparks were there.  Love exists, it's real.  The Casanova was everything I had dreamed of.   I don't want to get to ahead of myself, but I for-see a long and happy relationship.

This place is on point! They have awesome almost close to New York Pizza which was the debate at the table.  Service was attentive. Only down side was they only have beer and wine. Which for me being a beer guy was on point since they make their own beer.  However my girl wanted a mixer and they don't have that so she went beer classic also.  Definitely check it out and very reasonably priced.

Little Gem Caesar . . . perfect for two to share.  Big Star pizza . . . so good!  Loved the decor!  Beer, food and tip came to just under $40.  LOVED this place!  Nice feel on the inside and out.  Great decor.  Candles were such a nice touch.  Loved sitting at the bar.  Bartender and server were very pleasant.  Music was loud but just loud enough (you could still have a conversation).  Best part is it's in my neighborhood.  Welcome to the neighborhood Federal Pizza.  I can't wait to go back!

Service was so so... Pizza was 6.5/10.... Spaghetti was under cooked.... Beer was ...... The $5 Coors light bottle was cold.... But the meatballs were good.... Wouldn't eat there regularly if I lived here in town... Just ok...

They have great specials without compromising quality. I had a delicious lunch. The place has a great vibe to it. Our server Angel was fantastic! He took great care of us and was very knowledgeable about their wine selection. Look forward to coming here again!

I was there last Friday for an early dinner. The food was very good. The reason I am giving it 1 star is for the service. The woman who dropped our pizza off seemed irritated and was very rude. Bad service is something that irks me when I'm dinning out.
Lunch was amazing! Service outstanding! Food was incredible!  We sat outside and had the half-pizza/salad combo. WOW! Fresh, tasty and fast.

Federal Pizza is in a fantastic location, right next to Joyride (good Mexican) and Postino's wine bar, on Central just south of Camelback. Had the CASTELVETRANO OLIVES as appetizer to share and they were crisp and flavorful. For main course, the sweet potato pizza is definitely unique and tasty if you like sweet potato. If not, I've also had the At Last pizza and was not disappointed. What makes a good pizza in my opinion is the crust, and the crust has the oven fired taste. It's somewhat crispy, thin, and has an authentic Italian taste. Honestly, at Federal you are mainly there for the trendy environment and experience. Sit outside on the patio and enjoy some wine. Great location.

I'm sitting in my car waiting for a pizza that was promised 15 minutes ago.  Hope it's good because a second chance is unlikely.  Called 45 minutes ahead for a good 'za to take home for movie night, waited until they told me it would be ready and here I sit. The pizza finally comes with appropriate apologies. Can't argue about the quality of the pie: Schreiner's sausage, tasty mushrooms, MJ crust  - all good - but it's a pizza.  You shouldn't have to wait at the pickup window longer than it takes to make the pizza from scratch.   Even the best food tastes bitter after a bad experience with service.

When in doubt- choose federal. They are extremely accommodating- I've called in lunch orders at opening and they have them ready for me at the drive through in 20 minutes, they seat large groups, and their servers are genuinely friendly and attentive. I love sitting out on the patio and enjoying their music playlist. They need to publish their pandora station because it never fails.   I have yet to eat a pizza here I don't like. The Casanova is my personal favorite with prosciutto, dates, ricotta cheese and sauce. The perfect savory sweet combination. The manifesto, the answer, the sweet potato and even the Brussel sprout pizzas won't let you down! On their menu they also let you know what drink pairs well with it.   I would suggest sticking to their pizza. When I saw the warm donuts and chocolate sauce on the dessert menu, I was practically drooling on my pizza, but I was not overwhelmed by the dessert when I tried it. The donuts were a little airy and not very flavorful.

No need to add to the raves about the food, but I wanted to speak up about the great service we got last night at Federal. It was a Friday night and we had reservations for 5 people at 7pm.   We only had one of our party there by 7, and they seated him without giving him any pushback about needing the whole party there. Three more of us arrived by 7:30,and the last person was there by 8. Not once did anyone give us trouble about monopolozing a table, and they even let the last person order her pizza when she arrived.   The dinner was a going-away celebration for a very good friend who has had a very rough time lately, and it was a much-needed send-off for all of us.   Thanks, FP, for recognizing that we are going to spend money at your establishment even if we're a little late. Sometimes planes don't arrive on time, trucks don't get packed as quickly as we intend, and emotions run high when you're picking up your life and moving across the country. Thanks for helping us relax at the end of a hard day.

We visited on a Friday for lunch. We were seated right away. I ordered the "Double Down" lunch deal, where I got to choose half a pizza and a half-salad or soup. I ordered the half Casanova and chicken panzanella salad, and an apple spice wine cooler. The drink was delicious, like a really fresh apple cider. I liked the dough of the pizza--good, chewy, with bubbles in the crust, but I have had better. I enjoyed the sweet combination of toppings, and the softness of the hot ricotta was divine. The salad was good but had only two chunks of fresh mozzarella (mind you, those were tasty chunks). My husband had a full meatball pizza, which he liked but didn't think it was the best around. I tried a slice, and I agreed--it wasn't bad by any means, but it didn't have a zing to it, either. He had two Epicenter beers.  The service was an issue, too. Our server was MIA most of the time. All the other servers would pass by, see us looking around, and tend to us. Our server would then show up and see everything was taken care of and go to the opposite side of the dining room again. We were grateful that the rest of the staff was attentive!  We don't go to downtown Phoenix very often and there are a lot of choices there. While we liked Federal Pizza, I doubt we'll make a return visit.
Great Pizza, Great service. A bit pricey, but oh boy it's worth it!

Came back again for another try of their pizza, this time with the Manifesto. Goat cheese, sausage, fennel and mushrooms - oh my! So yummy, baked well and the goat cheese gives it that slight, bright tartness to liven the pizza up. This time around, there was no beer to be ordered but I had a craving for a Strawberry Lemonade for the hot night ... unfortunately Jared said they don't do Strawberry Lemonade but they do fresh squeezed lemonade and actually recommended they could do a muddled Strawberry Rhubarb puree added to the lemonade since thats what they have at the bar. Absolutely perfect, tangy, refreshing and damn that was brilliant. I got to try the Strawberry Rhubarb wine cooler and woo, those these are strong and tasty.  It's always a pleasuring dining in here and having Jared as our server! Can't wait to be back for Happy Hour.
Great service, good pizza, fair prices. Awesome deals going on during weekdays. Make sure you try the wine, it's delicious, or you can sample before you buy. Friendly service.
If you dine here, dine on the patio. The ambience is quaint and comfortable. The pizza is different, but in a good way. The brussel sprout pizza is the absolute shiz.

They are now doing $20 night here Monday's and Tuesday's after 8!  This is a legendary deal at Postino, and I like it even better here at Federal because they have a drivethru!  I sped right thru the first time not seeing the actual drivethru, but the gal was nice enough to open the sliding door during my second pass so I could see that I was in the right place.  The $20 will get you any bottle of their wines also served by the glass, and any pizza.  They have a great wine selection (a lot of the same as Postis) so I stuck with my summer jam which is always the Ca Del Sarto pinot grigio, crisp and refreshing in this heat, and tried the Big Star pizza which I worried would be a little busy but was really well done!  I learned a little trick when doing take out pizza - I put about 4 slices in a pan on the stove set over medium low heat while I open the wine and prepare a salad accompaniment.  This really makes the pizza crisp up, and you get to have it nice and hot at your convenience.  I foresee never cooking again on Mondays.

This place is like walking back in time. Great service , Great food and cute art decor.    I always get the spaghetti and meatballs which you think won't be good but its to die for. The margarita pizza is the best.

First, I want to say I love trying different pizza. I'd say I have experience. If I could give 10 stars for service alone, I would! My cup never went empty. Dishes never piled up on the table. Everyone who works here looks out for each other's tables. I'm soooo beyond impressed. It's busy too and you would never notice because the service is flawless.                                Next is the food. The pizza crust is soft and tastes like perfection. I can taste all the flavors the pizza has to offer. Not too cheesy..just enough sauce. What can I say?? I'll be back!! Prices are good too. $13 for 12in pizza that tastes so incredibly good.                   They also have a drive threw for those who don't want the dine in experience.

Maybe I come here too much. For instance, I know that it is exactly 367 steps from my door to Federal's. But the pizza is just so good, it's hard to not want to go everyday! My favorite pizzas are the Big Star and Margarita. The brussel sprouts are also amazing. I went with a group one day, including one small child, and even he liked the brussel sprouts! If that's not a testament to how good they are, I don't know what is.  They also have the same great happy hour as Windsor/Postino, with the addition of house-made wine coolers and beer growlers to go. $15 to buy the growler, but only $10 to get it filled. If you're in the mood for dessert, definitely get the donut holes with chocolate sauce. I'm not a big chocolate person, but I find myself covering the donuts with it.  As much as I like Federal, I have had a couple of disappointments. I tried the ravioli one night and they were very bland. I also got the wedge salad to go, and it seemed like it was mostly "wedge" without many toppings.  While there may be some misses at Federal, I will definitely keep coming back for the pizza.
This place is soooooo yummy! I've had pizza, salads and dessert and it's all awesome!
Not your average pepperoni place.  Their flavor combinations are so refreshing.  Great prices,  great service,  great beer,  great prices.  I'll certainly be back.
Very pleased with federal pizza! The environment is excellent and the service was great as well. We ordered a bottle of wine and pizza... Loved the pizza!!!

I freakin love this restaurant! However, let me make myself clear my Love of Federal pizza does not stem from any kind of stupendous customer service experience I have had at the restaurant. In fact I love, going here so much exactly because my experiences with their customer service are so hilariously bad. Let me attempt to explain my oxymoronic explanation of my relationship with Federal Pizza. This restaurant does not have bad customer service on purpose like one of those restaurants that are rude to you on purpose. In fact the wait staff does not seem to have an attitude problem at all and they have always seemed very pleasant. The problem appears to either be a problem with the culture at the restaurant or with their management. Every time I have eaten here I have had to have a meal comped, receiving a voucher for a future meal comp, or redeeming a meal comp because they can never get my order right. Even one time when I came in to redeem a meal comp for a free entree, the waitress forgot to put in my order and it took nearly and hour and a half to get my food! And because the waitress sucked so bad she had to give me 2 more freebees for future visits! This is why I love getting such bad service, because when this happens they feed me for free! Over the past several months eating at Federal has been a huge cution to my budget. I swear to god I make more money eating at this restaurant than I have actually spent here. In the past 3 times I have eaten here I think I have only had to spend $3 when I went in today because my drink was not covered on one of the vouchers they gave me. But even when I went in today the bartender freakin walked off the bar leaving me with nobody to refill my drink or give me my check. Another waitress eventually came over and took care of it but she was acting overwhelmed. Bottom line I will eat here for free and put up with the shitty customer service. The food is good so I don't mind having to wait for it. I just have to make sure when I go in that I don't have any other plans for the day, because I practically spend all afternoon there. Also, every time I  have go there I go by myself. I would be embarrassed to take a date to this place because most of the time I go in they treat me like I am not even there. Anyway: Federal Pizza thanks for feeding me for the past couple of months. But seriously WTF is wrong with you people. Don't your servers live on tips? Don't you have to make a profit off of people who come to your restaurant. Like seriously you people need to get your shit together. Then again, I will gladly continue eating at your restaurant for free in return by being ignored by your wait staff. LMAO.

Federal Pizza is one of our favorite restaurants in downtown Phoenix. Service is always good, super friendly staff. You must try the crispy polenta. It's a must every visit.   Everything we've tried has been tasty, but the Casanova Pizza is my all time favorite main on the menu. The only downside is the parking. We've driven downtown a few times and just left to go elsewhere because there is simply nowhere to park on the weekend.   This is a favorite for a girls night out or happy hour, preferably Mon-Thurs. Heads up that it's beer and wine only.

I was excited to go to this place after reading all the great reviews but was super disappointed...  First the ambiance is cute and the waitress was attentive. But the food didn't stack up.   We ordered the arancini (rice balls) and polenta fries for appetizers. The polenta fingers were solid but had too much of the batter around them. The arancini has cilantro inside!  Ewwww. I am a cilantro hater so that was deadly.   For dinner we ordered the meatball pizza and lamb bolognese. The bolognese was super, super gamey and they serve it with the wrong kind of pasta. The sauce doesn't cling well to it so you get blandish pasta and then a pile of sauce next to it. Not tasty.   The pizza was ok but nothing compared to a place like Pizzeria Bianca. Not even the same league.   We were so disappointed we decided to go someplace else for dessert...

We were greeted friendly enough. Seated at a raised booth right by the Server Station. I thought it was strange that asking us IF we wanted water or not was such a production? I mean, you would think Federal's tap water was from the Fountain of Youth the way it was presented to us with such FLOURISH as if this was a gift from the Gods?! Place was nearly empty save for a couple of tables occupied, a completely empty bar, and some tables outside claimed by families with kids. No reason for more employees than customers in the place to be running around acting like chickens with their heads cut off scrambling erratically about the place like ants on an ant hill? I even asked our server Nancy, what's with all the commotion and the shouting back and forth to each other? I wondered if there was an entire other side of the restaurant I was missing? No. Just keeping up appearances. If they look like they're hustling, then it must be a hip, trendy, fashionable place to dine, right? Wrong. Service was lackluster. Slow. Long intermissions between visiting our table periodically if for no other reason, than to check on things? Prices are outrageous for what you get. Food is meh. Just okay. Nothing to write home to Mom about. I asked for a taste test of two beers which took forever to deliver. Placed our food order, which also took forever on a very slow day, mid-afternoon? Ordered Double-Down half-pizza and wedge salad thinking this was the least expensive thing on the menu at $10.50 for 6 inches. Of pizza. I kid you not. It was 4 pitiful cracker-size triangles of a whole lot of crust, a scant amount of tomato sauce that tasted like Chef Boyardee from a can, and the thinnest possible trace of cheese and exactly ONE (1) pepperoni per triangle. Want fresh Parmesan? OH! This requires a big production too!! Think how special you're going to feel when they shred it over your 6 inches. Of Pizza. For you? How very chic. Tell ya what. I can shake my own parmesan out of a jar. I don't require this. It's just for SHOW! Anticipating a WEDGE salad, (it's in the description folks?! Should be a no-brainer?!) Instead I got what added up to no more than a stalk/rib/root of a head of salad with a whisper of dressing, exactly ONE (1) not TWO, tee-tiny little cherry tomato for a garnish, nary a scant trace of Gorgonzola cubes (I tasted two) and i think there may have been a bacon bit in there somewhere. The lettuce leaf wasn't even enough to serve as a fig leaf. For extra fun, it wasn't served separately or before your pizza, like a first-course? It was placed on a tin pie plate alongside a hot pizza on a thin layer of wax paper. So I had warm salad. I took advantage of...(Or did they take advantage of me for ordering it?), a half-glass of Holly something or other Chardonnay. Of course, this had to be delivered by the bartender who had to demonstrate his talents by pouring my wine for me from a cute little wine decanter to let it breathe first, and then into my glass with such flourish and dramatic interpretation. I have gotten more wine out of a Dixie Cup. To add insult to injury, Nancy never returned to our table until she delivered our food. And then never returned again until it was time to collect the check. I had accidentally dropped a knife on the floor, hoping that Nancy would return so I could ask her for another one, to cut my 1 or 2 leafs of bib lettuce from their root stalks which made up most of the so-called "Wedge" salad?! But she never did. So, I went without and used a fork. For extra fun, one employee shouted "HEY" to another employee right.over.my.shoulder and into my left ear, and the other employee shouted back at him his response at the same or higher volume into my right ear while I was trying to enjoy my morsel of food. I noticed this goes on a lot here. Employees shouting back and forth to each other. I am sure this is by design. It's an ill-attempt of the owner to train his staff into pretending like they are in an authentic Italian Restaurant, where there's a lot of arm-waving, and shouting at the top of one's lungs, to make it seem like the customer is all part of the action!! What a joke! So transparent what they are trying to do here. It's all one big Grand Illusion. ALL THIS FOR $35 for 2 people for lunch. Not including a tip just because I am that generous of a person and don't like to be perceived as a cheapskate. I will never, ever return again. And recommend to anyone who does not consider themselves one of the thousands of Suckers born every minute, to RUN, don't walk away from visiting Federal Pizza. Complete RIP-OFF!!

A new pizza place in a historic bank building. A Savings and Loan that most likely Charles Keating and the Keating Five put out of business. And to wash down those wood-fired pizzas from Master Baker MJ Coe, small-batch craft beers, custom growlers and fine wine.  It is the work of restaurateurs Craig DeMarco, wife Kris DeMarco, and Lauren and Wyatt Bailey in business as Federal Pizza, Postino and Windsor & Churn.  Here's what we know.  Located in the historic Al Beadle building, which originally housed the First Federal Savings & Loan Bank, which inspired the restaurant's name, Federal Pizza will serve up sharable starters, salads, sandwiches and wood-fired pizzas.  Federal will offer a seasonal and progressive wine list, small-batch craft beer selections, and custom growlers for to-go orders. Keep in mind you can order a pizza at home, drive through, grab the pizza and fill up your growler of two sizes and drive away without anyone seeing you in your supersexy PJ's. A first in Phoenix. Expect this feature in December.  Today I had a chat with Robert and Megan. Two hard working and very pleseant hotties behind the bar. I ordered up a pitcher of Lost Abbey Ale.
